books.name: Genesis
books.description: The book of beginnings - creation, fall, flood, and the patriarchs
books.author: Moses

chaptersContent.title: The Creation of the World
chaptersContent.summary: God creates the heavens and the earth in six days and rests on the seventh
chaptersContent.content: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth. The earth was without form and void, and darkness was over the face of the deep. And the Spirit of God was hovering over the face of the waters. And God said, 'Let there be light,' and there was light.

chaptersContent.title: The Garden of Eden
chaptersContent.summary: God forms man from dust, creates the Garden of Eden, and makes woman
chaptersContent.content: Then the Lord God formed the man of dust from the ground and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life, and the man became a living creature. And the Lord God planted a garden in Eden, in the east, and there he put the man whom he had formed.

chaptersContent.title: The Fall
chaptersContent.summary: Adam and Eve disobey God, sin enters the world, and they are expelled from Eden
chaptersContent.content: So when the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was to be desired to make one wise, she took of its fruit and ate, and she also gave some to her husband who was with her, and he ate.

chaptersContent.title: Cain and Abel
chaptersContent.summary: The first murder occurs when Cain kills his brother Abel out of jealousy
chaptersContent.content: And Abel also brought of the firstborn of his flock and of their fat portions. And the Lord had regard for Abel and his offering, but for Cain and his offering he had no regard.

chaptersContent.title: The Genealogy of Adam
chaptersContent.summary: The genealogy from Adam to Noah showing the long lives of the patriarchs
chaptersContent.content: This is the book of the generations of Adam. When God created man, he made him in the likeness of God. Male and female he created them, and he blessed them and named them Man when they were created.

chaptersContent.title: Noah and the Flood
chaptersContent.summary: God calls Noah to build an ark to save humanity and animals from the flood
chaptersContent.content: But Noah found favor in the eyes of the Lord. These are the generations of Noah. Noah was a righteous man, blameless in his generation. Noah walked with God.

chaptersContent.title: The Flood Begins
chaptersContent.summary: The flood waters cover the earth and Noah's family enters the ark
chaptersContent.content: Then the Lord said to Noah, 'Go into the ark, you and all your household, for I have seen that you are righteous before me in this generation.' And Noah did all that the Lord had commanded him.

chaptersContent.title: The Flood Subsides
chaptersContent.summary: The flood waters recede and Noah sends out birds to find dry land
chaptersContent.content: But God remembered Noah and all the beasts and all the livestock that were with him in the ark. And God made a wind blow over the earth, and the waters subsided. While the earth remains, seedtime and harvest, cold and heat, summer and winter, day and night, shall not cease.

chaptersContent.title: God's Covenant with Noah
chaptersContent.summary: God establishes a covenant with Noah and all living creatures
chaptersContent.content: And God blessed Noah and his sons and said to them, 'Be fruitful and multiply and fill the earth. I have set my bow in the cloud, and it shall be a sign of the covenant between me and the earth.'

chaptersContent.title: The Table of Nations
chaptersContent.summary: Genealogy of Noah's sons and the spread of nations across the earth
chaptersContent.content: These are the generations of the sons of Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Sons were born to them after the flood. From these the nations spread abroad on the earth after the flood.

chaptersContent.title: The Tower of Babel
chaptersContent.summary: Humanity builds a tower to reach heaven, God confuses their language
chaptersContent.content: Then they said, 'Come, let us build ourselves a city and a tower with its top in the heavens, and let us make a name for ourselves, lest we be dispersed over the face of the whole earth.' And the Lord said, 'Behold, they are one people, and they have all one language.'

chaptersContent.title: The Call of Abraham
chaptersContent.summary: God calls Abram to leave his country and promises to make him a great nation
chaptersContent.content: Now the Lord said to Abram, 'Go from your country and your kindred and your father's house to the land that I will show you. And I will make of you a great nation, and I will bless you and make your name great, so that you will be a blessing.'

chaptersContent.title: Abram and Lot Separate
chaptersContent.summary: Abram and Lot separate due to their herds, Lot chooses the Jordan Valley
chaptersContent.content: Then Abram said to Lot, 'Let there be no strife between you and me, and between your herdsmen and my herdsmen, for we are kinsmen. Is not the whole land before you? Separate yourself from me. If you take the left hand, then I will go to the right.'

chaptersContent.title: Abram Rescues Lot
chaptersContent.summary: Abram rescues Lot from captivity and meets Melchizedek
chaptersContent.content: When Abram heard that his kinsman had been taken captive, he led forth his trained men, born in his house, 318, and went in pursuit as far as Dan. And Melchizedek king of Salem brought out bread and wine. He was priest of God Most High.

chaptersContent.title: God's Covenant with Abram
chaptersContent.summary: God makes a covenant with Abram and promises him descendants
chaptersContent.content: After these things the word of the Lord came to Abram in a vision: 'Fear not, Abram, I am your shield; your reward shall be very great.' And he believed the Lord, and he counted it to him as righteousness.

chaptersContent.title: Hagar and Ishmael
chaptersContent.summary: Sarai gives Hagar to Abram, Hagar conceives Ishmael
chaptersContent.content: Now Sarai, Abram's wife, had borne him no children. She had a female Egyptian servant whose name was Hagar. And Sarai said to Abram, 'Behold now, the Lord has prevented me from bearing children. Go in to my servant; it may be that I shall obtain children by her.'

chaptersContent.title: The Covenant of Circumcision
chaptersContent.summary: God establishes the covenant of circumcision and changes Abram's name
chaptersContent.content: When Abram was ninety-nine years old the Lord appeared to Abram and said to him, 'I am God Almighty; walk before me, and be blameless. No longer shall your name be called Abram, but your name shall be Abraham, for I have made you the father of a multitude of nations.'

chaptersContent.title: The Three Visitors
chaptersContent.summary: Three visitors announce Isaac's birth and God's judgment on Sodom
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord appeared to him by the oaks of Mamre, as he sat at the door of his tent in the heat of the day. The Lord said, 'I will surely return to you about this time next year, and Sarah your wife shall have a son.'

chaptersContent.title: Sodom and Gomorrah
chaptersContent.summary: God destroys Sodom and Gomorrah, Lot and his family escape
chaptersContent.content: The two angels came to Sodom in the evening, and Lot was sitting in the gate of Sodom. When Lot saw them, he rose to meet them and bowed himself with his face to the earth. Then the Lord rained on Sodom and Gomorrah sulfur and fire from the Lord out of heaven.

chaptersContent.title: Abraham and Abimelech
chaptersContent.summary: Abraham lies about Sarah, God protects her from Abimelech
chaptersContent.content: And Abraham said of Sarah his wife, 'She is my sister.' And Abimelech king of Gerar sent and took Sarah. But God came to Abimelech in a dream by night and said to him, 'Behold, you are a dead man because of the woman whom you have taken.'

chaptersContent.title: The Birth of Isaac
chaptersContent.summary: Isaac is born, Hagar and Ishmael are sent away
chaptersContent.content: The Lord visited Sarah as he had said, and the Lord did to Sarah what he had promised. And Sarah conceived and bore Abraham a son in his old age at the time of which God had spoken to him. And Sarah said, 'God has made me laugh, and all who hear will laugh with me.'

chaptersContent.title: The Sacrifice of Isaac
chaptersContent.summary: God tests Abraham's faith by asking him to sacrifice his son Isaac
chaptersContent.content: He said, 'Take your son, your only son Isaac, whom you love, and go to the land of Moriah, and offer him there as a burnt offering on one of the mountains of which I shall tell you.'

chaptersContent.title: Sarah's Death and Burial
chaptersContent.summary: Sarah dies and Abraham purchases a burial place for her
chaptersContent.content: And Sarah died at Kiriath-arba (that is, Hebron) in the land of Canaan, and Abraham went in to mourn for Sarah and to weep for her. And Abraham rose up from before his dead and said to the Hittites, 'I am a sojourner and foreigner among you.'

chaptersContent.title: Isaac and Rebekah
chaptersContent.summary: Abraham's servant finds Rebekah to be Isaac's wife
chaptersContent.content: I will make you swear by the Lord, the God of heaven and God of the earth, that you will not take a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites, among whom I dwell, but will go to my country and to my kindred, and take a wife for my son Isaac.

chaptersContent.title: Abraham's Death and Isaac's Sons
chaptersContent.summary: Abraham dies, Isaac's wife Rebekah gives birth to twins
chaptersContent.content: Abraham breathed his last and died in a good old age, an old man and full of years, and was gathered to his people. And the Lord said to her, 'Two nations are in your womb, and two peoples from within you shall be divided.'

chaptersContent.title: Isaac and Abimelech
chaptersContent.summary: Isaac dwells in Gerar, God blesses him with prosperity
chaptersContent.content: Sojourn in this land, and I will be with you and will bless you, for to you and to your offspring I will give all these lands, and I will establish the oath that I swore to Abraham your father. And Isaac sowed in that land and reaped in the same year a hundredfold.

chaptersContent.title: Jacob Steals Esau's Blessing
chaptersContent.summary: Rebekah helps Jacob deceive Isaac to receive Esau's blessing
chaptersContent.content: Jacob said to his father, 'I am Esau your firstborn. I have done as you told me; now sit up and eat of my game, that your soul may bless me.' And he came near and kissed him. And Isaac smelled the smell of his garments and blessed him.

chaptersContent.title: Jacob's Dream at Bethel
chaptersContent.summary: Jacob dreams of a ladder to heaven and God's promise to him
chaptersContent.content: And he dreamed, and behold, there was a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven. And behold, the angels of God were ascending and descending on it! And behold, I am with you and will keep you wherever you go.

chaptersContent.title: Jacob and Rachel
chaptersContent.summary: Jacob works for Laban to marry Rachel, but receives Leah first
chaptersContent.content: Jacob loved Rachel. And he said, 'I will serve you seven years for your younger daughter Rachel.' In the morning, behold, it was Leah! And Jacob said to Laban, 'What is this you have done to me? Did I not serve with you for Rachel?'

chaptersContent.title: Jacob's Children
chaptersContent.summary: Jacob's wives compete to bear children, Jacob becomes wealthy
chaptersContent.content: Then God remembered Rachel, and God listened to her and opened her womb. She conceived and bore a son, and said, 'God has taken away my reproach.' And the man increased greatly and had large flocks, female servants and male servants, and camels and donkeys.

chaptersContent.title: Jacob Flees from Laban
chaptersContent.summary: Jacob flees from Laban with his family and flocks
chaptersContent.content: Then the Lord said to Jacob, 'Return to the land of your fathers and to your kindred, and I will be with you.' And Jacob said to his wives, 'I see that your father does not regard me with favor as he did before. But the God of my father has been with me.'

chaptersContent.title: Jacob Wrestles with God
chaptersContent.summary: Jacob wrestles with a man and receives a new name
chaptersContent.content: And Jacob was left alone. And a man wrestled with him until the breaking of the day. Then he said, 'Let me go, for the day has broken.' But Jacob said, 'I will not let you go unless you bless me.'

chaptersContent.title: Jacob Meets Esau
chaptersContent.summary: Jacob and Esau reconcile after many years of separation
chaptersContent.content: But Esau ran to meet him and embraced him and fell on his neck and kissed him, and they wept. And Jacob said, 'No, please, if I have found favor in your sight, then accept my present from my hand.'

chaptersContent.title: The Rape of Dinah
chaptersContent.summary: Dinah is violated, her brothers take revenge on Shechem
chaptersContent.content: Now Dinah the daughter of Leah, whom she had borne to Jacob, went out to see the women of the land. And when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, the prince of the land, saw her, he seized her and lay with her and humiliated her.

chaptersContent.title: Jacob Returns to Bethel
chaptersContent.summary: Jacob returns to Bethel, Rachel dies giving birth to Benjamin
chaptersContent.content: God said to Jacob, 'Arise, go up to Bethel and dwell there. Make an altar there to the God who appeared to you when you fled from your brother Esau.' And God said to him, 'Your name is Jacob; no longer shall your name be called Jacob, but Israel shall be your name.'

chaptersContent.title: Esau's Descendants
chaptersContent.summary: Genealogy of Esau and the Edomites
chaptersContent.content: These are the generations of Esau (that is, Edom). Esau took his wives from the Canaanites: Adah the daughter of Elon the Hittite, Oholibamah the daughter of Anah the daughter of Zibeon the Hivite. Thus Esau settled in the hill country of Seir.

chaptersContent.title: Joseph's Dreams
chaptersContent.summary: Joseph has dreams of ruling over his brothers, they sell him into slavery
chaptersContent.content: Now Joseph had a dream, and when he told it to his brothers they hated him even more. And they said to him, 'Shall you indeed reign over us? Or shall you indeed have dominion over us?' So they hated him even more for his dreams and for his words.

chaptersContent.title: Judah and Tamar
chaptersContent.summary: Judah's sons die, Tamar deceives him to bear children
chaptersContent.content: Then Judah acknowledged them and said, 'She is more righteous than I, since I did not give her to my son Shelah.' And he did not know her again. When the time of her labor came, there were twins in her womb.

chaptersContent.title: Joseph in Potiphar's House
chaptersContent.summary: Joseph serves Potiphar but is falsely accused and imprisoned
chaptersContent.content: The Lord was with Joseph, and he became a successful man, and he was in the house of his Egyptian master. But he refused and said to his master's wife, 'Behold, because of me my master has no concern about anything in the house.'

chaptersContent.title: Joseph Interprets Dreams
chaptersContent.summary: Joseph interprets dreams for Pharaoh's cupbearer and baker
chaptersContent.content: They said to him, 'We have had dreams, and there is no one to interpret them.' And Joseph said to them, 'Do not interpretations belong to God? Please tell them to me.' Yet the chief cupbearer did not remember Joseph, but forgot him.

chaptersContent.title: Joseph's Rise to Power
chaptersContent.summary: Joseph interprets Pharaoh's dreams and becomes ruler of Egypt
chaptersContent.content: Joseph answered Pharaoh, 'It is not in me; God will give Pharaoh a favorable answer.' And Pharaoh said to Joseph, 'Since God has shown you all this, there is none so discerning and wise as you are. You shall be over my house.'

chaptersContent.title: Joseph's Brothers Come to Egypt
chaptersContent.summary: Joseph's brothers come to Egypt to buy grain, Joseph recognizes them
chaptersContent.content: Joseph saw his brothers and recognized them, but he treated them like strangers and spoke roughly to them. And they said, 'We are indeed guilty concerning our brother, in that we saw the distress of his soul when he begged us and we did not listen.'

chaptersContent.title: The Second Journey to Egypt
chaptersContent.summary: Joseph's brothers return with Benjamin, Joseph tests them
chaptersContent.content: But Judah said to him, 'The man solemnly warned us, saying, You shall not see my face unless your brother is with you.' And Israel said, 'Why did you treat me so badly as to tell the man that you had another brother?'

chaptersContent.title: Joseph Tests His Brothers
chaptersContent.summary: Joseph plants his cup in Benjamin's sack to test his brothers
chaptersContent.content: They had gone only a short distance from the city. Now Joseph said to his steward, 'Up, follow after the men, and when you overtake them, say to them, Why have you repaid evil for good?' And Judah said, 'Now therefore, please let your servant remain instead of the boy.'

chaptersContent.title: Joseph Reveals Himself
chaptersContent.summary: Joseph reveals his identity to his brothers and sends for Jacob
chaptersContent.content: Then Joseph could not control himself before all those who stood by him. And he cried, 'Make everyone go out from me.' So no one stayed with him when Joseph made himself known to his brothers. And he wept aloud, so that the Egyptians heard it.

chaptersContent.title: Jacob Goes to Egypt
chaptersContent.summary: Jacob and his family move to Egypt to be with Joseph
chaptersContent.content: And he said, 'I am God, the God of your father. Do not be afraid to go down to Egypt, for there I will make you into a great nation. All the persons of the house of Jacob who came into Egypt were seventy.'

chaptersContent.title: Joseph's Family in Egypt
chaptersContent.summary: Joseph settles his family in Goshen and manages the famine
chaptersContent.content: The land of Egypt is before you. Settle your father and your brothers in the best of the land. Let them settle in the land of Goshen, and if you know any able men among them, put them in charge of my livestock.

chaptersContent.title: Jacob Blesses Joseph's Sons
chaptersContent.summary: Jacob blesses Joseph's sons Manasseh and Ephraim
chaptersContent.content: And now your two sons, who were born to you in the land of Egypt before I came to you in Egypt, are mine; Ephraim and Manasseh shall be mine, as Reuben and Simeon are. And Israel stretched out his right hand and laid it on the head of Ephraim.

chaptersContent.title: Jacob's Final Blessings
chaptersContent.summary: Jacob gives final blessings to each of his twelve sons
chaptersContent.content: Then Jacob called his sons and said, 'Gather yourselves together, that I may tell you what shall happen to you in days to come. The scepter shall not depart from Judah, nor the ruler's staff from between his feet, until tribute comes to him.'

chaptersContent.title: Joseph's Death
chaptersContent.summary: Jacob is buried in Canaan, Joseph dies in Egypt
chaptersContent.content: But Joseph said to them, 'Do not fear, for am I in the place of God? As for you, you meant evil against me, but God meant it for good, to bring it about that many people should be kept alive, as they are today.'

books.name: Exodus
books.description: The deliverance of Israel from Egypt and the giving of the Law
books.author: Moses

chaptersContent.title: Israel's Suffering in Egypt
chaptersContent.summary: The Israelites multiply in Egypt but are oppressed by a new pharaoh
chaptersContent.content: But the people of Israel were fruitful and increased greatly; they multiplied and grew exceedingly strong, so that the land was filled with them. Now there arose a new king over Egypt, who did not know Joseph.

chaptersContent.title: The Birth of Moses
chaptersContent.summary: Moses is born, hidden, and rescued by Pharaoh's daughter
chaptersContent.content: The woman conceived and bore a son, and when she saw that he was a fine child, she hid him three months. When the child grew older, she took him to Pharaoh's daughter, and he became her son. She named him Moses, 'Because I drew him out of the water.'

chaptersContent.title: Moses' Signs and Reluctance
chaptersContent.summary: God gives Moses miraculous signs and overcomes his objections
chaptersContent.content: The Lord said to him, 'What is that in your hand?' He said, 'A staff.' And he said, 'Throw it on the ground.' So he threw it on the ground, and it became a serpent, and Moses ran from it.

chaptersContent.title: Pharaoh's Hardened Heart
chaptersContent.summary: Pharaoh refuses to let Israel go and increases their labor
chaptersContent.content: Afterward Moses and Aaron went and said to Pharaoh, 'Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, Let my people go, that they may hold a feast to me in the wilderness.' But Pharaoh said, 'Who is the Lord, that I should obey his voice and let Israel go?'

chaptersContent.title: God's Promise to Deliver
chaptersContent.summary: God renews His promise to deliver Israel and reveals His name
chaptersContent.content: And God spoke to Moses and said to him, 'I am the Lord. I appeared to Abraham, to Isaac, and to Jacob, as God Almighty, but by my name the Lord I did not make myself known to them.'

chaptersContent.title: Moses and Aaron Before Pharaoh
chaptersContent.summary: Moses and Aaron perform signs before Pharaoh, but his heart is hardened
chaptersContent.content: But I will harden Pharaoh's heart, and though I multiply my signs and wonders in the land of Egypt, Pharaoh will not listen to you. Then I will lay my hand on Egypt and bring my hosts, my people the children of Israel, out of the land of Egypt.

chaptersContent.title: The Plagues: Frogs, Gnats, and Flies
chaptersContent.summary: God sends plagues of frogs, gnats, and flies on Egypt
chaptersContent.content: So Aaron stretched out his hand over the waters of Egypt, and the frogs came up and covered the land of Egypt. But the magicians did the same by their secret arts and made frogs come up on the land of Egypt.

chaptersContent.title: The Plagues: Livestock, Boils, and Hail
chaptersContent.summary: God sends plagues on livestock, boils, and destructive hail
chaptersContent.content: Behold, the hand of the Lord will fall with a very severe plague upon your livestock that are in the field, the horses, the donkeys, the camels, the herds, and the flocks. Then Moses stretched forth his staff toward heaven.

chaptersContent.title: The Plagues: Locusts and Darkness
chaptersContent.summary: God sends locusts and darkness as the final plagues
chaptersContent.content: If you refuse to let my people go, behold, tomorrow I will bring locusts into your country, and they shall cover the face of the land, so that no one can see the land. Then the Lord said to Moses, 'Stretch out your hand toward heaven.'

chaptersContent.title: The Final Plague Announced
chaptersContent.summary: God announces the death of the firstborn as the final plague
chaptersContent.content: So Moses said, 'Thus says the Lord: About midnight I will go out in the midst of Egypt, and every firstborn in the land of Egypt shall die, from the firstborn of Pharaoh who sits on his throne, even to the firstborn of the slave girl.'

chaptersContent.title: Consecration of the Firstborn
chaptersContent.summary: God commands the consecration of firstborn and the Feast of Unleavened Bread
chaptersContent.content: Consecrate to me all the firstborn. Whatever is the first to open the womb among the people of Israel, both of man and of beast, is mine. And you shall tell your son on that day, 'It is because of what the Lord did for me.'

chaptersContent.title: The Song of Moses
chaptersContent.summary: Moses and Israel sing praises to God for their deliverance
chaptersContent.content: Then Moses and the people of Israel sang this song to the Lord, saying, 'I will sing to the Lord, for he has triumphed gloriously; the horse and his rider he has thrown into the sea. The Lord is my strength and my song.'

chaptersContent.title: Bread from Heaven
chaptersContent.summary: God provides manna and quail for Israel in the wilderness
chaptersContent.content: Then the Lord said to Moses, 'Behold, I am about to rain bread from heaven for you, and the people shall go out and gather a day's portion every day, that I may test them, whether they will walk in my law or not.'

chaptersContent.title: Water from the Rock
chaptersContent.summary: God provides water from the rock and victory over Amalek
chaptersContent.content: And the people quarreled with Moses and said, 'Give us water to drink.' And Moses said to them, 'Why do you quarrel with me? Why do you test the Lord?' Behold, I will stand before you there on the rock at Horeb.

chaptersContent.title: Jethro's Advice
chaptersContent.summary: Jethro advises Moses to delegate leadership responsibilities
chaptersContent.content: Moses' father-in-law said to him, 'What you are doing is not good. You and the people with you will certainly wear yourselves out, for the thing is too heavy for you. You are not able to do it alone.'

chaptersContent.title: Israel at Mount Sinai
chaptersContent.summary: Israel arrives at Mount Sinai and prepares to meet with God
chaptersContent.content: Now therefore, if you will indeed obey my voice and keep my covenant, you shall be my treasured possession among all peoples, for all the earth is mine; and you shall be to me a kingdom of priests and a holy nation.

chaptersContent.title: Laws About Personal Injury
chaptersContent.summary: God gives laws about personal injury, slavery, and restitution
chaptersContent.content: Whoever strikes a man so that he dies shall be put to death. But if there is harm, then you shall pay life for life, eye for eye, tooth for tooth, hand for hand, foot for foot.

chaptersContent.title: Laws About Property
chaptersContent.summary: God gives laws about property damage, theft, and social justice
chaptersContent.content: If a man steals an ox or a sheep, and kills it or sells it, he shall repay five oxen for an ox, and four sheep for a sheep. You shall not wrong a sojourner or oppress him, for you were sojourners in the land of Egypt.

chaptersContent.title: Laws About Justice and Festivals
chaptersContent.summary: God gives laws about justice, festivals, and the Sabbath
chaptersContent.content: You shall not fall in with the many to do evil, nor shall you bear witness in a lawsuit, siding with the many, so as to pervert justice. Six days you shall do your work, but on the seventh day you shall rest.

chaptersContent.title: The Covenant Confirmed
chaptersContent.summary: Moses confirms the covenant with Israel and goes up Mount Sinai
chaptersContent.content: Moses came and told the people all the words of the Lord and all the rules. And all the people answered with one voice and said, 'All the words that the Lord has spoken we will do.'

chaptersContent.title: Contributions for the Sanctuary
chaptersContent.summary: God commands contributions for building the tabernacle and its furnishings
chaptersContent.content: Speak to the people of Israel, that they take for me a contribution. From every man whose heart moves him you shall receive the contribution for me. And let them make me a sanctuary, that I may dwell in their midst.

chaptersContent.title: The Tabernacle Structure
chaptersContent.summary: God gives detailed instructions for building the tabernacle structure
chaptersContent.content: Moreover, you shall make the tabernacle with ten curtains of fine twined linen and blue and purple and scarlet yarns; you shall make them with cherubim skillfully worked into them. And you shall make fifty clasps of gold.

chaptersContent.title: The Altar and Court
chaptersContent.summary: God gives instructions for the altar, court, and oil for the lamp
chaptersContent.content: You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long and five cubits broad. The altar shall be square, and its height shall be three cubits. You shall command the people of Israel that they bring to you pure beaten olive oil.

chaptersContent.title: The Priests' Garments
chaptersContent.summary: God gives instructions for the priests' holy garments
chaptersContent.content: Then bring near to you Aaron your brother, and his sons with him, from among the people of Israel, to serve me as priestsAaron and Aaron's sons, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar.

chaptersContent.title: Consecration of the Priests
chaptersContent.summary: God gives instructions for consecrating Aaron and his sons as priests
chaptersContent.content: Now this is what you shall do to them to consecrate them, that they may serve me as priests. Take one bull of the herd and two rams without blemish, and unleavened bread, unleavened cakes mixed with oil, and unleavened wafers smeared with oil.

chaptersContent.title: The Altar of Incense and Other Items
chaptersContent.summary: God gives instructions for the altar of incense, basin, and census tax
chaptersContent.content: You shall make an altar to burn incense on; you shall make it of acacia wood. Aaron shall make atonement on its horns once a year. With the blood of the sin offering of atonement he shall make atonement for it once in the year throughout your generations.

chaptersContent.title: Bezalel and Oholiab
chaptersContent.summary: God appoints Bezalel and Oholiab to build the tabernacle
chaptersContent.content: The Lord said to Moses, 'See, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah, and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, with ability and intelligence, with knowledge and all craftsmanship.'

chaptersContent.title: The Golden Calf
chaptersContent.summary: Israel worships a golden calf while Moses is on Mount Sinai
chaptersContent.content: When the people saw that Moses delayed to come down from the mountain, the people gathered themselves together to Aaron and said to him, 'Up, make us gods who shall go before us. As for this Moses, the man who brought us up out of the land of Egypt, we do not know what has become of him.'

chaptersContent.title: The Command to Leave Sinai
chaptersContent.summary: God commands Israel to leave Sinai and promises His presence
chaptersContent.content: The Lord said to Moses, 'Depart; go up from here, you and the people whom you have brought up out of the land of Egypt, to the land of which I swore to Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob, saying, To your offspring I will give it.'

chaptersContent.title: Moses Makes New Tablets
chaptersContent.summary: Moses makes new tablets and God renews the covenant
chaptersContent.content: The Lord said to Moses, 'Cut for yourself two tablets of stone like the first, and I will write on the tablets the words that were on the first tablets, which you broke.' The Lord passed before him and proclaimed, 'The Lord, the Lord.'

chaptersContent.title: Sabbath Regulations
chaptersContent.summary: Moses commands Sabbath observance and contributions for the tabernacle
chaptersContent.content: Moses assembled all the congregation of the people of Israel and said to them, 'These are the things that the Lord has commanded you to do. Six days work shall be done, but on the seventh day you shall have a Sabbath of solemn rest.'

chaptersContent.title: Building the Tabernacle
chaptersContent.summary: The skilled workers build the tabernacle according to God's instructions
chaptersContent.content: Bezalel and Oholiab and every craftsman in whom the Lord has put skill and intelligence to know how to do any work in the construction of the sanctuary shall work in accordance with all that the Lord has commanded.

chaptersContent.title: Making the Ark and Other Furnishings
chaptersContent.summary: Bezalel makes the ark, table, lampstand, and altar of incense
chaptersContent.content: Bezalel made the ark of acacia wood. Two cubits and a half was its length, a cubit and a half its breadth, and a cubit and a half its height. And he overlaid it with pure gold inside and outside, and made a molding of gold around it.

chaptersContent.title: Making the Altar and Court
chaptersContent.summary: Bezalel makes the altar of burnt offering and the court of the tabernacle
chaptersContent.content: He made the altar of burnt offering of acacia wood. Five cubits was its length, and five cubits its breadth. It was square, and three cubits was its height. He made the court. For the south side the hangings of the court were of fine twined linen.

chaptersContent.title: Making the Priests' Garments
chaptersContent.summary: The skilled workers make the priests' garments as commanded
chaptersContent.content: From the blue and purple and scarlet yarns they made finely woven garments, for ministering in the Holy Place. They made the holy garments for Aaron, as the Lord had commanded Moses. Thus all the work of the tabernacle of the tent of meeting was finished.

chaptersContent.title: The Burning Bush
chaptersContent.summary: God appears to Moses in a burning bush and commissions him to deliver Israel
chaptersContent.content: And the angel of the Lord appeared to him in a flame of fire out of the midst of a bush. He looked, and behold, the bush was burning, yet it was not consumed. And Moses said, 'I will turn aside to see this great sight, why the bush is not burned.'

chaptersContent.title: The Passover
chaptersContent.summary: God institutes the Passover and delivers Israel from Egypt
chaptersContent.content: The blood shall be a sign for you, on the houses where you are. And when I see the blood, I will pass over you, and no plague will befall you to destroy you, when I strike the land of Egypt.

chaptersContent.title: Crossing the Red Sea
chaptersContent.summary: God parts the Red Sea for Israel to escape and destroys Pharaoh's army
chaptersContent.content: And Moses said to the people, 'Fear not, stand firm, and see the salvation of the Lord, which he will work for you today. For the Egyptians whom you see today, you shall never see again.'

chaptersContent.title: The Ten Commandments
chaptersContent.summary: God gives the Ten Commandments to Israel at Mount Sinai
chaptersContent.content: And God spoke all these words, saying, 'I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery. You shall have no other gods before me.'

chaptersContent.title: The Tabernacle Erected
chaptersContent.summary: Moses erects the tabernacle and God's glory fills it
chaptersContent.content: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying, 'On the first day of the first month you shall erect the tabernacle of the tent of meeting. Then the cloud covered the tent of meeting, and the glory of the Lord filled the tabernacle. For the cloud of the Lord was on the tabernacle by day.'

books.name: Leviticus
books.description: Laws and rituals for worship, holiness, and priestly duties
books.author: Moses

chaptersContent.title: The Burnt Offering
chaptersContent.summary: God gives instructions for the burnt offering
chaptersContent.content: If his offering is a burnt offering from the herd, he shall offer a male without blemish. He shall bring it to the entrance of the tent of meeting, that he may be accepted before the Lord. He shall lay his hand on the head of the burnt offering, and it shall be accepted for him to make atonement for him.

chaptersContent.title: The Grain Offering
chaptersContent.summary: God gives instructions for the grain offering
chaptersContent.content: When anyone brings a grain offering as an offering to the Lord, his offering shall be of fine flour. He shall pour oil on it and put frankincense on it. And he shall bring it to Aaron's sons the priests, and he shall take from it a handful of the fine flour and oil, with all of its frankincense.

chaptersContent.title: The Peace Offering
chaptersContent.summary: God gives instructions for the peace offering
chaptersContent.content: If his offering is a sacrifice of peace offering, if he offers an animal from the herd, male or female, he shall offer it without blemish before the Lord. And he shall lay his hand on the head of his offering and kill it at the entrance of the tent of meeting, and Aaron's sons the priests shall throw the blood against the sides of the altar.

chaptersContent.title: The Sin Offering
chaptersContent.summary: God gives instructions for the sin offering
chaptersContent.content: Speak to the people of Israel, saying, If anyone sins unintentionally in any of the Lord's commandments about things not to be done, and does any one of them, if it is the anointed priest who sins, thus bringing guilt on the people, then he shall offer for the sin that he has committed a bull from the herd without blemish to the Lord for a sin offering.

chaptersContent.title: The Guilt Offering
chaptersContent.summary: God gives instructions for the guilt offering
chaptersContent.content: When he realizes his guilt in any of these and confesses the sin he has committed, he shall bring to the Lord as his compensation for the sin that he has committed, a female from the flock, a lamb or a goat, for a sin offering. And the priest shall make atonement for him for his sin.

chaptersContent.title: The Law of the Burnt Offering
chaptersContent.summary: Additional laws for the burnt offering and grain offering
chaptersContent.content: Command Aaron and his sons, saying, This is the law of the burnt offering. The burnt offering shall be on the hearth on the altar all night until the morning, and the fire of the altar shall be kept burning on it. The fire shall be kept burning on the altar continually; it shall not go out.

chaptersContent.title: The Law of the Guilt Offering
chaptersContent.summary: Additional laws for the guilt offering and peace offering
chaptersContent.content: This is the law of the guilt offering. It is most holy. In the place where they kill the burnt offering they shall kill the guilt offering, and its blood shall be thrown against the sides of the altar. And all its fat shall be offered, the fat tail, the fat that covers the entrails.

chaptersContent.title: Consecration of Aaron and His Sons
chaptersContent.summary: Moses consecrates Aaron and his sons as priests
chaptersContent.content: Take Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments and the anointing oil and the bull of the sin offering and the two rams and the basket of unleavened bread. And Moses did as the Lord commanded him, and the congregation was assembled at the entrance of the tent of meeting.

chaptersContent.title: Aaron's First Offerings
chaptersContent.summary: Aaron offers his first sacrifices as high priest
chaptersContent.content: And an ox and a ram for peace offerings, to sacrifice before the Lord, and a grain offering mixed with oil, for today the Lord will appear to you. And Moses said, This is the thing that the Lord commanded you to do, that the glory of the Lord may appear to you.

chaptersContent.title: The Death of Nadab and Abihu
chaptersContent.summary: Nadab and Abihu are killed for offering unauthorized fire
chaptersContent.content: Now Nadab and Abihu, the sons of Aaron, each took his censer and put fire in it and laid incense on it and offered unauthorized fire before the Lord, which he had not commanded them. And fire came out from before the Lord and consumed them, and they died before the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Clean and Unclean Animals
chaptersContent.summary: God gives laws about clean and unclean animals
chaptersContent.content: Speak to the people of Israel, saying, These are the living things that you may eat among all the animals that are on the earth. Whatever parts the hoof and is cloven-footed and chews the cud, among the animals, you may eat. For I am the Lord your God. Consecrate yourselves therefore, and be holy, for I am holy.

chaptersContent.title: Purification After Childbirth
chaptersContent.summary: Laws for purification after giving birth
chaptersContent.content: Speak to the people of Israel, saying, If a woman conceives and bears a male child, then she shall be unclean seven days. As at the time of her menstruation, she shall be unclean. Then she shall continue for thirty-three days in the blood of her purifying. She shall not touch anything holy, nor come into the sanctuary.

chaptersContent.title: Laws About Leprosy
chaptersContent.summary: Laws for identifying and dealing with leprosy
chaptersContent.content: When a person has on the skin of his body a swelling or an eruption or a spot, and it turns into a case of leprous disease on the skin of his body, then he shall be brought to Aaron the priest or to one of his sons the priests. The leprous person who has the disease shall wear torn clothes and let the hair of his head hang loose.

chaptersContent.title: Laws for Cleansing Lepers
chaptersContent.summary: Procedures for cleansing those healed of leprosy
chaptersContent.content: This shall be the law of the leprous person for the day of his cleansing. He shall be brought to the priest, and the priest shall go out of the camp, and the priest shall look, and if the case of leprous disease is healed in the leprous person, then the priest shall command them to take for him who is to be cleansed two live clean birds.

chaptersContent.title: Laws About Bodily Discharges
chaptersContent.summary: Laws for dealing with various bodily discharges
chaptersContent.content: Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, When any man has a discharge from his body, his discharge is unclean. When a woman has a discharge, and the discharge in her body is blood, she shall be in her menstrual impurity for seven days, and whoever touches her shall be unclean until the evening.

chaptersContent.title: The Place of Sacrifice
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about where sacrifices may be offered
chaptersContent.content: If any one of the house of Israel kills an ox or a lamb or a goat in the camp, or kills it outside the camp, and does not bring it to the entrance of the tent of meeting to offer it as a gift to the Lord in front of the tabernacle of the Lord, bloodguilt shall be imputed to that man.

chaptersContent.title: Unlawful Sexual Relations
chaptersContent.summary: Laws prohibiting various forms of sexual immorality
chaptersContent.content: Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, I am the Lord your God. None of you shall approach any one of his close relatives to uncover nakedness. I am the Lord. Do not make yourselves unclean by any of these things, for by all these the nations I am driving out before you have become unclean.

chaptersContent.title: Punishments for Sexual Sins
chaptersContent.summary: Punishments for various sexual sins and abominations
chaptersContent.content: Say to the people of Israel, Any one of the people of Israel or of the strangers who sojourn in Israel who gives any of his children to Molech shall surely be put to death. The people of the land shall stone him with stones. Consecrate yourselves, therefore, and be holy, for I am the Lord your God.

chaptersContent.title: Holiness of Priests
chaptersContent.summary: Laws for priests to maintain holiness
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said to Moses, Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them, No one shall make himself unclean for the dead among his people, except for his closest relatives, his mother, his father, his son, his daughter, his brother. You shall sanctify him, for he offers the bread of your God.

chaptersContent.title: Acceptable Offerings
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about what makes offerings acceptable
chaptersContent.content: Speak to Aaron and his sons so that they abstain from the holy things of the people of Israel, which they dedicate to me, so that they do not profane my holy name: I am the Lord. Say to them, If any one of all your offspring throughout your generations approaches the holy things that the people of Israel dedicate to the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Appointed Feasts
chaptersContent.summary: Laws for the appointed feasts and holy days
chaptersContent.content: Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, These are the appointed feasts of the Lord that you shall proclaim as holy convocations; they are my appointed feasts. These are the appointed feasts of the Lord, the holy convocations, which you shall proclaim at the time appointed for them.

chaptersContent.title: Oil and Bread for the Lampstand
chaptersContent.summary: Laws for the lampstand oil and bread of the Presence
chaptersContent.content: Command the people of Israel to bring you pure beaten olive oil for the light, that a lamp may regularly be set up to burn. Aaron shall arrange it from evening to morning before the Lord regularly. It shall be a statute forever throughout your generations at the entrance of the tent of meeting before the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: The Sabbath Year and Jubilee
chaptersContent.summary: Laws for the Sabbath year and year of jubilee
chaptersContent.content: But in the seventh year there shall be a Sabbath of solemn rest for the land, a Sabbath to the Lord. You shall not sow your field or prune your vineyard. And you shall consecrate the fiftieth year, and proclaim liberty throughout the land to all its inhabitants. It shall be a jubilee for you.

chaptersContent.title: Blessings and Curses
chaptersContent.summary: Blessings for obedience and curses for disobedience
chaptersContent.content: If you walk in my statutes and observe my commandments and do them, then I will give you your rains in their season, and the land shall yield its increase, and the trees of the field shall yield their fruit. And I will walk among you and will be your God, and you shall be my people.

chaptersContent.title: Vows and Dedications
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about vows and dedicating things to the Lord
chaptersContent.content: Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, When a man makes a special vow, the value of which shall be stated in terms of the shekel of the sanctuary, the shekel being twenty gerahs. If he cannot afford the equivalent, then he shall stand before the priest, and the priest shall value him.

chaptersContent.title: The Day of Atonement
chaptersContent.summary: God establishes the annual Day of Atonement for Israel's sins
chaptersContent.content: For on this day shall atonement be made for you to cleanse you. You shall be clean before the Lord from all your sins. It is a Sabbath of solemn rest to you, and you shall afflict yourselves; it is a statute forever.

chaptersContent.title: Laws of Holiness
chaptersContent.summary: God calls Israel to be holy and gives laws for righteous living
chaptersContent.content: Speak to all the congregation of the people of Israel and say to them: You shall be holy, for I the Lord your God am holy. You shall not hate your brother in your heart, but you shall reason frankly with your neighbor, lest you incur sin because of him.

books.name: Numbers
books.description: Israel's wilderness wanderings and preparations to enter the Promised Land
books.author: Moses

chaptersContent.title: A Census of Israel's Warriors
chaptersContent.summary: God commands Moses to take a census of fighting men
chaptersContent.content: The Lord spoke to Moses in the wilderness of Sinai, in the tent of meeting, on the first day of the second month, in the second year after they had come out of the land of Egypt, saying, Take a census of all the congregation of the people of Israel.

chaptersContent.title: The Arrangement of the Camps
chaptersContent.summary: God arranges the tribes in order around the tabernacle
chaptersContent.content: The Lord spoke to Moses and Aaron, saying, The people of Israel shall camp each by his own flag, with the banners of their fathers' houses. They shall camp facing the tent of meeting on every side. Thus did the people of Israel. According to all that the Lord commanded Moses.

chaptersContent.title: The Sons of Aaron
chaptersContent.summary: The Levites are set apart for service in the tabernacle
chaptersContent.content: These are the generations of Aaron and Moses at the time when the Lord spoke with Moses on Mount Sinai. Bring the tribe of Levi near, and set them before Aaron the priest, that they may minister to him. And behold, I have taken the Levites from among the people of Israel.

chaptersContent.title: Duties of the Kohathites
chaptersContent.summary: The Kohathites are assigned to carry the holy things
chaptersContent.content: Take a census of the sons of Kohath from among the sons of Levi, by their clans and their fathers' houses, from thirty years old up to fifty years old, all who can come on duty, to do the work in the tent of meeting.

chaptersContent.title: Unclean People
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about removing unclean people from the camp
chaptersContent.content: Command the people of Israel that they put out of the camp everyone who is leprous or has a discharge and everyone who is unclean through contact with the dead. You shall put out both male and female, putting them outside the camp.

chaptersContent.title: The Nazirite Vow
chaptersContent.summary: Laws for those who take the Nazirite vow
chaptersContent.content: Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, When either a man or a woman makes a special vow, the vow of a Nazirite, to separate himself to the Lord, he shall separate himself from wine and strong drink. He shall drink no vinegar made from wine.

chaptersContent.title: Offerings for the Altar
chaptersContent.summary: The leaders bring offerings for the dedication of the altar
chaptersContent.content: On the day when Moses had finished setting up the tabernacle and had anointed and consecrated it with all its furnishings and had anointed and consecrated the altar with all its utensils, the chiefs of Israel, heads of their fathers' houses.

chaptersContent.title: The Seven Lamps
chaptersContent.summary: God gives instructions for the lampstand and Levites
chaptersContent.content: Speak to Aaron and say to him, When you set up the lamps, the seven lamps shall give light in front of the lampstand. And Aaron did so: he set up its lamps in front of the lampstand, as the Lord commanded Moses.

chaptersContent.title: The Passover
chaptersContent.summary: Israel celebrates the Passover in the wilderness
chaptersContent.content: Let the people of Israel keep the Passover at its appointed time. On the fourteenth day of this month, at twilight, you shall keep it at its appointed time; according to all its statutes and all its rules you shall keep it.

chaptersContent.title: The Silver Trumpets
chaptersContent.summary: God gives instructions for making and using silver trumpets
chaptersContent.content: Make two silver trumpets. Of hammered work you shall make them, and you shall use them for summoning the congregation and for breaking camp. And when you go to war in your land against the adversary who oppresses you, then you shall sound an alarm with the trumpets.

chaptersContent.title: The People Complain
chaptersContent.summary: Israel complains about the manna and God sends quail
chaptersContent.content: And the people complained in the hearing of the Lord about their misfortunes, and when the Lord heard it, his anger was kindled, and the fire of the Lord burned among them and consumed some outlying parts of the camp. Now the rabble that was among them had a strong craving.

chaptersContent.title: Miriam and Aaron Oppose Moses
chaptersContent.summary: Miriam and Aaron speak against Moses and Miriam is punished
chaptersContent.content: Miriam and Aaron spoke against Moses because of the Cushite woman whom he had married, for he had married a Cushite woman. And they said, Has the Lord indeed spoken only through Moses? Has he not spoken through us also? And the Lord heard it.

chaptersContent.title: Laws About Offerings
chaptersContent.summary: God gives additional laws about offerings and sacrifices
chaptersContent.content: Speak to the people of Israel and say to them, When you come into the land you are to inhabit, which I am giving you, and you offer to the Lord from the herd or from the flock a food offering or a burnt offering, to fulfill a vow or as a freewill offering.

chaptersContent.title: Korah's Rebellion
chaptersContent.summary: Korah leads a rebellion against Moses and Aaron
chaptersContent.content: Now Korah the son of Izhar, son of Kohath, son of Levi, and Dathan and Abiram the sons of Eliab, and On the son of Peleth, sons of Reuben, took men. And they rose up before Moses, with a number of the people of Israel.

chaptersContent.title: Aaron's Staff Buds
chaptersContent.summary: God confirms Aaron's priesthood with a miraculous sign
chaptersContent.content: And the staff of the man whom I choose shall sprout. Thus I will make to cease from me the grumblings of the people of Israel, which they grumble against you. Moses spoke to the people of Israel. And all their chiefs gave him staffs, one for each chief.

chaptersContent.title: Duties of Priests and Levites
chaptersContent.summary: God defines the duties and inheritance of priests and Levites
chaptersContent.content: So the Lord said to Aaron, You and your sons and your father's house with you shall bear iniquity connected with the sanctuary, and you and your sons with you shall bear iniquity connected with your priesthood. And behold, I have taken your brothers the Levites from among the people of Israel.

chaptersContent.title: Laws for Cleansing
chaptersContent.summary: God gives laws for purification using the red heifer
chaptersContent.content: This is the statute of the law that the Lord has commanded: Tell the people of Israel to bring you a red heifer without defect, in which there is no blemish, and on which a yoke has never come. And the priest shall take some of its blood with his finger.

chaptersContent.title: The Waters of Meribah
chaptersContent.summary: Moses strikes the rock and is denied entry to the Promised Land
chaptersContent.content: Take the staff, and assemble the congregation, you and Aaron your brother, and tell the rock before their eyes to yield its water. So you shall bring water out of the rock for them and give drink to the congregation and their cattle.

chaptersContent.title: The Bronze Serpent
chaptersContent.summary: God sends fiery serpents and provides healing through a bronze serpent
chaptersContent.content: Then the Lord sent fiery serpents among the people, and they bit the people, so that many people of Israel died. And the people came to Moses and said, We have sinned, for we have spoken against the Lord and against you. Pray to the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Balak Summons Balaam
chaptersContent.summary: Balak king of Moab summons Balaam to curse Israel
chaptersContent.content: And Balak the son of Zippor saw all that Israel had done to the Amorites. And Moab was in great dread of the people, because they were many. Moab was overcome with fear of the people of Israel. Come now, curse this people for me, since they are too mighty for me.

chaptersContent.title: Balaam's First Oracle
chaptersContent.summary: Balaam blesses Israel instead of cursing them
chaptersContent.content: And he took up his discourse and said, From Aram Balak has brought me, the king of Moab from the eastern mountains: Come, curse Jacob for me, and come, denounce Israel! How can I curse whom God has not cursed? How can I denounce whom the Lord has not denounced?

chaptersContent.title: Balaam's Final Oracles
chaptersContent.summary: Balaam gives final prophecies about Israel's future
chaptersContent.content: The oracle of Balaam the son of Beor, the oracle of the man whose eye is opened, the oracle of him who hears the words of God, who sees the vision of the Almighty, falling down with his eyes uncovered. I see him, but not now; I behold him, but not near.

chaptersContent.title: Israel's Sin at Peor
chaptersContent.summary: Israel commits sexual immorality with Moabite women
chaptersContent.content: While Israel lived in Shittim, the people began to whore with the daughters of Moab. These invited the people to the sacrifices of their gods, and the people ate and bowed down to their gods. So Israel yoked himself to Baal of Peor.

chaptersContent.title: A Second Census
chaptersContent.summary: God commands a second census of the new generation
chaptersContent.content: After the plague, the Lord said to Moses and to Eleazar the son of Aaron, the priest, Take a census of all the congregation of the people of Israel, from twenty years old and upward, by their fathers' houses, all in Israel who are able to go to war.

chaptersContent.title: The Daughters of Zelophehad
chaptersContent.summary: Zelophehad's daughters request inheritance rights
chaptersContent.content: Then drew near the daughters of Zelophehad the son of Hepher, son of Gilead, son of Machir, son of Manasseh, from the clans of Manasseh the son of Joseph. These were the names of his daughters: Mahlah, Noah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Tirzah.

chaptersContent.title: Daily Offerings
chaptersContent.summary: God gives laws for daily, weekly, and monthly offerings
chaptersContent.content: Command the people of Israel and say to them, My offering, my food for my food offerings, my pleasing aroma, you shall be careful to offer to me at its appointed time. And you shall say to them, This is the food offering that you shall offer to the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Offerings for the Appointed Feasts
chaptersContent.summary: God gives laws for offerings during the appointed feasts
chaptersContent.content: On the first day of the seventh month you shall have a holy convocation. You shall not do any ordinary work. It is a day for you to blow the trumpets. On the tenth day of this seventh month you shall have a holy convocation.

chaptersContent.title: Laws About Vows
chaptersContent.summary: God gives laws about making and keeping vows
chaptersContent.content: If a man vows a vow to the Lord, or swears an oath to bind himself by a pledge, he shall not break his word. He shall do according to all that proceeds out of his mouth. If a woman vows a vow to the Lord and binds herself by a pledge.

chaptersContent.title: Vengeance on Midian
chaptersContent.summary: Israel takes vengeance on Midian for leading them into sin
chaptersContent.content: Avenge the people of Israel on the Midianites. Afterward you shall be gathered to your people. So Moses spoke to the people, saying, Arm men from among you for the war, that they may go against Midian to execute the Lord's vengeance on Midian.

chaptersContent.title: Reuben and Gad Settle East of Jordan
chaptersContent.summary: Reuben and Gad request land east of the Jordan
chaptersContent.content: Now the people of Reuben and the people of Gad had a very great number of livestock. And they saw the land of Jazer and the land of Gilead, and behold, the place was a place for livestock. And the people of Gad and the people of Reuben came and said to Moses.

chaptersContent.title: Recounting Israel's Journey
chaptersContent.summary: Moses recounts the stages of Israel's journey from Egypt
chaptersContent.content: These are the stages of the people of Israel, when they went out of the land of Egypt by their companies under the leadership of Moses and Aaron. Moses wrote down their starting places, stage by stage, by command of the Lord. And the Lord spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab.

chaptersContent.title: Boundaries of the Promised Land
chaptersContent.summary: God defines the boundaries of the land Israel will inherit
chaptersContent.content: The Lord spoke to Moses, saying, Command the people of Israel, and say to them, When you enter the land of Canaan (this is the land that shall fall to you for an inheritance, the land of Canaan as defined by its borders). These are the names of the men who shall divide the land to you for inheritance.

chaptersContent.title: Cities for the Levites
chaptersContent.summary: God commands cities for the Levites and cities of refuge
chaptersContent.content: The Lord spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying, Command the people of Israel to give to the Levites some of the inheritance of their possession as cities for them to dwell in. And pasturelands around the cities shall you give to the Levites.

chaptersContent.title: Marriage of Female Heirs
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about female heirs marrying within their tribe
chaptersContent.content: The heads of the fathers' houses of the clan of the people of Gilead the son of Machir, son of Manasseh, from the clans of the people of Joseph, came near and spoke before Moses and before the chiefs, the heads of the fathers' houses of the people of Israel.

chaptersContent.title: The Twelve Spies
chaptersContent.summary: Twelve spies explore the Promised Land, but only two trust God
chaptersContent.content: But Caleb quieted the people before Moses and said, 'Let us go up at once and occupy it, for we are well able to overcome it.' Then the men who had gone up with him said, 'We are not able to go up against the people, for they are stronger than we are.'

chaptersContent.title: Israel's Rebellion
chaptersContent.summary: Israel rebels against God and is sentenced to wander 40 years
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said to Moses, 'How long will this people despise me? And how long will they not believe in me, in spite of all the signs that I have done among them?'

books.name: Deuteronomy
books.description: Moses' final speeches reviewing the law and preparing Israel for the Promised Land
books.author: Moses

chaptersContent.title: Moses Recounts Israel's Journey
chaptersContent.summary: Moses begins his final speech recounting Israel's journey
chaptersContent.content: These are the words that Moses spoke to all Israel beyond the Jordan in the wilderness, in the Arabah opposite Suph, between Paran and Tophel, Laban, Hazeroth, and Dizahab. In the fortieth year, on the first day of the eleventh month, Moses spoke to the people of Israel.

chaptersContent.title: Israel's Journey Around Edom
chaptersContent.summary: Moses recounts Israel's journey around Edom and Moab
chaptersContent.content: Then we turned and journeyed into the wilderness in the direction of the Red Sea, as the Lord told me. And for many days we traveled around Mount Seir. For the Lord your God has blessed you in all the work of your hands. He knows your going through this great wilderness.

chaptersContent.title: Conquest of the Transjordan
chaptersContent.summary: Moses recounts the conquest of lands east of the Jordan
chaptersContent.content: Then we turned and went up the way to Bashan. And Og the king of Bashan came out against us, he and all his people, to battle at Edrei. But the Lord said to me, Do not fear him, for I have given him and all his people and his land into your hand.

chaptersContent.title: Moses Exhorts Israel to Obedience
chaptersContent.summary: Moses urges Israel to obey God's laws and avoid idolatry
chaptersContent.content: And now, O Israel, listen to the statutes and the rules that I am teaching you, and do them, that you may live, and go in and take possession of the land that the Lord, the God of your fathers, is giving you. You shall not add to the word that I command you.

chaptersContent.title: The Ten Commandments
chaptersContent.summary: Moses repeats the Ten Commandments to the new generation
chaptersContent.content: I am the Lord your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of slavery. You shall have no other gods before me. You shall not make for yourself a carved image, or any likeness of anything that is in heaven above.

chaptersContent.title: A Chosen People
chaptersContent.summary: God's choice of Israel and commands for conquest
chaptersContent.content: When the Lord your God brings you into the land that you are entering to take possession of it, and clears away many nations before you, the Hittites, the Girgashites, the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.

chaptersContent.title: Remember the Lord Your God
chaptersContent.summary: Moses warns against forgetting God in prosperity
chaptersContent.content: And you shall remember the whole way that the Lord your God has led you these forty years in the wilderness, that he might humble you, testing you to know what was in your heart, whether you would keep his commandments or not.

chaptersContent.title: Not Because of Righteousness
chaptersContent.summary: Moses reminds Israel they don't deserve the land
chaptersContent.content: Do not say in your heart, after the Lord your God has thrust them out before you, It is because of my righteousness that the Lord has brought me in to possess this land, whereas it is because of the wickedness of these nations that the Lord is driving them out before you.

chaptersContent.title: New Tablets of Stone
chaptersContent.summary: Moses recounts receiving new tablets and God's requirements
chaptersContent.content: At that time the Lord said to me, Cut for yourself two tablets of stone like the first, and come up to me on the mountain and make an ark of wood. And now, Israel, what does the Lord your God require of you, but to fear the Lord your God.

chaptersContent.title: Love and Obey the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Moses urges Israel to love and obey God for blessing
chaptersContent.content: You shall therefore love the Lord your God and keep his charge, his statutes, his rules, and his commandments always. And if you will indeed obey my commandments that I command you today, to love the Lord your God, and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.

chaptersContent.title: The Place of Worship
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about centralized worship and avoiding pagan practices
chaptersContent.content: But you shall seek the place that the Lord your God will choose out of all your tribes to put his name and make his habitation there. There you shall go, and there you shall bring your burnt offerings and your sacrifices, your tithes and the contribution that you present.

chaptersContent.title: Warning Against Idolatry
chaptersContent.summary: Warning against false prophets and idolatry
chaptersContent.content: If a prophet or a dreamer of dreams arises among you and gives you a sign or a wonder, and the sign or wonder that he tells you comes to pass, and if he says, Let us go after other gods, which you have not known, and let us serve them.

chaptersContent.title: Clean and Unclean Food
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about clean and unclean animals and tithing
chaptersContent.content: For you are a people holy to the Lord your God, and the Lord has chosen you to be a people for his treasured possession, out of all the peoples who are on the face of the earth. You shall not eat any abomination. You shall tithe all the yield of your seed that comes from the field year by year.

chaptersContent.title: The Sabbatical Year
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about the seventh year and treatment of the poor
chaptersContent.content: At the end of every seven years you shall grant a release. And this is the manner of the release: every creditor shall release what he has lent to his neighbor. He shall not exact it of his neighbor, his brother, because the Lord's release has been proclaimed.

chaptersContent.title: The Three Annual Feasts
chaptersContent.summary: Laws for Passover, Weeks, and Booths festivals
chaptersContent.content: Observe the month of Abib and keep the Passover to the Lord your God, for in the month of Abib the Lord your God brought you out of Egypt. Three times a year all your males shall appear before the Lord your God at the place that he will choose.

chaptersContent.title: Justice and Kingship
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about justice and future kings of Israel
chaptersContent.content: If any case arises requiring decision between one kind of homicide and another, one kind of legal right and another, or one kind of assault and another, any case within your towns that is too difficult for you, then you shall arise and go up to the place that the Lord your God will choose.

chaptersContent.title: Provision for Priests and Levites
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about priests, Levites, and true prophets
chaptersContent.content: The Levitical priests, all the tribe of Levi, shall have no portion or inheritance with Israel. They shall eat the Lord's food offerings as their inheritance. For the Lord your God has chosen him out of all your tribes to stand and minister in the name of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Cities of Refuge
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about cities of refuge and witnesses
chaptersContent.content: When the Lord your God cuts off the nations whose land the Lord your God is giving you, and you dispossess them and dwell in their cities and in their houses, you shall set apart three cities for yourselves in the land that the Lord your God is giving you to possess.

chaptersContent.title: Laws of Warfare
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about going to war and sieging cities
chaptersContent.content: When you go out to war against your enemies, and see horses and chariots and an army larger than your own, you shall not be afraid of them, for the Lord your God is with you, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.

chaptersContent.title: Various Laws
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about unsolved murders, marriage, and inheritance
chaptersContent.content: If in the land that the Lord your God is giving you to possess someone is found slain, lying in the open country, and it is not known who killed him, then your elders and your judges shall come out, and they shall measure the distance to the surrounding cities.

chaptersContent.title: Various Laws Continued
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about property, marriage, and sexual morality
chaptersContent.content: You shall not see your brother's ox or his sheep going astray and ignore them. You shall take them back to your brother. A woman shall not wear a man's garment, nor shall a man put on a woman's cloak, for whoever does these things is an abomination to the Lord your God.

chaptersContent.title: Exclusion from the Assembly
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about who may enter the assembly and other regulations
chaptersContent.content: No one whose testicles are crushed or whose male organ is cut off shall enter the assembly of the Lord. No one born of a forbidden union may enter the assembly of the Lord. Even to the tenth generation, none of his descendants may enter the assembly of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Divorce and Other Laws
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about divorce, pledges, and social justice
chaptersContent.content: When a man takes a wife and marries her, if then she finds no favor in his eyes because he has found some indecency in her, and he writes her a certificate of divorce and puts it in her hand and sends her out of his house.

chaptersContent.title: Various Laws
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about corporal punishment, levirate marriage, and weights
chaptersContent.content: If there is a dispute between men and they come into court and the judges decide between them, acquitting the innocent and condemning the guilty, then if the guilty man deserves to be beaten, the judge shall cause him to lie down and be beaten in his presence.

chaptersContent.title: Firstfruits and Tithes
chaptersContent.summary: Laws about offering firstfruits and tithing
chaptersContent.content: When you come into the land that the Lord your God is giving you for an inheritance and have taken possession of it and live in it, you shall take some of the first of all the fruit of the ground, which you harvest from your land that the Lord your God is giving you.

chaptersContent.title: The Altar on Mount Ebal
chaptersContent.summary: Instructions for building an altar and writing the law
chaptersContent.content: Now Moses and the elders of Israel commanded the people, saying, Keep the whole commandment that I command you today. And on the day you cross over the Jordan to the land that the Lord your God is giving you, you shall set up large stones and plaster them with plaster.

chaptersContent.title: Blessings and Curses
chaptersContent.summary: Detailed blessings for obedience and curses for disobedience
chaptersContent.content: And if you faithfully obey the voice of the Lord your God, being careful to do all his commandments that I command you today, the Lord your God will set you high above all the nations of the earth. And all these blessings shall come upon you and overtake you.

chaptersContent.title: The Covenant Renewed
chaptersContent.summary: Moses renews the covenant with Israel
chaptersContent.content: These are the words of the covenant that the Lord commanded Moses to make with the people of Israel in the land of Moab, besides the covenant that he had made with them at Horeb. You are standing today all of you before the Lord your God.

chaptersContent.title: Joshua to Succeed Moses
chaptersContent.summary: Moses appoints Joshua as his successor
chaptersContent.content: So Moses continued to speak these words to all Israel. And he said to them, I am 120 years old today. I am no longer able to go out and come in. The Lord has said to me, You shall not go over this Jordan. The Lord your God himself will go over before you.

chaptersContent.title: The Song of Moses
chaptersContent.summary: Moses' song warning Israel about future disobedience
chaptersContent.content: Give ear, O heavens, and I will speak, and let the earth hear the words of my mouth. The Rock, his work is perfect, for all his ways are justice. A God of faithfulness and without iniquity, just and upright is he.

chaptersContent.title: Moses' Final Blessing
chaptersContent.summary: Moses blesses each tribe before his death
chaptersContent.content: This is the blessing with which Moses the man of God blessed the people of Israel before his death. He said, The Lord came from Sinai and dawned from Seir upon us; he shone forth from Mount Paran; he came from the ten thousands of holy ones.

chaptersContent.title: The Death of Moses
chaptersContent.summary: Moses dies on Mount Nebo and Joshua succeeds him
chaptersContent.content: Then Moses went up from the plains of Moab to Mount Nebo, to the top of Pisgah, which is opposite Jericho. And the Lord showed him all the land, Gilead as far as Dan, all Naphtali, the land of Ephraim and Manasseh, all the land of Judah.

chaptersContent.title: The Great Commandment
chaptersContent.summary: Moses declares the greatest commandment to love God with all your heart
chaptersContent.content: Hear, O Israel: The Lord our God, the Lord is one. You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your might. And these words that I command you today shall be on your heart.

chaptersContent.title: Choose Life
chaptersContent.summary: Moses presents the choice between life and death, blessing and curse
chaptersContent.content: I call heaven and earth to witness against you today, that I have set before you life and death, blessing and curse. Therefore choose life, that you and your offspring may live, loving the Lord your God, obeying his voice and holding fast to him.

books.name: Joshua
books.description: The conquest of the Promised Land under Joshua's leadership
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Joshua's Commission
chaptersContent.summary: God commissions Joshua to lead Israel into the Promised Land
chaptersContent.content: No man shall be able to stand before you all the days of your life. Just as I was with Moses, so I will be with you. I will not leave you or forsake you. This Book of the Law shall not depart from your mouth, but you shall meditate on it day and night.

chaptersContent.title: The Fall of Jericho
chaptersContent.summary: The walls of Jericho fall after Israel marches around the city
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said to Joshua, 'See, I have given Jericho into your hand, with its king and mighty men of valor.' So the people shouted, and the trumpets were blown. As soon as the people heard the sound of the trumpet, the people shouted a great shout, and the wall fell down flat.

chaptersContent.title: God's Commission to Joshua
chaptersContent.summary: God commissions Joshua to lead Israel into the Promised Land
chaptersContent.content: No man shall be able to stand before you all the days of your life. Just as I was with Moses, so I will be with you. I will not leave you or forsake you. This Book of the Law shall not depart from your mouth, but you shall meditate on it day and night.

chaptersContent.title: Rahab and the Spies
chaptersContent.summary: Two spies are hidden by Rahab in Jericho
chaptersContent.content: And as soon as we heard it, our hearts melted, and there was no spirit left in any man because of you, for the Lord your God, he is God in the heavens above and on the earth beneath. Behold, when we come into the land, you shall tie this scarlet cord in the window through which you let us down.

chaptersContent.title: Crossing the Jordan
chaptersContent.summary: Israel crosses the Jordan River on dry ground
chaptersContent.content: Joshua said to the people, 'Consecrate yourselves, for tomorrow the Lord will do wonders among you.' And the priests bearing the ark of the covenant of the Lord stood firmly on dry ground in the midst of the Jordan, and all Israel was passing over on dry ground.

chaptersContent.title: Memorial Stones
chaptersContent.summary: Twelve stones are set up as a memorial of crossing the Jordan
chaptersContent.content: That this may be a sign among you. When your children ask in time to come, 'What do those stones mean to you?' then you shall tell them that the waters of the Jordan were cut off before the ark of the covenant of the Lord. When it passed over the Jordan, the waters of the Jordan were cut off.

chaptersContent.title: Circumcision and Passover
chaptersContent.summary: Israel is circumcised and celebrates Passover in the Promised Land
chaptersContent.content: At that time the Lord said to Joshua, 'Make flint knives and circumcise the sons of Israel a second time.' And the Lord said to Joshua, 'Today I have rolled away the reproach of Egypt from you.' And the manna ceased the day after they ate of the produce of the land.

chaptersContent.title: The Fall of Jericho
chaptersContent.summary: The walls of Jericho fall after Israel marches around the city
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said to Joshua, 'See, I have given Jericho into your hand, with its king and mighty men of valor.' So the people shouted, and the trumpets were blown. As soon as the people heard the sound of the trumpet, the people shouted a great shout, and the wall fell down flat.

chaptersContent.title: Achan's Sin
chaptersContent.summary: Israel is defeated at Ai because of Achan's sin
chaptersContent.content: Israel has sinned; they have transgressed my covenant that I commanded them. They have taken some of the devoted things; they have stolen and lied and put them among their own belongings. Therefore the people of Israel cannot stand before their enemies.

chaptersContent.title: The Conquest of Ai
chaptersContent.summary: Israel defeats Ai using an ambush strategy
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said to Joshua, 'Do not fear and do not be dismayed. Take all the fighting men with you, and arise, go up to Ai. See, I have given into your hand the king of Ai, and his people, and his city, and his land.'

chaptersContent.title: The Gibeonite Deception
