chaptersContent.summary: The Gibeonites deceive Israel into making a treaty
chaptersContent.content: So the men took some of their provisions, but did not ask counsel from the Lord. And Joshua made peace with them and made a covenant with them, to let them live, and the leaders of the congregation swore to them. But all the leaders said to all the congregation, 'We have sworn to them by the Lord.'

chaptersContent.title: The Sun Stands Still
chaptersContent.summary: Joshua defeats five kings and the sun stands still
chaptersContent.content: At that time Joshua spoke to the Lord in the day when the Lord gave the Amorites over to the sons of Israel, and he said in the sight of Israel, 'Sun, stand still at Gibeon, and moon, in the Valley of Aijalon.' And the sun stood still, and the moon stopped.

chaptersContent.title: Conquest of Northern Canaan
chaptersContent.summary: Joshua defeats the northern kings and conquers the land
chaptersContent.content: Just as the Lord had commanded Moses his servant, so Moses commanded Joshua, and so Joshua did. He left nothing undone of all that the Lord had commanded Moses. Joshua made war a long time with all those kings. So Joshua took the whole land.

chaptersContent.title: List of Defeated Kings
chaptersContent.summary: A summary of all the kings defeated by Moses and Joshua
chaptersContent.content: Moses, the servant of the Lord, and the people of Israel defeated them. And Moses the servant of the Lord gave their land for a possession to the Reubenites and the Gadites and the half-tribe of Manasseh. In all, thirty-one kings.

chaptersContent.title: Land Still to Be Conquered
chaptersContent.summary: God tells Joshua about the remaining land to be conquered
chaptersContent.content: Now Joshua was old and advanced in years, and the Lord said to him, 'You are old and advanced in years, and there remains yet very much land to possess.' But to the tribe of Levi Moses gave no inheritance; the Lord God of Israel is their inheritance.

chaptersContent.title: Caleb's Inheritance
chaptersContent.summary: Caleb receives his inheritance in Hebron
chaptersContent.content: And Moses swore on that day, saying, 'Surely the land on which your foot has trodden shall be an inheritance for you and your children forever, because you have wholly followed the Lord my God.' So now give me this hill country of which the Lord spoke on that day.

chaptersContent.title: Judah's Territory
chaptersContent.summary: The boundaries and cities of Judah's inheritance
chaptersContent.content: According to the commandment of the Lord to Joshua, he gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh a portion among the people of Judah, Kiriath-arba, that is, Hebron (Arba was the father of Anak). And Caleb drove out from there the three sons of Anak.

chaptersContent.title: Ephraim and Manasseh's Territory
chaptersContent.summary: The boundaries of Ephraim and the half-tribe of Manasseh
chaptersContent.content: The people of Joseph, Manasseh and Ephraim, received their inheritance. The territory of the people of Ephraim by their clans was as follows: the boundary of their inheritance was Ataroth-addar to Upper Beth-horon. However, they did not drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer.

chaptersContent.title: Manasseh's Territory
chaptersContent.summary: The boundaries and cities of the half-tribe of Manasseh
chaptersContent.content: They approached Eleazar the priest and Joshua the son of Nun and the leaders and said, 'The Lord commanded Moses to give us an inheritance along with our brothers.' So according to the commandment of the Lord, he gave them an inheritance among the brothers of their father.

chaptersContent.title: The Tabernacle at Shiloh
chaptersContent.summary: The tabernacle is set up at Shiloh and land is surveyed
chaptersContent.content: Then the whole congregation of the people of Israel assembled at Shiloh and set up the tent of meeting there. The land lay subdued before them. Joshua said to the people of Israel, 'How long will you put off going in to take possession of the land, which the Lord, the God of your fathers, has given you?'

chaptersContent.title: Benjamin's Territory
chaptersContent.summary: The boundaries and cities of Benjamin's inheritance
chaptersContent.content: The inheritance of the people of Simeon formed part of the territory of the people of Judah. Because the portion of the people of Judah was too large for them, the people of Simeon obtained an inheritance in the midst of their inheritance.

chaptersContent.title: Cities of Refuge
chaptersContent.summary: Six cities of refuge are designated for accidental killers
chaptersContent.content: Say to the people of Israel, 'Appoint the cities of refuge, of which I spoke to you through Moses, that the manslayer who strikes any person without intent or unknowingly may flee there. They shall be for you a refuge from the avenger of blood.'

chaptersContent.title: Levi's Cities
chaptersContent.summary: The Levites receive cities and pasturelands throughout Israel
chaptersContent.content: And they said to them at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, 'The Lord commanded through Moses that we be given cities to dwell in, along with their pasturelands for our livestock.' So by command of the Lord the people of Israel gave the Levites the following cities and pasturelands out of their inheritance.

chaptersContent.title: Eastern Tribes Return Home
chaptersContent.summary: The eastern tribes return to their land across the Jordan
chaptersContent.content: Only be very careful to observe the commandment and the law that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you, to love the Lord your God, and to walk in all his ways and to keep his commandments and to cling to him and to serve him with all your heart and with all your soul.'

chaptersContent.title: Joshua's Farewell Address
chaptersContent.summary: Joshua gives his final words to Israel's leaders
chaptersContent.content: And you have seen all that the Lord your God has done to all these nations for your sake, for it is the Lord your God who has fought for you. But you shall cling to the Lord your God just as you have done to this day. Be very careful, therefore, to love the Lord your God.

chaptersContent.title: The Covenant Renewed
chaptersContent.summary: Joshua challenges Israel to choose whom they will serve
chaptersContent.content: Now therefore fear the Lord and serve him in sincerity and in faithfulness. Put away the gods that your fathers served beyond the River and in Egypt, and serve the Lord. And if it is evil in your eyes to serve the Lord, choose this day whom you will serve. But as for me and my house, we will serve the Lord.

books.name: Judges
books.description: The period of judges and Israel's cycle of sin and deliverance
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Judah's Conquest
chaptersContent.summary: Judah leads the conquest of Canaan after Joshua's death
chaptersContent.content: After the death of Joshua, the people of Israel inquired of the Lord, 'Who shall go up first for us against the Canaanites, to fight against them?' The Lord said, 'Judah shall go up; behold, I have given the land into his hand.' And the Lord was with Judah, and he took possession of the hill country, but he could not drive out the inhabitants of the plain because they had chariots of iron.

chaptersContent.title: Israel's Disobedience
chaptersContent.summary: Israel's failure to drive out the Canaanites leads to cycles of sin
chaptersContent.content: And the people of Israel did what was evil in the sight of the Lord and served the Baals. Then the Lord raised up judges, who saved them out of the hand of those who plundered them. Whenever the Lord raised up judges for them, the Lord was with the judge, and he saved them from the hand of their enemies all the days of the judge.

chaptersContent.title: The First Judges
chaptersContent.summary: Othniel, Ehud, and Shamgar deliver Israel from oppression
chaptersContent.content: But when the people of Israel cried out to the Lord, the Lord raised up a deliverer for the people of Israel, who saved them, Othniel the son of Kenaz, Caleb's younger brother. And Ehud made for himself a sword with two edges, a cubit in length, and he bound it on his right thigh under his clothes.

chaptersContent.title: Deborah and Barak
chaptersContent.summary: Deborah leads Israel to victory over the Canaanites
chaptersContent.content: Now Deborah, a prophetess, the wife of Lappidoth, was judging Israel at that time. She sent and summoned Barak the son of Abinoam from Kedesh-naphtali and said to him, 'Has not the Lord, the God of Israel, commanded you, Go, gather your men at Mount Tabor.'

chaptersContent.title: Deborah's Song
chaptersContent.summary: Deborah and Barak sing a song of victory and praise
chaptersContent.content: Then Deborah and Barak the son of Abinoam sang on that day, saying, 'That the leaders took the lead in Israel, that the people offered themselves willingly, bless the Lord!' So may all your enemies perish, O Lord! But your friends be like the sun as he rises in his might.

chaptersContent.title: Gideon's Call
chaptersContent.summary: God calls Gideon to deliver Israel from the Midianites
chaptersContent.content: And the angel of the Lord appeared to him and said to him, 'The Lord is with you, O mighty man of valor.' And he said to him, 'Please, Lord, how can I save Israel? Behold, my clan is the weakest in Manasseh, and I am the least in my father's house.'

chaptersContent.title: Gideon's Victory
chaptersContent.summary: God gives victory through Gideon's small army of 300 men
chaptersContent.content: The Lord said to Gideon, 'The people with you are too many for me to give the Midianites into their hand, lest Israel boast over me, saying, "My own hand has saved me."' And the Lord said to Gideon, 'With the 300 men who lapped I will save you and give the Midianites into your hand.'

chaptersContent.title: Gideon's Rule and Death
chaptersContent.summary: Gideon refuses kingship but Israel falls into idolatry after his death
chaptersContent.content: Gideon said to them, 'I will not rule over you, and my son will not rule over you; the Lord will rule over you.' And Gideon made an ephod of it and put it in his city, in Ophrah. And all Israel whored after it there, and it became a snare to Gideon and to his family.

chaptersContent.title: Abimelech's Reign
chaptersContent.summary: Abimelech becomes king and brings destruction to Shechem
chaptersContent.content: And he went to his father's house at Ophrah and killed his brothers the sons of Jerubbaal, seventy men, on one stone. But Jotham ran away and fled and went to Beer and lived there, because of Abimelech his brother. Thus God returned the evil of Abimelech, which he committed against his father in killing his seventy brothers.

chaptersContent.title: Tola and Jair
chaptersContent.summary: Two minor judges who ruled Israel briefly
chaptersContent.content: After Abimelech there arose to save Israel Tola the son of Puah, son of Dodo, a man of Issachar, and he lived at Shamir in the hill country of Ephraim. And he judged Israel twenty-three years. Then he died and was buried at Shamir.

chaptersContent.title: Jephthah's Vow
chaptersContent.summary: Jephthah makes a rash vow and sacrifices his daughter
chaptersContent.content: And Jephthah made a vow to the Lord and said, 'If you will give the Ammonites into my hand, then whatever comes out from the doors of my house to meet me when I return in peace from the Ammonites shall be the Lord's, and I will offer it up for a burnt offering.'

chaptersContent.title: Jephthah's Conflict
chaptersContent.summary: Jephthah fights with Ephraim and dies
chaptersContent.content: And Jephthah said to them, 'I and my people had a great dispute with the Ammonites, and when I called you, you did not save me from their hand.' And the Gileadites captured the fords of the Jordan against the Ephraimites. And when any of the fugitives of Ephraim said, 'Let me go over,' the men of Gilead said to him, 'Are you an Ephraimite?'

chaptersContent.title: Samson's Birth Announced
chaptersContent.summary: An angel announces Samson's birth to Manoah and his wife
chaptersContent.content: And the angel of the Lord appeared to the woman and said to her, 'Behold, you are barren and have not borne children, but you shall conceive and bear a son. For behold, you shall conceive and bear a son. No razor shall come upon his head, for the child shall be a Nazirite to God from the womb.'

chaptersContent.title: Samson's Marriage
chaptersContent.summary: Samson marries a Philistine woman and begins his exploits
chaptersContent.content: But his father and mother said to him, 'Is there not a woman among the daughters of your relatives, or among all our people, that you must go to take a wife from the uncircumcised Philistines?' But Samson said to his father, 'Get her for me, for she is right in my eyes.'

chaptersContent.title: Samson's Revenge
chaptersContent.summary: Samson takes revenge on the Philistines for his wife's death
chaptersContent.content: So Samson went and caught 300 foxes and took torches. And he turned them tail to tail and put a torch between each pair of tails. And Samson said to them, 'This time I shall be innocent in regard to the Philistines, when I do them harm.'

chaptersContent.title: Samson's Death
chaptersContent.summary: Samson's final act of strength destroys the Philistine temple
chaptersContent.content: Then Samson called to the Lord and said, 'O Lord God, please remember me and please strengthen me only this once, O God, that I may be avenged on the Philistines for my two eyes.' And Samson grasped the two middle pillars on which the house rested, and he leaned his weight against them.

chaptersContent.title: Micah's Idol
chaptersContent.summary: A man named Micah makes an idol and hires a Levite priest
chaptersContent.content: And the man Micah had a shrine, and he made an ephod and household gods, and ordained one of his sons, who became his priest. In those days there was no king in Israel. Everyone did what was right in his own eyes. And Micah said, 'Now I know that the Lord will prosper me, because I have a Levite as priest.'

chaptersContent.title: Dan's Migration
chaptersContent.summary: The tribe of Dan migrates and takes Micah's priest and idols
chaptersContent.content: In those days there was no king in Israel. And in those days the tribe of the people of Dan was seeking for itself an inheritance to dwell in, for until then no inheritance among the tribes of Israel had fallen to them. And they took what Micah had made, and the priest who belonged to him.

chaptersContent.title: The Levite's Concubine
chaptersContent.summary: A Levite's concubine is brutally treated, leading to civil war
chaptersContent.content: In those days, when there was no king in Israel, a certain Levite was sojourning in the remote parts of the hill country of Ephraim, who took to himself a concubine from Bethlehem in Judah. And the men of the city, worthless fellows, surrounded the house, beating on the door.

chaptersContent.title: War Against Benjamin
chaptersContent.summary: Israel goes to war against Benjamin for the crime at Gibeah
chaptersContent.content: Then all the people of Israel came out, and the congregation was assembled as one man, from Dan to Beersheba, including the land of Gilead, to the Lord at Mizpah. Now then, give up the men, the worthless fellows in Gibeah, that we may put them to death and purge evil from Israel.'

chaptersContent.title: Wives for Benjamin
chaptersContent.summary: Israel provides wives for the remaining Benjaminites
chaptersContent.content: Now the men of Israel had sworn at Mizpah, 'No one of us shall give his daughter in marriage to Benjamin.' And the people came to Bethel and sat there till evening before God, and they lifted up their voices and wept bitterly. In those days there was no king in Israel. Everyone did what was right in his own eyes.

books.name: Ruth
books.description: The story of Ruth's loyalty and God's providence
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Ruth's Loyalty to Naomi
chaptersContent.summary: Ruth chooses to stay with Naomi after her husband's death
chaptersContent.content: But Ruth said, 'Do not urge me to leave you or to return from following you. For where you go I will go, and where you lodge I will lodge. Your people shall be my people, and your God my God.'

chaptersContent.title: Ruth Meets Boaz
chaptersContent.summary: Ruth gleans in Boaz's field and finds favor with him
chaptersContent.content: But Boaz answered her, 'All that you have done for your mother-in-law since the death of your husband has been fully told to me, and how you left your father and mother and your native land and came to a people that you did not know before.'

chaptersContent.title: Ruth's Request to Boaz
chaptersContent.summary: Ruth asks Boaz to be her kinsman-redeemer
chaptersContent.content: He said, 'Who are you?' And she answered, 'I am Ruth, your servant. Spread your wings over your servant, for you are a redeemer.'

chaptersContent.title: Boaz Redeems Ruth
chaptersContent.summary: Boaz marries Ruth and they become ancestors of David
chaptersContent.content: So Boaz took Ruth, and she became his wife. And he went in to her, and the Lord gave her conception, and she bore a son. And they named him Obed. He was the father of Jesse, the father of David.

books.name: 1 Samuel
books.description: The transition from judges to monarchy through Samuel, Saul, and David
books.author: Samuel and others

chaptersContent.title: Hannah's Prayer
chaptersContent.summary: Hannah prays for a son and dedicates Samuel to the Lord
chaptersContent.content: She was deeply distressed and prayed to the Lord and wept bitterly. And she vowed a vow and said, 'O Lord of hosts, if you will indeed look on the affliction of your servant and remember me and not forget your servant, but will give to your servant a son, then I will give him to the Lord all the days of his life.'

chaptersContent.title: Hannah's Song and Eli's Sons
chaptersContent.summary: Hannah praises God and Eli's wicked sons are condemned
chaptersContent.content: And Hannah prayed and said, 'My heart exults in the Lord; my horn is exalted in the Lord. My mouth derides my enemies, because I rejoice in your salvation. There is none holy like the Lord: there is none besides you; there is no rock like our God.'

chaptersContent.title: Samuel's Call
chaptersContent.summary: Young Samuel hears God's voice and becomes a prophet
chaptersContent.content: Therefore Eli said to Samuel, 'Go, lie down, and if he calls you, you shall say, "Speak, Lord, for your servant hears."' So Samuel went and lay down in his place. And the Lord came and stood, calling as at other times, 'Samuel! Samuel!' And Samuel said, 'Speak, for your servant hears.'

chaptersContent.title: The Ark Captured
chaptersContent.summary: The Philistines capture the ark and Eli's sons die
chaptersContent.content: And when the people came to the camp, the elders of Israel said, 'Why has the Lord defeated us today before the Philistines? Let us bring the ark of the covenant of the Lord here from Shiloh, that it may come among us and save us from the power of our enemies.'

chaptersContent.title: The Ark Among the Philistines
chaptersContent.summary: The ark causes trouble for the Philistines and their god Dagon
chaptersContent.content: And when the people of Ashdod rose early the next day, behold, Dagon had fallen face downward on the ground before the ark of the Lord. So they took Dagon and put him back in his place. But the hand of the Lord was heavy against the people of Ashdod, and he terrified and afflicted them with tumors.

chaptersContent.title: The Ark Returned
chaptersContent.summary: The Philistines return the ark with offerings to Israel
chaptersContent.content: They said, 'If you send away the ark of the God of Israel, do not send it empty, but by all means return him a guilt offering. Then you will be healed, and it will be known to you why his hand does not turn away from you.'

chaptersContent.title: Samuel Judges Israel
chaptersContent.summary: Samuel leads Israel to repentance and victory over the Philistines
chaptersContent.content: And Samuel said to all the house of Israel, 'If you are returning to the Lord with all your heart, then put away the foreign gods and the Ashtaroth from among you and direct your heart to the Lord and serve him only, and he will deliver you out of the hand of the Philistines.'

chaptersContent.title: Israel Demands a King
chaptersContent.summary: Israel asks for a king and Samuel warns them of the consequences
chaptersContent.content: And said to him, 'Behold, you are old and your sons do not walk in your ways. Now appoint for us a king to judge us like all the nations.' But the Lord said to Samuel, 'Obey the voice of the people in all that they say to you, for they have not rejected you, but they have rejected me from being king over them.'

chaptersContent.title: Saul Meets Samuel
chaptersContent.summary: Saul searches for his father's donkeys and meets Samuel
chaptersContent.content: And he said to him, 'Behold, there is a man of God in this city, and he is a man who is held in honor; all that he says comes true. So now let us go there. Perhaps he can tell us the way we should go.'

chaptersContent.title: Saul Anointed King
chaptersContent.summary: Samuel anoints Saul as king and gives him signs
chaptersContent.content: Then Samuel took a flask of oil and poured it on his head and kissed him and said, 'Has not the Lord anointed you to be prince over his people Israel? And you shall reign over the people of the Lord and you will save them from the hand of their surrounding enemies.'

chaptersContent.title: Saul's First Victory
chaptersContent.summary: Saul leads Israel to victory over the Ammonites
chaptersContent.content: And the Spirit of God rushed upon Saul when he heard these words, and his anger was greatly kindled. And he took a yoke of oxen and cut them in pieces and sent them throughout all the territory of Israel by the hand of messengers, saying, 'Whoever does not come out after Saul and Samuel, so shall it be done to his oxen!'

chaptersContent.title: Samuel's Farewell Speech
chaptersContent.summary: Samuel addresses Israel and calls them to faithfulness
chaptersContent.content: If you will fear the Lord and serve him and obey his voice and not rebel against the commandment of the Lord, and if both you and the king who reigns over you will follow the Lord your God, it will be well. Only fear the Lord and serve him faithfully with all your heart. For consider what great things he has done for you.

chaptersContent.title: Saul's Unlawful Sacrifice
chaptersContent.summary: Saul offers sacrifice unlawfully and loses his kingdom
chaptersContent.content: And Samuel said, 'What have you done?' And Saul said, 'When I saw that the people were scattering from me, and that you did not come within the days appointed, and that the Philistines had mustered at Michmash, I said, Now the Philistines will come down against me at Gilgal, and I have not sought the favor of the Lord.'

chaptersContent.title: Jonathan's Victory
chaptersContent.summary: Jonathan and his armor-bearer defeat the Philistines
chaptersContent.content: Jonathan said to the young man who carried his armor, 'Come, let us go over to the garrison of these uncircumcised. It may be that the Lord will work for us, for nothing can hinder the Lord from saving by many or by few.'

chaptersContent.title: Saul's Disobedience
chaptersContent.summary: Saul spares Agag and the best of the Amalekites
chaptersContent.content: But Saul and the people spared Agag and the best of the sheep and of the oxen and of the fattened calves and the lambs, and all that was good, and would not utterly destroy them. All that was despised and worthless they utterly destroyed.

chaptersContent.title: David Anointed
chaptersContent.summary: Samuel anoints David as king and the Spirit comes upon him
chaptersContent.content: The Lord said to Samuel, 'How long will you grieve over Saul, since I have rejected him from being king over Israel? Fill your horn with oil, and go. I will send you to Jesse the Bethlehemite, for I have provided for myself a king among his sons.'

chaptersContent.title: David and Goliath
chaptersContent.summary: Young David defeats the giant Goliath with faith in God
chaptersContent.content: Then David said to the Philistine, 'You come to me with a sword and with a spear and with a javelin, but I come to you in the name of the Lord of hosts, the God of the armies of Israel, whom you have defied. And that all this assembly may know that the Lord saves not with sword and spear. For the battle is the Lord's, and he will give you into our hand.'

chaptersContent.title: David and Jonathan
chaptersContent.summary: David and Jonathan become friends, and Saul becomes jealous
chaptersContent.content: As soon as he had finished speaking to Saul, the soul of Jonathan was knit to the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul. And Jonathan made a covenant with David, because he loved him as his own soul. And Saul eyed David from that day on.

chaptersContent.title: Saul Tries to Kill David
chaptersContent.summary: Saul attempts to kill David but Jonathan and Michal help him escape
chaptersContent.content: And Saul spoke to Jonathan his son and to all his servants, that they should kill David. But Jonathan, Saul's son, delighted much in David. And Jonathan told David, 'Saul my father seeks to kill you. Therefore be on your guard in the morning. Stay in a secret place and hide yourself.'

chaptersContent.title: Jonathan Warns David
chaptersContent.summary: Jonathan helps David escape and they make a covenant
chaptersContent.content: And David vowed again, saying, 'Your father knows well that I have found favor in your eyes, and he thinks, Do not let Jonathan know this, lest he be grieved. But truly, as the Lord lives and as your soul lives, there is but a step between me and death.'

chaptersContent.title: David at Nob
chaptersContent.summary: David receives bread and Goliath's sword from Ahimelech
chaptersContent.content: Then David came to Nob to Ahimelech the priest. And Ahimelech came to meet David trembling and said to him, 'Why are you alone, and no one with you?' And the priest said, 'The sword of Goliath the Philistine, whom you struck down in the Valley of Elah, behold, it is wrapped in a cloth behind the ephod.'

chaptersContent.title: David at Adullam
chaptersContent.summary: David gathers followers and Saul kills the priests of Nob
chaptersContent.content: David departed from there and escaped to the cave of Adullam. And when his brothers and all his father's house heard it, they went down there to him. And everyone who was in distress, and everyone who was in debt, and everyone who was bitter in soul, gathered to him.

chaptersContent.title: David Saves Keilah
chaptersContent.summary: David saves Keilah from the Philistines but must flee from Saul
chaptersContent.content: Now they told David, 'Behold, the Philistines are fighting against Keilah and are robbing the threshing floors.' Therefore David inquired of the Lord, 'Shall I go and attack these Philistines?' And the Lord said to David, 'Go and attack the Philistines and save Keilah.'

chaptersContent.title: David Spares Saul
chaptersContent.summary: David shows mercy by sparing Saul's life in the cave
chaptersContent.content: He said to his men, 'The Lord forbid that I should do this thing to my lord, the Lord's anointed, to put out my hand against him, seeing he is the Lord's anointed.' Behold, this day your eyes have seen how the Lord gave you today into my hand in the cave. And some told me to kill you, but I spared you.

chaptersContent.title: David and Abigail
chaptersContent.summary: Abigail prevents David from killing Nabal and becomes his wife
chaptersContent.content: Now the name of the man was Nabal, and the name of his wife Abigail. The woman was discerning and beautiful, but the man was harsh and badly behaved; he was a Calebite. And blessed be your discretion, and blessed be you, who have kept me this day from bloodguilt and from avenging myself with my own hand!'

chaptersContent.title: David Spares Saul Again
chaptersContent.summary: David spares Saul's life a second time in the wilderness
chaptersContent.content: But David said to Abishai, 'Do not destroy him, for who can put out his hand against the Lord's anointed and be guiltless?' And David said, 'As the Lord lives, the Lord will strike him, or his day will come to die, or he will go down into battle and perish.'

chaptersContent.title: David Among the Philistines
chaptersContent.summary: David lives in Philistine territory to escape Saul
chaptersContent.content: Then David said in his heart, 'Now I shall perish one day by the hand of Saul. There is nothing better for me than that I should escape to the land of the Philistines. Then Saul will despair of seeking me any longer within the borders of Israel, and I shall escape out of his hand.'

chaptersContent.title: Saul and the Witch of Endor
chaptersContent.summary: Saul consults a medium and learns of his impending death
chaptersContent.content: And when Saul inquired of the Lord, the Lord did not answer him, either by dreams, or by Urim, or by prophets. Then Saul said to his servants, 'Seek out for me a woman who is a medium, that I may go to her and inquire of her.' And his servants said to him, 'Behold, there is a medium at En-dor.'

chaptersContent.title: David Rejected by Philistines
chaptersContent.summary: The Philistine commanders reject David from their army
chaptersContent.content: But the commanders of the Philistines were angry with him. And the commanders of the Philistines said to him, 'Send the man back, that he may return to the place to which you have assigned him. He shall not go down with us to battle, lest in the battle he become an adversary to us.'

chaptersContent.title: David Recovers His Family
chaptersContent.summary: David recovers his family and possessions from the Amalekites
chaptersContent.content: And David was greatly distressed, for the people spoke of stoning him, because all the people were bitter in soul, each for his sons and daughters. But David strengthened himself in the Lord his God. And David inquired of the Lord, 'Shall I pursue after this band?'

chaptersContent.title: Saul's Death
chaptersContent.summary: Saul and Jonathan die in battle against the Philistines
chaptersContent.content: Then Saul said to his armor-bearer, 'Draw your sword, and thrust me through with it, lest these uncircumcised come and thrust me through, and mistreat me.' But his armor-bearer would not, for he feared greatly. Therefore Saul took his own sword and fell upon it.

books.name: 2 Samuel
books.description: David's reign as king of Israel, his triumphs and failures
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: David Learns of Saul's Death
chaptersContent.summary: David mourns Saul and Jonathan's death and executes the Amalekite
chaptersContent.content: Then David took hold of his clothes and tore them, and so did all the men who were with him. And they mourned and wept and fasted until evening for Saul and for Jonathan his son and for the people of the Lord and for the house of Israel, because they had fallen by the sword.

chaptersContent.title: David Anointed King of Judah
chaptersContent.summary: David is anointed king of Judah while Ish-bosheth rules Israel
chaptersContent.content: And the men of Judah came, and there they anointed David king over the house of Judah. When they told David, 'It was the men of Jabesh-gilead who buried Saul,' David sent messengers to the men of Jabesh-gilead and said to them, 'May you be blessed by the Lord, because you showed this loyalty to Saul your lord and buried him.'

chaptersContent.title: Civil War Between Houses
chaptersContent.summary: Conflict between David's house and Saul's house continues
chaptersContent.content: There was a long war between the house of Saul and the house of David. And David grew stronger and stronger, while the house of Saul became weaker and weaker. And Abner said to David, 'I will make a covenant with you. But one thing I require of you, that is, you shall not see my face unless you first bring Michal, Saul's daughter.'

chaptersContent.title: Ish-bosheth Murdered
chaptersContent.summary: Ish-bosheth is murdered by his own men, and David executes them
chaptersContent.content: And behold, the doorkeeper of the house had been cleaning wheat, but she grew drowsy and slept. So Rechab and Baanah his brother slipped in. And they came into the midst of the house as if to get wheat, and they stabbed him in the stomach.

chaptersContent.title: David King Over All Israel
chaptersContent.summary: David becomes king over all Israel and captures Jerusalem
chaptersContent.content: So all the elders of Israel came to the king at Hebron, and King David made a covenant with them at Hebron before the Lord, and they anointed David king over Israel. And David lived in the stronghold and called it the city of David. And David built all around from the Millo inward.

chaptersContent.title: The Ark Brought to Jerusalem
chaptersContent.summary: David brings the ark to Jerusalem with great celebration
chaptersContent.content: And David and all the house of Israel were celebrating before the Lord, with songs and lyres and harps and tambourines and castanets and cymbals. And David danced before the Lord with all his might. And David was wearing a linen ephod.

chaptersContent.title: The Davidic Covenant
chaptersContent.summary: God promises David an eternal kingdom through his descendants
chaptersContent.content: When your days are fulfilled and you lie down with your fathers, I will raise up your offspring after you, who shall come from your body, and I will establish his kingdom. He shall build a house for my name, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom forever.

chaptersContent.title: David's Victories
chaptersContent.summary: David defeats various enemies and establishes his kingdom
chaptersContent.content: And David put garrisons in Aram of Damascus, and the Syrians became servants to David and brought tribute. And the Lord gave victory to David wherever he went. And he put garrisons in Edom, and all the Edomites became David's servants.

chaptersContent.title: David and Mephibosheth
chaptersContent.summary: David shows kindness to Jonathan's son Mephibosheth
chaptersContent.content: And David said, 'Is there still anyone left of the house of Saul, that I may show him kindness for Jonathan's sake?' And David said to him, 'Do not fear, for I will show you kindness for the sake of your father Jonathan, and I will restore to you all the land of Saul your father.'

chaptersContent.title: War with Ammon and Syria
chaptersContent.summary: David defeats the Ammonites and their Syrian allies
chaptersContent.content: Be strong, and let us be courageous for our people, and for the cities of our God, and may the Lord do what seems good to him.' And when all the kings who were servants of Hadadezer saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they made peace with Israel and became subject to them.

chaptersContent.title: David's Sin with Bathsheba
chaptersContent.summary: David commits adultery and arranges Uriah's death
chaptersContent.content: It happened, late one afternoon, when David arose from his couch and was walking on the roof of the king's house, that he saw from the roof a woman bathing; and the woman was very beautiful. So David sent messengers and took her, and she came to him, and he lay with her.

chaptersContent.title: Nathan's Rebuke and David's Repentance
chaptersContent.summary: Nathan confronts David about his sin, and David repents
chaptersContent.content: Nathan said to David, 'You are the man! Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, "I anointed you king over Israel, and I delivered you out of the hand of Saul."' David said to Nathan, 'I have sinned against the Lord.' And Nathan said to David, 'The Lord also has put away your sin; you shall not die.'

chaptersContent.title: Amnon and Tamar
chaptersContent.summary: Amnon rapes his sister Tamar, and Absalom kills him
chaptersContent.content: But he would not listen to her, and being stronger than she, he violated her and lay with her. Then Amnon hated her with very great hatred, so that the hatred with which he hated her was greater than the love with which he had loved her.

chaptersContent.title: Absalom's Return
chaptersContent.summary: Joab arranges for Absalom to return to Jerusalem
chaptersContent.content: We must all die; we are like water spilled on the ground, which cannot be gathered up again. But God will not take away life, and he devises means so that the banished one will not remain an outcast. And the king said, 'Let him dwell apart in his own house; he is not to come into my presence.'

chaptersContent.title: Absalom's Conspiracy
chaptersContent.summary: Absalom conspires against David and forces him to flee
chaptersContent.content: So Absalom stole the hearts of the men of Israel. And a messenger came to David, saying, 'The hearts of the men of Israel have gone after Absalom.' Then David said to all his servants who were with him at Jerusalem, 'Arise, and let us flee, or else there will be no escape for us from Absalom.'

chaptersContent.title: David's Flight
chaptersContent.summary: David flees Jerusalem and faces various trials
chaptersContent.content: And David said to Abishai and to all his servants, 'Behold, my own son seeks my life; how much more now may this Benjaminite! Leave him alone, and let him curse, for the Lord has told him to. It may be that the Lord will look on the wrong done to me.'

chaptersContent.title: Ahithophel's Counsel
chaptersContent.summary: Ahithophel advises Absalom, but Hushai's counsel prevails
chaptersContent.content: And Absalom and all the men of Israel said, 'The counsel of Hushai the Archite is better than the counsel of Ahithophel.' For the Lord had ordained to defeat the good counsel of Ahithophel, so that the Lord might bring harm upon Absalom.

chaptersContent.title: Absalom's Death
chaptersContent.summary: Absalom is killed by Joab despite David's orders
chaptersContent.content: And the king ordered Joab and Abishai and Ittai, 'Deal gently for my sake with the young man Absalom.' And all the people heard when the king gave orders to all the commanders about Absalom. And Joab said, 'I will not waste time like this with you.'

chaptersContent.title: David's Return
chaptersContent.summary: David returns to Jerusalem and deals with various issues
chaptersContent.content: So the king arose and took his seat in the gate. And all the people were told, 'Behold, the king is sitting in the gate.' And all the people came before the king. Now Israel had fled every man to his own home. And he swayed the heart of all the men of Judah as one man.

chaptersContent.title: Sheba's Rebellion
chaptersContent.summary: Sheba leads a rebellion against David, but it is crushed
chaptersContent.content: Now there happened to be there a worthless man, whose name was Sheba, the son of Bichri, a Benjaminite. And he blew the trumpet and said, 'We have no portion in David, and we have no inheritance in the son of Jesse; every man to his tents, O Israel!'

chaptersContent.title: The Gibeonites Avenged
chaptersContent.summary: David avenges the Gibeonites and defeats the Philistines
chaptersContent.content: Now there was a famine in the days of David for three years, year after year. And David sought the face of the Lord. And the Lord said, 'There is bloodguilt on Saul and on his house, because he put the Gibeonites to death.'

chaptersContent.title: David's Song of Deliverance
chaptersContent.summary: David sings a song praising God for his deliverance
chaptersContent.content: And David spoke to the Lord the words of this song on the day when the Lord delivered him from the hand of all his enemies, and from the hand of Saul. He said, 'The Lord is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer, my God, my rock, in whom I take refuge.'

chaptersContent.title: David's Last Words
chaptersContent.summary: David's final words and the list of his mighty men
chaptersContent.content: The Spirit of the Lord speaks by me; his word is on my tongue. The God of Israel has spoken; the Rock of Israel has said to me: When one rules justly over men, ruling in the fear of God, he dawns on them like the morning light.

chaptersContent.title: David's Census
chaptersContent.summary: David takes a census and faces God's judgment
chaptersContent.content: But David's heart struck him after he had numbered the people. And David said to the Lord, 'I have sinned greatly in what I have done. But now, O Lord, please take away the iniquity of your servant, for I have done very foolishly.'

books.name: 1 Kings
books.description: Solomon's reign and the beginning of the divided kingdom
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: David's Final Days
chaptersContent.summary: Adonijah attempts to seize the throne while David is dying
chaptersContent.content: Now Adonijah the son of Haggith exalted himself, saying, 'I will be king.' And he prepared for himself chariots and horsemen, and fifty men to run before him. But as the Lord lives, who has redeemed my soul out of every adversity, as I swore to you by the Lord, the God of Israel, saying, 'Solomon your son shall reign after me, and he shall sit on my throne in my place,' even so will I do this day.

chaptersContent.title: Solomon's Throne Established
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon secures his reign and deals with his enemies
chaptersContent.content: And keep the charge of the Lord your God, walking in his ways and keeping his statutes, his commandments, his rules, and his testimonies, as it is written in the Law of Moses, that you may prosper in all that you do and wherever you turn. So Solomon sat on the throne of David his father, and his kingdom was firmly established. So the kingdom was established in the hand of Solomon.

chaptersContent.title: Solomon's Wisdom
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon asks for wisdom and God grants his request
chaptersContent.content: Give your servant therefore an understanding mind to govern your people, that I may discern between good and evil, for who is able to govern this your great people? Behold, I now do according to your word. Behold, I give you a wise and discerning mind, so that none like you has been before you and none like you shall arise after you.

chaptersContent.title: Solomon's Officials
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon's administrative structure and his great wisdom
chaptersContent.content: Judah and Israel were as many as the sand by the sea. They ate and drank and were happy. And Judah and Israel lived in safety, from Dan even to Beersheba, every man under his vine and under his fig tree, all the days of Solomon. And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding beyond measure, and breadth of mind like the sand on the seashore.

chaptersContent.title: Preparations for the Temple
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon makes preparations to build the temple
chaptersContent.content: And so I intend to build a house for the name of the Lord my God, as the Lord said to David my father, 'Your son, whom I will set on your throne in your place, shall build the house for my name.' And the Lord gave Solomon wisdom, as he promised him. And there was peace between Hiram and Solomon, and the two of them made a treaty.

chaptersContent.title: Temple Construction
chaptersContent.summary: The construction of Solomon's temple begins
chaptersContent.content: In the four hundred and eightieth year after the people of Israel came out of the land of Egypt, in the fourth year of Solomon's reign over Israel, in the month of Ziv, which is the second month, he began to build the house of the Lord. When the house was built, it was with stone prepared at the quarry, so that neither hammer nor axe nor any tool of iron was heard in the house while it was being built.

chaptersContent.title: Solomon's Palace
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon builds his palace and completes the temple furnishings
chaptersContent.content: Solomon was building his own house thirteen years, and he finished his entire house. He was the son of a widow of the tribe of Naphtali, and his father was a man of Tyre, a worker in bronze. And he was full of wisdom, understanding, and skill for making any work in bronze. So all the work that King Solomon did on the house of the Lord was finished.

chaptersContent.title: Temple Dedication
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon dedicates the temple and God's glory fills it
chaptersContent.content: And when the priests came out of the Holy Place, a cloud filled the house of the Lord, so that the priests could not stand to minister because of the cloud, for the glory of the Lord filled the house of the Lord. But will God indeed dwell on the earth? Behold, heaven and the highest heaven cannot contain you; how much less this house that I have built!

chaptersContent.title: God's Promise to Solomon
chaptersContent.summary: God appears to Solomon and renews the covenant
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said to him, 'I have heard your prayer and your plea, which you have made before me. I have consecrated this house that you have built, to put my name there forever. My eyes and my heart will be there for all time. But if you turn aside from following me, you or your children, and do not keep my commandments and my statutes that I have set before you, but go and serve other gods and worship them.

chaptersContent.title: Queen of Sheba
chaptersContent.summary: The Queen of Sheba visits Solomon and is amazed by his wisdom
chaptersContent.content: Now when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon concerning the name of the Lord, she came to test him with hard questions. But I did not believe the reports until I came and my own eyes had seen it. And behold, the half was not told me. Your wisdom and prosperity surpass the report that I heard. Blessed be the Lord your God, who has delighted in you and set you on the throne of Israel!

chaptersContent.title: Solomon's Downfall
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon's foreign wives lead him into idolatry
chaptersContent.content: For when Solomon was old his wives turned away his heart after other gods, and his heart was not wholly true to the Lord his God, as was the heart of David his father. So Solomon did what was evil in the sight of the Lord and did not wholly follow the Lord, as David his father had done. Therefore the Lord said to Solomon, 'Since this has been your practice and you have not kept my covenant and my statutes that I have commanded you, I will surely tear the kingdom from you.'

chaptersContent.title: Rehoboam's Folly
chaptersContent.summary: Rehoboam rejects the elders' advice and the kingdom divides
chaptersContent.content: And they said to him, 'If you will be a servant to this people today and serve them, and speak good words to them when you answer them, then they will be your servants forever.' But he abandoned the counsel that the old men gave him and took counsel with the young men who had grown up with him and stood before him. So Israel has been in rebellion against the house of David to this day.

chaptersContent.title: Jeroboam's Idolatry
chaptersContent.summary: Jeroboam sets up golden calves and false worship
chaptersContent.content: So the king took counsel and made two calves of gold. And he said to the people, 'You have been going up to Jerusalem long enough. Behold your gods, O Israel, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.' And this thing became a sin, for the people went as far as Dan to be before one. He also made temples on high places and appointed priests from among all the people.

chaptersContent.title: Ahijah's Prophecy
chaptersContent.summary: Ahijah prophesies judgment against Jeroboam's house
chaptersContent.content: Go, tell Jeroboam, 'Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: Because I exalted you from among the people and made you leader over my people Israel and tore the kingdom away from the house of David and gave it to you, and yet you have not been like my servant David, who kept my commandments and followed me with all his heart, doing only that which was right in my eyes.

chaptersContent.title: Abijam and Asa
chaptersContent.summary: The reigns of Abijam and Asa in Judah
chaptersContent.content: And he walked in all the sins that his father did before him, and his heart was not wholly true to the Lord his God, as the heart of David his father had been. And Asa did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as David his father had done. But the high places were not taken away. Nevertheless, the heart of Asa was wholly true to the Lord all his days.

chaptersContent.title: Northern Kingdom Kings
chaptersContent.summary: A series of wicked kings in the northern kingdom
chaptersContent.content: And moreover, the word of the Lord came by the prophet Jehu the son of Hanani against Baasha and his house, both because of all the evil that he did in the sight of the Lord, provoking him to anger with the work of his hands, in being like the house of Jeroboam, and also because he destroyed it. And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord and walked in the way of Jeroboam.

chaptersContent.title: Elijah and the Widow
chaptersContent.summary: Elijah is fed by a widow and raises her son from the dead
chaptersContent.content: Now Elijah the Tishbite, of Tishbe in Gilead, said to Ahab, 'As the Lord, the God of Israel, lives, before whom I stand, there shall be neither dew nor rain these years, except by my word.' For thus says the Lord, the God of Israel: 'The jar of flour shall not be spent, and the jug of oil shall not be empty, until the day that the Lord sends rain upon the earth.'

chaptersContent.title: Elijah and the Prophets of Baal
chaptersContent.summary: Elijah defeats the prophets of Baal on Mount Carmel
chaptersContent.content: And Elijah came near to all the people and said, 'How long will you go limping between two different opinions? If the Lord is God, follow him; but if Baal, then follow him.' And the people did not answer him a word. Answer me, O Lord, answer me, that this people may know that you, O Lord, are God, and that you have turned their hearts back.

chaptersContent.title: Elijah's Flight
chaptersContent.summary: Elijah flees from Jezebel and encounters God at Horeb
chaptersContent.content: But he himself went a day's journey into the wilderness and came and sat down under a broom tree. And he asked that he might die, saying, 'It is enough; now, O Lord, take away my life, for I am no better than my fathers.' And after the earthquake a fire, but the Lord was not in the fire. And after the fire the sound of a low whisper.

chaptersContent.title: Ahab's Victories
chaptersContent.summary: Ahab defeats the Syrians with God's help
chaptersContent.content: And behold, a prophet came near to Ahab king of Israel and said, 'Thus says the Lord, Have you seen all this great multitude? Behold, I will give it into your hand this day, and you shall know that I am the Lord.' And the prophet came near to the king of Israel and said to him, 'Come, strengthen yourself, and consider well what you have to do, for in the spring the king of Syria will come up against you.'

chaptersContent.title: Naboth's Vineyard
chaptersContent.summary: Ahab and Jezebel murder Naboth to steal his vineyard
chaptersContent.content: And after this Ahab said to Naboth, 'Give me your vineyard, that I may have it for a vegetable garden, because it is near my house, and I will give you a better vineyard for it; or, if it seems good to you, I will give you its value in money.' And you shall say to him, 'Thus says the Lord: Have you killed and also taken possession?' And there was none who sold himself to do what was evil in the sight of the Lord like Ahab.

chaptersContent.title: Ahab's Death
chaptersContent.summary: Ahab dies in battle despite trying to disguise himself
chaptersContent.content: And he said, 'I saw all Israel scattered on the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd. And the Lord said, 'These have no master; let each return to his home in peace.' But a certain man drew his bow at random and struck the king of Israel between the scale armor and the breastplate. Therefore he said to the driver of his chariot, 'Turn around and carry me out of the battle, for I am wounded.'

books.name: 2 Kings
books.description: The divided kingdom and eventual exile of both Israel and Judah
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Ahaziah's Illness
chaptersContent.summary: Ahaziah seeks help from Baal-zebub and Elijah condemns him
chaptersContent.content: But the angel of the Lord said to Elijah the Tishbite, 'Arise, go up to meet the messengers of the king of Samaria, and say to them, Is it because there is no God in Israel that you are going to inquire of Baal-zebub, the god of Ekron? Now therefore thus says the Lord, You shall not come down from the bed to which you have gone up, but you shall surely die.'

chaptersContent.title: Elijah's Ascension
chaptersContent.summary: Elijah is taken up to heaven in a whirlwind, and Elisha receives his mantle
chaptersContent.content: When they had crossed, Elijah said to Elisha, 'Ask what I shall do for you, before I am taken from you.' And Elisha said, 'Please let there be a double portion of your spirit on me.' And as they still went on and talked, behold, chariots of fire and horses of fire separated the two of them. And Elijah went up by a whirlwind into heaven.

chaptersContent.title: Moab's Rebellion
chaptersContent.summary: Jehoram, Jehoshaphat, and the king of Edom defeat Moab
chaptersContent.content: And the king of Israel went with the king of Judah and the king of Edom. And when they had made a circuitous march of seven days, there was no water for the army or for the animals that followed them. And Elisha said, 'As the Lord of hosts lives, before whom I stand, were it not that I have regard for Jehoshaphat the king of Judah, I would neither look at you nor see you.'

chaptersContent.title: Elisha's Miracles
chaptersContent.summary: Elisha performs several miracles including raising a child from the dead
chaptersContent.content: Then she came and told the man of God, and he said, 'Go, sell the oil and pay your debts, and you and your sons can live on the rest.' And he said, 'At this season, about this time next year, you shall embrace a son.' And he went up and lay on the child, putting his mouth on his mouth, his eyes on his eyes, and his hands on his hands.

chaptersContent.title: Naaman's Healing
chaptersContent.summary: Naaman the Syrian is healed of leprosy through Elisha
chaptersContent.content: And Elisha sent a messenger to him, saying, 'Go and wash in the Jordan seven times, and your flesh shall be restored, and you shall be clean.' So he went down and dipped himself seven times in the Jordan, according to the word of the man of God, and his flesh was restored like the flesh of a little child, and he was clean.

chaptersContent.title: The Floating Axe Head
chaptersContent.summary: Elisha makes an iron axe head float and reveals enemy plans
chaptersContent.content: And the man of God said, 'Where did it fall?' When he showed him the place, he cut off a stick and threw it in there and made the iron float. And he said, 'Do not be afraid, for those who are with us are more than those who are with them.' Then Elisha prayed and said, 'O Lord, please open his eyes that he may see.'

chaptersContent.title: The Siege Lifted
chaptersContent.summary: God causes the Syrians to flee and Samaria is delivered
chaptersContent.content: But Elisha said, 'Hear the word of the Lord: thus says the Lord, Tomorrow about this time a seah of fine flour shall be sold for a shekel, and two seahs of barley for a shekel, at the gate of Samaria.' For the Lord had made the army of the Syrians hear the sound of chariots and of horses, the sound of a great army.

chaptersContent.title: The Shunammite Woman
chaptersContent.summary: The Shunammite woman's land is restored and Hazael becomes king
chaptersContent.content: Now Elisha had said to the woman whose son he had restored to life, 'Arise, and depart with your household, and sojourn wherever you can, for the Lord has called for a famine, and it will come upon the land for seven years.' And Elisha said to him, 'Go, say to him, 'You shall certainly recover,' but the Lord has shown me that he shall certainly die.'

chaptersContent.title: Jehu Anointed King
chaptersContent.summary: Jehu is anointed king and kills Joram and Ahaziah
chaptersContent.content: And he poured the oil on his head and said to him, 'Thus says the Lord, the God of Israel, I anoint you king over the people of the Lord, over Israel. And the whole house of Ahab shall perish; and I will cut off from Ahab every male, bond or free, in Israel. But Jehu drew his bow with his full strength, and shot Joram between the shoulders, so that the arrow pierced his heart.

chaptersContent.title: Jehu's Bloody Reign
chaptersContent.summary: Jehu destroys the house of Ahab and Baal worshipers
chaptersContent.content: Know then that there shall fall to the earth nothing of the word of the Lord, which the Lord spoke concerning the house of Ahab, for the Lord has done what he said by his servant Elijah. And he said, 'Come with me, and see my zeal for the Lord.' So he had him ride in his chariot. And the Lord said to Jehu, 'Because you have done well in carrying out what is right in my eyes.'

chaptersContent.title: Athaliah's Downfall
chaptersContent.summary: Joash is crowned king and Athaliah is killed
chaptersContent.content: In the seventh year Jehoiada sent and brought the captains of the Carites and of the guards, and had them come to him in the house of the Lord. And he brought out the king's son and put the crown on him and gave him the testimony. And they proclaimed him king and anointed him, and they clapped their hands and said, 'Long live the king!'

chaptersContent.title: Joash Repairs the Temple
chaptersContent.summary: Joash repairs the temple and is eventually killed
chaptersContent.content: Joash said to the priests, 'All the money of the holy things that is brought into the house of the Lord, the money for which each man is assessedthe money from the assessment of personsand the money that a man's heart prompts him to bring into the house of the Lord, let the priests take, each from his donor.' And they did not require an accounting from the men into whose hand they delivered the money.

chaptersContent.title: Jehoahaz and Jehoash
chaptersContent.summary: The reigns of Jehoahaz and Jehoash in Israel
chaptersContent.content: But Jehoahaz sought the favor of the Lord, and the Lord listened to him, for he saw the oppression of Israel, how the king of Syria oppressed them. And Elisha said to him, 'Take a bow and arrows.' So he took a bow and arrows. And Jehoash the son of Jehoahaz took again from the hand of Ben-hadad the son of Hazael the cities that he had taken from Jehoahaz his father in war.

chaptersContent.title: Amaziah and Jeroboam II
chaptersContent.summary: The reigns of Amaziah in Judah and Jeroboam II in Israel
chaptersContent.content: And he did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, yet not like David his father. He did all that Joash his father had done. He restored the border of Israel from Lebo-hamath as far as the Sea of the Arabah, according to the word of the Lord, the God of Israel, which he spoke by his servant Jonah the son of Amittai, the prophet.

chaptersContent.title: Kings of Israel and Judah
chaptersContent.summary: A series of kings in both kingdoms with varying righteousness
chaptersContent.content: And he did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, according to all that his father Amaziah had done. In the thirty-eighth year of Azariah king of Judah, Zechariah the son of Jeroboam reigned over Israel in Samaria six months. And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. He did not depart from all the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat.

chaptersContent.title: Ahaz's Wicked Reign
chaptersContent.summary: Ahaz introduces pagan worship and seeks help from Assyria
chaptersContent.content: But he walked in the way of the kings of Israel and even burned his son as an offering, according to the despicable practices of the nations whom the Lord drove out before the people of Israel. And King Ahaz went to Damascus to meet Tiglath-pileser king of Assyria, and saw the altar that was at Damascus. And King Ahaz sent to Uriah the priest a pattern of the altar.

chaptersContent.title: Fall of Israel
chaptersContent.summary: The northern kingdom of Israel is conquered and exiled by Assyria
chaptersContent.content: In the ninth year of Hoshea, the king of Assyria captured Samaria, and he carried Israel away to Assyria and placed them in Halah, and on the Habor, the river of Gozan, and in the cities of the Medes. Yet the Lord warned Israel and Judah by every prophet and every seer, saying, 'Turn from your evil ways and keep my commandments.'

chaptersContent.title: Hezekiah's Good Reign
chaptersContent.summary: Hezekiah removes idolatry and trusts in the Lord
chaptersContent.content: And he did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, according to all that David his father had done. He trusted in the Lord, the God of Israel, so that there was none like him among all the kings of Judah after him, nor among those who were before him. And the Lord was with him; wherever he went out, he prospered.

chaptersContent.title: Hezekiah's Prayer
chaptersContent.summary: Hezekiah prays and God delivers Jerusalem from Sennacherib
chaptersContent.content: And Hezekiah prayed before the Lord and said: 'O Lord, the God of Israel, enthroned above the cherubim, you are the God, you alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth; you have made heaven and earth. So now, O Lord our God, save us, please, from his hand, that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that you, O Lord, are God alone.'

chaptersContent.title: Hezekiah's Illness
chaptersContent.summary: Hezekiah is healed and shows his treasures to Babylon
chaptersContent.content: Turn back, and say to Hezekiah the leader of my people, Thus says the Lord, the God of David your father: I have heard your prayer; I have seen your tears. Behold, I will heal you. On the third day you shall go up to the house of the Lord, and I will add fifteen years to your life. And I will deliver you and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria.

chaptersContent.title: Manasseh's Evil Reign
chaptersContent.summary: Manasseh leads Judah into great wickedness
chaptersContent.content: And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, according to the despicable practices of the nations whom the Lord drove out before the people of Israel. But they did not listen, and Manasseh led them astray to do more evil than the nations had done whom the Lord destroyed before the people of Israel. Moreover, Manasseh shed very much innocent blood.

chaptersContent.title: Josiah's Discovery
chaptersContent.summary: Josiah finds the Book of the Law and begins reform
chaptersContent.content: And Hilkiah the high priest said to Shaphan the secretary, 'I have found the Book of the Law in the house of the Lord.' And Hilkiah gave the book to Shaphan, and he read it. And when the king heard the words of the Book of the Law, he tore his clothes. Because your heart was penitent, and you humbled yourself before the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Josiah's Reforms
chaptersContent.summary: Josiah implements extensive religious reforms
chaptersContent.content: And the king stood by the pillar and made a covenant before the Lord, to walk after the Lord and to keep his commandments and his testimonies and his statutes with all his heart and all his soul, to perform the words of this covenant that were written in this book. And all the people joined in the covenant. Before him there was no king like him.

chaptersContent.title: Jehoiakim and Jehoiachin
chaptersContent.summary: Babylon begins to dominate Judah
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord sent against him bands of the Chaldeans and bands of the Syrians and bands of the Moabites and bands of the Ammonites, and sent them against Judah to destroy it, according to the word of the Lord that he spoke by his servants the prophets. And Jehoiachin the king of Judah gave himself up to the king of Babylon.

chaptersContent.title: Fall of Judah
chaptersContent.summary: Jerusalem is destroyed and Judah is exiled to Babylon
chaptersContent.content: And he burned the house of the Lord and the king's house and all the houses of Jerusalem; every great house he burned down. And Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard carried into exile the rest of the people who were left in the city and the deserters who had deserted to the king of Babylon, together with the rest of the multitude.

books.name: 1 Chronicles
books.description: Israel's history from Adam to David with focus on worship
books.author: Ezra

chaptersContent.title: Adam to Abraham
chaptersContent.summary: Genealogy from Adam through Noah to Abraham
chaptersContent.content: Adam, Seth, Enosh; Kenan, Mahalalel, Jared; Enoch, Methuselah, Lamech; Noah, Shem, Ham, and Japheth. The sons of Noah: Shem, Ham, and Japheth. The sons of Abraham: Isaac and Ishmael.

chaptersContent.title: Judah's Line
chaptersContent.summary: Genealogy of Judah leading to David
chaptersContent.content: These are the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun, Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher. The sons of Judah: Er, Onan and Shelah; these three Bath-shua the Canaanite bore to him. Now Er Judah's firstborn was evil in the sight of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: David's Sons
chaptersContent.summary: David's descendants and the royal line
chaptersContent.content: These are the sons of David who were born to him in Hebron: the firstborn, Amnon, by Ahinoam the Jezreelite; the second, Daniel, by Abigail the Carmelite; the third, Absalom, whose mother was Maacah, the daughter of Talmai, king of Geshur; the fourth, Adonijah, whose mother was Haggith.

chaptersContent.title: Other Judah Clans
chaptersContent.summary: Additional clans and families of Judah
chaptersContent.content: Jabez was more honorable than his brothers; and his mother called his name Jabez, saying, 'Because I bore him in pain.' Jabez called upon the God of Israel, saying, 'Oh that you would bless me and enlarge my border, and that your hand might be with me, and that you would keep me from harm so that it might not bring me pain!'

chaptersContent.title: Reuben, Gad, and Manasseh
chaptersContent.summary: Genealogy of the Transjordan tribes
chaptersContent.content: The sons of Reuben the firstborn of Israel (for he was the firstborn, but because he defiled his father's couch, his birthright was given to the sons of Joseph the son of Israel, so that he could not be enrolled as the oldest son). And when they prevailed over them, the Hagrites and all who were with them were given into their hands.

chaptersContent.title: Levi's Descendants
chaptersContent.summary: Genealogy of the priestly tribe of Levi
chaptersContent.content: The sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, and Merari. These are the men whom David put in charge of the service of song in the house of the Lord after the ark rested there. Their kinsmen the Levites were appointed for all the service of the tabernacle of the house of God.

chaptersContent.title: Issachar, Benjamin, Naphtali
chaptersContent.summary: Genealogy of northern tribes
chaptersContent.content: The sons of Issachar: Tola, Puah, Jashub, and Shimron, four. The sons of Tola: Uzzi, Rephaiah, Jeriel, Jahmai, Ibsam, and Shemuel, heads of their fathers' houses, namely of Tola, mighty men of valor in their generations; their number in the days of David was 22,600.

chaptersContent.title: Benjamin's Descendants
chaptersContent.summary: Detailed genealogy of Benjamin including Saul's family
chaptersContent.content: Benjamin fathered Bela his firstborn, Ashbel the second, Aharah the third, Nohah the fourth, and Rapha the fifth. Ner was the father of Kish, Kish of Saul, Saul of Jonathan, Malchi-shua, Abinadab and Eshbaal. And the sons of Ulam were men who were mighty men of valor, archers.

chaptersContent.title: Returned Exiles
chaptersContent.summary: List of those who returned from Babylonian exile
chaptersContent.content: So all Israel was recorded in genealogies, and these are written in the Book of the Kings of Israel. And Judah was taken into exile in Babylon because of their breach of faith. All these, who were chosen as gatekeepers at the thresholds, were 212. They were enrolled by genealogies in their villages.

chaptersContent.title: Saul's Death
chaptersContent.summary: Saul's defeat and death on Mount Gilboa
chaptersContent.content: Now the Philistines fought against Israel, and the men of Israel fled before the Philistines and fell slain on Mount Gilboa. So Saul died for his breach of faith. He broke faith with the Lord in that he did not keep the command of the Lord, and also consulted a medium, seeking guidance.

chaptersContent.title: David Made King
chaptersContent.summary: David is anointed king and captures Jerusalem
chaptersContent.content: Then all Israel gathered together to David at Hebron and said, 'Behold, we are your bone and flesh. In times past, even when Saul was king, it was you who led out and brought in Israel. And the Lord your God said to you, 'You shall be shepherd of my people Israel, and you shall be prince over my people Israel.'

chaptersContent.title: David's Mighty Men
chaptersContent.summary: List of warriors who joined David
chaptersContent.content: Now these are the men who came to David at Ziklag, while he could not move about freely because of Saul the son of Kish. And they were armed with bows and could shoot arrows and sling stones with either the right or the left hand; they were Benjaminites, Saul's kinsmen. All these, men of war, arrayed in battle order.

chaptersContent.title: The Ark Brought to Jerusalem
chaptersContent.summary: David's first attempt to bring the ark to Jerusalem
chaptersContent.content: And let us bring again the ark of our God to us, for we did not seek it in the days of Saul.' And all the assembly agreed to do so, for the thing was right in the eyes of all the people. And David and all Israel went up to Baalah, that is to Kiriath-jearim which belongs to Judah, to bring up from there the ark of God.

chaptersContent.title: David's House and Victories
chaptersContent.summary: David builds his house and defeats the Philistines
chaptersContent.content: And David knew that the Lord had established him as king over Israel, and that his kingdom was highly exalted for the sake of his people Israel. And David inquired of God, 'Shall I go up against the Philistines? Will you give them into my hand?' And the Lord said to him, 'Go up, and I will give them into your hand.'

chaptersContent.title: Ark Brought with Rejoicing
chaptersContent.summary: The ark is successfully brought to Jerusalem with proper ceremony
chaptersContent.content: Then David said, 'No one but the Levites may carry the ark of God, for the Lord chose them to carry the ark of the Lord and to minister to him forever.' David also commanded the chiefs of the Levites to appoint their brothers as the singers who should play loudly on musical instruments.

chaptersContent.title: David's Thanksgiving
chaptersContent.summary: David's psalm of thanksgiving and appointment of Levites
chaptersContent.content: Oh give thanks to the Lord; call upon his name; make known his deeds among the peoples! Seek the Lord and his strength; seek his presence continually! Oh give thanks to the Lord, for he is good; for his steadfast love endures forever!

chaptersContent.title: God's Covenant with David
chaptersContent.summary: God promises David an eternal kingdom through his descendants
chaptersContent.content: And when your days are fulfilled to walk with your fathers, I will raise up your offspring after you, one of your own sons, and I will establish his kingdom. He shall build a house for me, and I will establish his throne forever. And I will be to him a father, and he shall be to me a son.

chaptersContent.title: David's Victories
chaptersContent.summary: David's military successes against surrounding nations
chaptersContent.content: After this David defeated the Philistines and subdued them, and he took Gath and its villages out of the hand of the Philistines. And David put garrisons in Aram of Damascus, and the Syrians became servants to David and brought tribute. And the Lord gave victory to David wherever he went.

chaptersContent.title: Ammonite War
chaptersContent.summary: David's war against the Ammonites and their allies
chaptersContent.content: And David said, 'I will deal kindly with Hanun the son of Nahash, for his father dealt kindly with me.' So David sent messengers to console him concerning his father. And David sent Joab and all the host of the mighty men. And when the servants of Hadadezer saw that they had been defeated by Israel.

chaptersContent.title: Philistine Giants
chaptersContent.summary: David's men defeat Philistine giants
chaptersContent.content: In the spring of the year, the time when kings go out to battle, Joab led out the army and ravaged the country of the Ammonites and came and besieged Rabbah. But David remained at Jerusalem. And there was again war at Gath, where there was a man of great stature, who had six fingers on each hand.

chaptersContent.title: David's Census
chaptersContent.summary: David's sinful census and its consequences
chaptersContent.content: Then Satan stood against Israel and incited David to number Israel. But God was displeased with this thing, and he struck Israel. And David said to God, 'I have sinned greatly in that I have done this thing. But now, please take away the iniquity of your servant, for I have acted very foolishly.'

chaptersContent.title: Temple Preparations
chaptersContent.summary: David prepares materials for the temple
chaptersContent.content: And David said, 'Solomon my son is young and inexperienced, and the house that is to be built for the Lord must be exceedingly magnificent, of fame and glory throughout all lands. I will therefore make preparation for it.' So David provided materials in great quantity before his death.

chaptersContent.title: Levites Organized
chaptersContent.summary: David organizes the Levites for temple service
chaptersContent.content: When David was old and full of days, he made Solomon his son king over Israel. The Levites, thirty years old and upward, were numbered, and the total was 38,000 men. For their duty was to assist the sons of Aaron for the service of the house of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Priests Organized
chaptersContent.summary: David organizes the priests into divisions
chaptersContent.content: The divisions of the sons of Aaron were these. The sons of Aaron: Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar. But Nadab and Abihu died before their father and had no children, so Eleazar and Ithamar became the priests. These were the divisions of the sons of Aaron.

chaptersContent.title: Musicians Organized
chaptersContent.summary: David organizes the musicians for temple worship
chaptersContent.content: David and the chiefs of the service also set apart for the service the sons of Asaph, and of Heman, and of Jeduthun, who prophesied with lyres, with harps, and with cymbals. The number of them along with their brothers, who were trained in singing to the Lord, all who were skillful, was 288.

chaptersContent.title: Gatekeepers and Officials
chaptersContent.summary: Organization of gatekeepers and other temple officials
chaptersContent.content: As for the divisions of the gatekeepers: of the Korahites, Meshelemiah the son of Kore, of the sons of Asaph. And Meshelemiah had sons: Zechariah the firstborn, Jediael the second, Zebadiah the third, Jathniel the fourth. And of the Levites, Ahijah had charge of the treasuries of the house of God.

chaptersContent.title: Military and Civil Organization
chaptersContent.summary: David's military and civil administration
chaptersContent.content: This is the number of the people of Israel, the heads of fathers' houses, the commanders of thousands and hundreds, and their officers who served the king in all matters concerning the divisions that came and went, month by month throughout the year, each division numbering 24,000.

chaptersContent.title: David's Charge to Solomon
chaptersContent.summary: David charges Solomon to build the temple
chaptersContent.content: Then King David rose to his feet and said: 'Hear me, my brothers and my people. I had it in my heart to build a house of rest for the ark of the covenant of the Lord and for the footstool of our God, and I made preparations for building. And you, Solomon my son, know the God of your father and serve him with a whole heart and with a willing mind.'

chaptersContent.title: David's Prayer and Offering
chaptersContent.summary: David's prayer of thanksgiving for temple preparations
chaptersContent.content: Yours, O Lord, is the greatness and the power and the glory and the victory and the majesty, for all that is in the heavens and in the earth is yours. Yours is the kingdom, O Lord, and you are exalted as head above all. But who am I, and what is my people, that we should be able thus to offer willingly? For all things come from you, and of your own have we given you.

books.name: 2 Chronicles
books.description: The history of Judah from Solomon to the Babylonian exile
books.author: Ezra

chaptersContent.title: Solomon's Wisdom and Wealth
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon asks for wisdom and receives great wealth
chaptersContent.content: In that night God appeared to Solomon, and said to him, 'Ask what I shall give you.' Give me now wisdom and knowledge to go out and come in before this people, for who can govern this people of yours, which is so great? Wisdom and knowledge are granted to you. I will also give you riches, possessions, and honor.

chaptersContent.title: Preparations for the Temple
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon makes preparations and requests help from Hiram
chaptersContent.content: Behold, I am about to build a house for the name of the Lord my God and dedicate it to him for the burning of incense of sweet spices before him, and for the regular arrangement of the shewbread, and for burnt offerings morning and evening. But who is able to build him a house, since heaven, even highest heaven, cannot contain him?

chaptersContent.title: Temple Construction Begins
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon begins building the temple on Mount Moriah
chaptersContent.content: Then Solomon began to build the house of the Lord in Jerusalem on Mount Moriah, where the Lord had appeared to David his father, at the place that David had appointed, on the threshing floor of Ornan the Jebusite. These are Solomon's measurements for building the house of God: the length, in cubits of the old standard, was sixty cubits.

chaptersContent.title: Temple Furnishings
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon makes the temple furnishings and vessels
chaptersContent.content: He made an altar of bronze, twenty cubits long and twenty cubits wide and ten cubits high. He also made ten basins in which to wash, and put five on the south side and five on the north side. In them the things to be washed were rinsed, but the sea was for the priests to wash in.

chaptersContent.title: Ark Brought to Temple
