chaptersContent.summary: The ark is brought into the completed temple
chaptersContent.content: Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel and all the heads of the tribes, the leaders of the fathers' houses of the people of Israel, in Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the covenant of the Lord out of the city of David, which is Zion. And the priests brought the ark of the covenant of the Lord to its place.

chaptersContent.title: Solomon's Prayer
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon's prayer of dedication for the temple
chaptersContent.content: And he said, 'O Lord, God of Israel, there is no God like you, in heaven or on earth, keeping covenant and showing steadfast love to your servants who walk before you with all their heart. But will God indeed dwell with man on the earth? Behold, heaven and the highest heaven cannot contain you, how much less this house that I have built!'

chaptersContent.title: God's Glory Fills the Temple
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon dedicates the temple and God's glory fills it
chaptersContent.content: As soon as Solomon finished his prayer, fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering and the sacrifices, and the glory of the Lord filled the temple. If my people who are called by my name humble themselves, and pray and seek my face and turn from their wicked ways, then I will hear from heaven and will forgive their sin and heal their land.

chaptersContent.title: Solomon's Other Activities
chaptersContent.summary: Solomon's building projects and administrative work
chaptersContent.content: Solomon brought Pharaoh's daughter up from the city of David to the house that he had built for her, for he said, 'My wife shall not live in the house of David king of Israel, for the places to which the ark of the Lord has come are holy.' And Solomon offered up burnt offerings to the Lord on the altar of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Queen of Sheba
chaptersContent.summary: The Queen of Sheba visits and is amazed by Solomon
chaptersContent.content: Now when the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, she came to Jerusalem to test him with hard questions, having a very great retinue and camels bearing spices and very much gold and precious stones. And she said to the king, 'The report was true that I heard in my own land of your words and of your wisdom.'

chaptersContent.title: Rehoboam's Folly
chaptersContent.summary: Rehoboam rejects wise counsel and the kingdom divides
chaptersContent.content: And they said to him, 'If you will be good to this people and please them and speak good words to them, then they will be your servants forever.' But he abandoned the counsel that the old men gave him and took counsel with the young men who had grown up with him and stood before him.

chaptersContent.title: Rehoboam's Reign
chaptersContent.summary: Rehoboam strengthens Judah and appoints priests
chaptersContent.content: Thus says the Lord, You shall not go up or fight against your relatives. Return every man to his home, for this thing is from me. So they strengthened the kingdom of Judah, and for three years they made Rehoboam the son of Solomon secure, for they walked for three years in the way of David and Solomon.

chaptersContent.title: Rehoboam's Downfall
chaptersContent.summary: Rehoboam forsakes the Lord and is humbled
chaptersContent.content: When the rule of Rehoboam was established and he was strong, he forsook the law of the Lord, and all Israel with him. Then the princes of Israel and the king humbled themselves and said, 'The Lord is righteous.' When the Lord saw that they humbled themselves, the word of the Lord came to Shemaiah.

chaptersContent.title: Abijah's Victory
chaptersContent.summary: Abijah defeats Jeroboam and relies on the Lord
chaptersContent.content: And Abijah stood up on Mount Zemaraim that is in the hill country of Ephraim and said, 'Hear me, O Jeroboam and all Israel! Ought you not to know that the Lord God of Israel gave the kingship over Israel forever to David and his sons by a covenant of salt? Behold, God is with us at our head, and his priests with their battle trumpets.'

chaptersContent.title: Asa's Good Reign
chaptersContent.summary: Asa removes idolatry and trusts in the Lord
chaptersContent.content: And Asa did what was good and right in the eyes of the Lord his God. He said to Judah, 'Let us build these cities and surround them with walls and towers, gates and bars. The land is still ours, because we have sought the Lord our God. We have sought him, and he has given us peace on every side.'

chaptersContent.title: Asa's Reform
chaptersContent.summary: Asa's religious reforms and covenant renewal
chaptersContent.content: And he went out to meet Asa and said to him, 'Hear me, Asa, and all Judah and Benjamin: The Lord is with you while you are with him. If you seek him, he will be found by you, but if you forsake him, he will forsake you. And all Judah rejoiced over the oath, for they had sworn with all their heart.

chaptersContent.title: Asa's Mistake
chaptersContent.summary: Asa seeks help from Syria instead of the Lord
chaptersContent.content: And at that time Hanani the seer came to Asa king of Judah and said to him, 'Because you relied on the king of Syria, and did not rely on the Lord your God, the army of the king of Syria has escaped you. For the eyes of the Lord run to and fro throughout the whole earth, to give strong support to those whose heart is blameless toward him.'

chaptersContent.title: Jehoshaphat's Good Reign
chaptersContent.summary: Jehoshaphat strengthens Judah and teaches the law
chaptersContent.content: The Lord was with Jehoshaphat, because he walked in the earlier ways of his father David. He did not seek the Baals, but sought the God of his father and walked in his commandments, and did not act as Israel did. And they taught in Judah, having the Book of the Law of the Lord with them.

chaptersContent.title: Jehoshaphat's Alliance
chaptersContent.summary: Jehoshaphat allies with Ahab and is rebuked
chaptersContent.content: And Ahab king of Israel said to Jehoshaphat king of Judah, 'Will you go with me to Ramoth-gilead?' He answered him, 'I am as you are, my people as your people. We will be with you in the war.' And Jehoshaphat said to the king of Israel, 'Inquire first for the word of the Lord.'

chaptersContent.title: Jehoshaphat's Judicial Reform
chaptersContent.summary: Jehoshaphat appoints judges and establishes justice
chaptersContent.content: But Jehu the son of Hanani the seer went out to meet him and said to King Jehoshaphat, 'Should you help the wicked and love those who hate the Lord? Because of this, wrath has gone out against you from the Lord. And he charged them: 'Thus you shall do in the fear of the Lord, in faithfulness, and with your whole heart.'

chaptersContent.title: Jehoshaphat's Victory
chaptersContent.summary: Jehoshaphat wins victory through prayer and worship
chaptersContent.content: O our God, will you not execute judgment on them? For we are powerless against this great horde that is coming against us. We do not know what to do, but our eyes are on you. And he said, 'Do not be afraid and do not be dismayed at this great horde, for the battle is not yours but God's.'

chaptersContent.title: Jehoram's Evil Reign
chaptersContent.summary: Jehoram kills his brothers and leads Judah into sin
chaptersContent.content: And he walked in the way of the kings of Israel, as the house of Ahab had done. For the daughter of Ahab was his wife. And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord. And the Lord stirred up against Jehoram the anger of the Philistines and of the Arabians who are near the Ethiopians.

chaptersContent.title: Ahaziah's Brief Reign
chaptersContent.summary: Ahaziah's wicked reign and death
chaptersContent.content: He also walked in the ways of the house of Ahab, for his mother was his counselor in doing wickedly. He did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, as the house of Ahab had done. For after the death of his father they were his counselors, to his undoing.

chaptersContent.title: Athaliah's Usurpation
chaptersContent.summary: Athaliah seizes power and kills the royal family
chaptersContent.content: In the seventh year Jehoiada took courage and entered into a covenant with the commanders of hundreds, Azariah the son of Jeroham, Ishmael the son of Jehohanan, Azariah the son of Obed, Maaseiah the son of Adaiah, and Elishaphat the son of Zichri. And they brought out the king's son and put the crown on him.

chaptersContent.title: Joash's Reign and Death
chaptersContent.summary: Joash repairs the temple but later turns to evil
chaptersContent.content: And Joash did what was right in the eyes of the Lord all the days of Jehoiada the priest. And they offered burnt offerings in the house of the Lord regularly all the days of Jehoiada. But they conspired against him, and by command of the king they stoned him with stones in the court of the house of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Amaziah's Mixed Reign
chaptersContent.summary: Amaziah's partial obedience and eventual defeat
chaptersContent.content: And he did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, yet not with a whole heart. But if you go, go, be strong for the battle. Yet God will make you fall before the enemy, for God has power to help or to cast down. But Amaziah would not listen, for it was of God, in order that he might give them into the hand of their enemies.

chaptersContent.title: Uzziah's Prosperity and Pride
chaptersContent.summary: Uzziah's success and his punishment for pride
chaptersContent.content: He set himself to seek God in the days of Zechariah, who instructed him in the fear of God, and as long as he sought the Lord, God made him prosper. But when he was strong, he grew proud, to his destruction. For he was unfaithful to the Lord his God and entered the temple of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Jotham's Good Reign
chaptersContent.summary: Jotham's righteous reign and building projects
chaptersContent.content: And he did what was right in the eyes of the Lord according to all that his father Uzziah had done, except he did not enter the temple of the Lord. But the people still followed corrupt practices. So Jotham became mighty, because he ordered his ways before the Lord his God.

chaptersContent.title: Ahaz's Wickedness
chaptersContent.summary: Ahaz's great evil and seeking help from Assyria
chaptersContent.content: Ahaz was twenty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned sixteen years in Jerusalem. And he did not do what was right in the eyes of the Lord, as his father David had done. Therefore the Lord his God gave him into the hand of the king of Syria, who defeated him and took captive a great number of his people.

chaptersContent.title: Hezekiah's Reform
chaptersContent.summary: Hezekiah begins his reign with religious reform
chaptersContent.content: And he did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, according to all that David his father had done. And he said to them, 'Hear me, Levites! Now consecrate yourselves, and consecrate the house of the Lord, the God of your fathers, and carry out the filth from the Holy Place.'

chaptersContent.title: Passover Celebration
chaptersContent.summary: Hezekiah celebrates Passover with great joy
chaptersContent.content: Hezekiah sent to all Israel and Judah, and wrote letters also to Ephraim and Manasseh, that they should come to the house of the Lord at Jerusalem to keep the Passover to the Lord, the God of Israel. The hand of God was also on Judah to give them one heart to do what the king and the princes commanded.

chaptersContent.title: Hezekiah's Organization
chaptersContent.summary: Hezekiah organizes the priests and Levites
chaptersContent.content: And Hezekiah appointed the divisions of the priests and of the Levites, division by division, each according to his service, the priests and the Levites, for burnt offerings and peace offerings, to minister in the gates and to give thanks and praise. And he commanded the people who lived in Jerusalem to give the portion due to the priests and the Levites.

chaptersContent.title: Sennacherib's Invasion
chaptersContent.summary: Hezekiah trusts God and Jerusalem is delivered
chaptersContent.content: Be strong and courageous. Do not be afraid or dismayed before the king of Assyria and all the horde that is with him, for there are more with us than with him. With him is an arm of flesh, but with us is the Lord our God, to help us and to fight our battles. And the Lord saved Hezekiah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

chaptersContent.title: Manasseh's Repentance
chaptersContent.summary: Manasseh's great evil and eventual repentance
chaptersContent.content: And he did what was evil in the sight of the Lord, according to the abominations of the nations whom the Lord drove out before the people of Israel. And when he was in distress, he entreated the favor of the Lord his God and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers. He prayed to him, and God was moved by his entreaty.

chaptersContent.title: Josiah's Reform
chaptersContent.summary: Josiah's great religious reform and covenant renewal
chaptersContent.content: And he did what was right in the eyes of the Lord, and walked in the ways of David his father; and he did not turn aside to the right hand or to the left. And the king stood in his place and made a covenant before the Lord, to walk after the Lord and to keep his commandments and his testimonies and his statutes.

chaptersContent.title: Josiah's Passover
chaptersContent.summary: Josiah celebrates the greatest Passover since Samuel
chaptersContent.content: Josiah kept a Passover to the Lord in Jerusalem. And they slaughtered the Passover lamb on the fourteenth day of the first month. No Passover like it had been kept in Israel since the days of Samuel the prophet. None of the kings of Israel had kept such a Passover as was kept by Josiah.

chaptersContent.title: The Exile and Return
chaptersContent.summary: Judah's exile to Babylon and Cyrus's decree for return
chaptersContent.content: But they kept mocking the messengers of God, despising his words and scoffing at his prophets, until the wrath of the Lord rose against his people, until there was no remedy. In the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the Lord by the mouth of Jeremiah might be fulfilled, the Lord stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia.

books.name: Ezra
books.description: The return from Babylonian exile and rebuilding of the temple
books.author: Ezra

chaptersContent.title: Cyrus's Decree
chaptersContent.summary: King Cyrus allows the Jews to return and rebuild the temple
chaptersContent.content: In the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of the Lord by the mouth of Jeremiah might be fulfilled, the Lord stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom and also put it in writing: 'Thus says Cyrus king of Persia: The Lord, the God of heaven, has given me all the kingdoms of the earth, and he has charged me to build him a house at Jerusalem, which is in Judah.'

chaptersContent.title: List of Returned Exiles
chaptersContent.summary: Census of those who returned from Babylonian exile
chaptersContent.content: Now these were the people of the province who came up out of the captivity of those exiles whom Nebuchadnezzar the king of Babylon had carried captive to Babylonia. They returned to Jerusalem and Judah, each to his own town. The whole assembly together was 42,360.

chaptersContent.title: Rebuilding the Altar
chaptersContent.summary: The returned exiles rebuild the altar and celebrate festivals
chaptersContent.content: Then arose Jeshua the son of Jozadak, with his fellow priests, and Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel with his kinsmen, and they built the altar of the God of Israel, to offer burnt offerings on it, as it is written in the Law of Moses the man of God. And they sang responsively, praising and giving thanks to the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Opposition to Rebuilding
chaptersContent.summary: Enemies oppose the rebuilding of the temple
chaptersContent.content: Now when the adversaries of Judah and Benjamin heard that the returned exiles were building a temple to the Lord, the God of Israel, they approached Zerubbabel and the heads of fathers' houses and said to them, 'Let us build with you, for we worship your God as you do.'

chaptersContent.title: Work Resumes on the Temple
chaptersContent.summary: Work on the temple resumes with prophetic encouragement
chaptersContent.content: Now the prophets, Haggai and Zechariah the son of Iddo, prophesied to the Jews who were in Judah and Jerusalem, in the name of the God of Israel who was over them. Then Zerubbabel the son of Shealtiel and Jeshua the son of Jozadak arose and began to rebuild the house of God that is in Jerusalem.

chaptersContent.title: Temple Completion
chaptersContent.summary: The temple is completed and dedicated with great joy
chaptersContent.content: And the elders of the Jews built and prospered through the prophesying of Haggai the prophet and Zechariah the son of Iddo. They finished their building by decree of the God of Israel and by decree of Cyrus and Darius and Artaxerxes king of Persia. And the people of Israel, the priests and the Levites, and the rest of the returned exiles, celebrated the dedication of this house of God with joy.

chaptersContent.title: Ezra's Mission
chaptersContent.summary: Ezra comes to Jerusalem to teach the Law
chaptersContent.content: This Ezra went up from Babylonia. He was a scribe skilled in the Law of Moses that the Lord, the God of Israel, had given, and the king granted him all that he asked, for the hand of the Lord his God was on him. For Ezra had set his heart to study the Law of the Lord, and to do it and to teach his statutes and rules in Israel.

chaptersContent.title: Ezra's Journey to Jerusalem
chaptersContent.summary: Ezra leads a group of exiles back to Jerusalem
chaptersContent.content: Then I proclaimed a fast there, at the river Ahava, that we might humble ourselves before our God, to seek from him a safe journey for ourselves, our children, and all our goods. The hand of our God was on us, and he delivered us from the hand of the enemy and from ambushes by the way.

chaptersContent.title: Ezra's Prayer of Confession
chaptersContent.summary: Ezra confesses the people's sin of intermarriage
chaptersContent.content: O my God, I am ashamed and blush to lift my face to you, my God, for our iniquities have risen higher than our heads, and our guilt has mounted up to the heavens. But now for a brief moment favor has been shown by the Lord our God, to leave us a remnant and to give us a secure hold in his holy place.

chaptersContent.title: The People's Response
chaptersContent.summary: The people agree to put away their foreign wives
chaptersContent.content: While Ezra prayed and made confession, weeping and casting himself down before the house of God, a very great assembly of men, women, and children, gathered to him out of Israel, for the people wept bitterly. And Shecaniah the son of Jehiel, of the sons of Elam, addressed Ezra.

books.name: Nehemiah
books.description: Rebuilding Jerusalem's walls and spiritual renewal
books.author: Nehemiah

chaptersContent.title: Nehemiah's Prayer
chaptersContent.summary: Nehemiah prays for Jerusalem and seeks God's favor
chaptersContent.content: As soon as I heard these words I sat down and wept and mourned for days, and I continued fasting and praying before the God of heaven. Let your ear be attentive and your eyes open, to hear the prayer of your servant that I now pray before you day and night for the people of Israel your servants, confessing the sins of the people of Israel, which we have sinned against you.

chaptersContent.title: Nehemiah's Request to the King
chaptersContent.summary: Nehemiah asks the king for permission to rebuild Jerusalem
chaptersContent.content: Then the king said to me, 'What are you requesting?' So I prayed to the God of heaven. And I said to the king, 'If it pleases the king, and if your servant has found favor in your sight, that you send me to Judah, to the city of my fathers' graves, that I may rebuild it.'

chaptersContent.title: Rebuilding the Walls
chaptersContent.summary: The people begin rebuilding the walls of Jerusalem
chaptersContent.content: Then Eliashib the high priest rose up with his brothers the priests, and they built the Sheep Gate. They consecrated it and set its doors. They consecrated it as far as the Tower of the Hundred, as far as the Tower of Hananel. The sons of Hassenaah built the Fish Gate.

chaptersContent.title: Opposition to Rebuilding
chaptersContent.summary: Enemies oppose the rebuilding and Nehemiah encourages the people
chaptersContent.content: So we built the wall. And all the wall was joined together to half its height, for the people had a mind to work. And we prayed to our God and set a guard as a protection against them day and night. Remember the Lord, who is great and awesome, and fight for your brothers, your sons, your daughters, your wives, and your homes.

chaptersContent.title: Nehemiah's Social Reforms
chaptersContent.summary: Nehemiah addresses economic oppression among the people
chaptersContent.content: I was very angry when I heard their outcry and these words. And I thought over what to do, and I brought charges against the nobles and the officials. I said to them, 'You are exacting interest, each from his brother.' And I held a great assembly against them.

chaptersContent.title: Schemes Against Nehemiah
chaptersContent.summary: Enemies try to stop Nehemiah through threats and deception
chaptersContent.content: Sanballat and Geshem sent to me, saying, 'Come and let us meet together at Hakkephirim in the plain of Ono.' But they intended to do me harm. And I sent messengers to them, saying, 'I am doing a great work and I cannot come down. Why should the work stop while I leave it and come down to you?'

chaptersContent.title: List of Returned Exiles
chaptersContent.summary: Census of those who returned from exile
chaptersContent.content: Then my God put it into my heart to assemble the nobles and the officials and the people to be enrolled by genealogy. And I found the book of the genealogy of those who came up at the first, and I found written in it. So the priests, the Levites, the gatekeepers, the singers, some of the people, and the temple servants lived in their towns.

chaptersContent.title: Reading the Law
chaptersContent.summary: Ezra reads the Law to the people and they understand
chaptersContent.content: And all the people gathered as one man into the square before the Water Gate. And they told Ezra the scribe to bring the Book of the Law of Moses that the Lord had commanded Israel. And Ezra blessed the Lord, the great God, and all the people answered, 'Amen, Amen,' lifting up their hands. And they bowed their heads and worshiped the Lord with their faces to the ground.

chaptersContent.title: National Confession
chaptersContent.summary: The people confess their sins and God's faithfulness
chaptersContent.content: And the Israelites separated themselves from all foreigners and stood and confessed their sins and the iniquities of their fathers. But you are a God ready to forgive, gracious and merciful, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love, and did not forsake them.

chaptersContent.title: The People's Covenant
chaptersContent.summary: The people make a covenant to obey God's law
chaptersContent.content: Join with their brothers, their nobles, and enter into a curse and an oath to walk in God's Law that was given by Moses the servant of God, and to observe and do all the commandments of the Lord our Lord and his rules and his statutes.

chaptersContent.title: Jerusalem's Population
chaptersContent.summary: People are chosen to live in Jerusalem
chaptersContent.content: Now the leaders of the people lived in Jerusalem. And the rest of the people cast lots to bring one out of ten to live in Jerusalem the holy city, while nine out of ten remained in the other towns. All the Levites in the holy city were 284.

chaptersContent.title: Priests and Levites
chaptersContent.summary: List of priests and Levites and dedication of the wall
chaptersContent.content: At the dedication of the wall of Jerusalem, they sought the Levites in all their places, to bring them to Jerusalem to celebrate the dedication with gladness, with thanksgivings and with singing, with cymbals, harps, and lyres.

chaptersContent.title: Nehemiah's Final Reforms
chaptersContent.summary: Nehemiah's final reforms and prayer for remembrance
chaptersContent.content: Remember me, O my God, concerning this, and do not wipe out my good deeds that I have done for the house of my God and for his service. Then I commanded the Levites that they should purify themselves and come and guard the gates, to keep the Sabbath day holy.

books.name: Esther
books.description: God's providence in saving the Jewish people through Queen Esther
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Queen Vashti Deposed
chaptersContent.summary: King Ahasuerus deposes Queen Vashti for disobedience
chaptersContent.content: Now in the days of Ahasuerus, the Ahasuerus who reigned from India to Ethiopia over 127 provinces, in those days when King Ahasuerus sat on his royal throne in Susa, the capital, in the third year of his reign, he gave a feast for all his officials and servants.

chaptersContent.title: Esther Becomes Queen
chaptersContent.summary: Esther is chosen as the new queen after a beauty contest
chaptersContent.content: He was bringing up Hadassah, that is Esther, the daughter of his uncle, for she had neither father nor mother. The young woman had a beautiful figure and was lovely to look at, and when her father and her mother died, Mordecai took her as his own daughter.

chaptersContent.title: Haman's Plot
chaptersContent.summary: Haman plots to destroy all the Jews in the kingdom
chaptersContent.content: After these things King Ahasuerus promoted Haman the Agagite, the son of Hammedatha, and advanced him and set his throne above all the officials who were with him. And when Haman saw that Mordecai did not bow down or pay homage to him, Haman was filled with fury.

chaptersContent.title: For Such a Time as This
chaptersContent.summary: Mordecai challenges Esther to act for her people's salvation
chaptersContent.content: Then Mordecai told them to reply to Esther, 'Do not think to yourself that in the king's palace you will escape any more than all the other Jews. For if you keep silent at this time, relief and deliverance will rise for the Jews from another place, but you and your father's house will perish. And who knows whether you have not come to the kingdom for such a time as this?'

chaptersContent.title: Esther's First Banquet
chaptersContent.summary: Esther invites the king and Haman to a banquet
chaptersContent.content: And when the king saw Queen Esther standing in the court, she won favor in his sight. And the king held out to Esther the golden scepter that was in his hand. Then Esther approached and touched the tip of the scepter. And the king said to her, 'What is it, Queen Esther? What is your request?'

chaptersContent.title: Mordecai Honored
chaptersContent.summary: The king honors Mordecai for saving his life
chaptersContent.content: On that night the king could not sleep. And he gave orders to bring the book of memorable deeds, the chronicles, and they were read before the king. And it was found written how Mordecai had told about Bigthan and Teresh, two of the king's eunuchs, who guarded the threshold.

chaptersContent.title: Haman's Downfall
chaptersContent.summary: Esther reveals Haman's plot and the king condemns him
chaptersContent.content: Then Queen Esther answered, 'If I have found favor in your sight, O king, and if it please the king, let my life be granted me for my petition, and my people for my request.' And Esther said, 'A foe and enemy! This wicked Haman!' Then Haman was terrified before the king and the queen.

chaptersContent.title: Esther Saves the Jews
chaptersContent.summary: Esther and Mordecai are given authority to save the Jews
chaptersContent.content: Then Esther spoke again to the king. She fell at his feet and wept and pleaded with him to avert the evil plan of Haman the Agagite and the plot that he had devised against the Jews. Then King Ahasuerus said to Queen Esther and to Mordecai the Jew, 'Behold, I have given Esther the house of Haman.'

chaptersContent.title: The Festival of Purim
chaptersContent.summary: The Jews are delivered and establish the festival of Purim
chaptersContent.content: Now in the twelfth month, which is the month of Adar, on the thirteenth day of the same, when the king's command and edict were about to be carried out, on the very day when the enemies of the Jews hoped to gain the mastery over them, the reverse occurred: the Jews gained mastery over those who hated them.

chaptersContent.title: Mordecai's Greatness
chaptersContent.summary: Mordecai becomes great in the kingdom
chaptersContent.content: King Ahasuerus imposed tax on the land and on the coastlands of the sea. And all the acts of his power and might, and the full account of the high honor of Mordecai, to which the king advanced him, are they not written in the Book of the Chronicles of the kings of Media and Persia?

books.name: Job
books.description: The story of Job's suffering and God's sovereignty
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Job's Character and First Test
chaptersContent.summary: Job is introduced as a righteous man who faces Satan's first test
chaptersContent.content: There was a man in the land of Uz whose name was Job, and that man was blameless and upright, one who feared God and turned away from evil. And he said, 'Naked I came from my mother's womb, and naked shall I return. The Lord gave, and the Lord has taken away; blessed be the name of the Lord.'

chaptersContent.title: Job's Second Test
chaptersContent.summary: Satan afflicts Job with painful sores, but Job remains faithful
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said to Satan, 'Have you considered my servant Job, that there is none like him on the earth, a blameless and upright man, who fears God and turns away from evil?' But he said to her, 'You speak as one of the foolish women would speak. Shall we receive good from God, and shall we not receive evil?'

chaptersContent.title: My Redeemer Lives
chaptersContent.summary: Job expresses faith that his Redeemer lives
chaptersContent.content: For I know that my Redeemer lives, and at the last he will stand upon the earth. And after my skin has been thus destroyed, yet in my flesh I shall see God, whom I shall see for myself, and my eyes shall behold, and not another.

chaptersContent.title: God Answers Job
chaptersContent.summary: God speaks to Job out of the whirlwind about His power and wisdom
chaptersContent.content: Then the Lord answered Job out of the whirlwind and said: 'Who is this that darkens counsel by words without knowledge? Where were you when I laid the foundation of the earth? Tell me, if you have understanding.'

chaptersContent.title: Job's Restoration
chaptersContent.summary: Job repents and God restores his fortunes double
chaptersContent.content: I know that you can do all things, and that no purpose of yours can be thwarted. I had heard of you by the hearing of the ear, but now my eye sees you; therefore I despise myself, and repent in dust and ashes.

books.name: Psalms
books.description: Songs and prayers expressing worship, praise, and petition
books.author: David and others

chaptersContent.title: The Way of the Righteous and the Wicked
chaptersContent.summary: Contrasts the blessed life of the righteous with the fate of the wicked
chaptersContent.content: Blessed is the man who walks not in the counsel of the wicked, nor stands in the way of sinners, nor sits in the seat of scoffers, but his delight is in the law of the Lord, and on his law he meditates day and night.

chaptersContent.title: The Reign of the Lord's Anointed
chaptersContent.summary: God's promise to establish His King on Zion despite opposition
chaptersContent.content: Why do the nations rage and the peoples plot in vain? The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take counsel together, against the Lord and against his anointed. Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and you perish in the way.

chaptersContent.title: Save Me, O My God
chaptersContent.summary: David's prayer for deliverance from his enemies
chaptersContent.content: But you, O Lord, are a shield about me, my glory, and the lifter of my head. I lay down and slept; I woke again, for the Lord sustained me. Salvation belongs to the Lord; your blessing be on your people!

chaptersContent.title: Answer Me When I Call
chaptersContent.summary: David's evening prayer for God's favor and peace
chaptersContent.content: Answer me when I call, O God of my righteousness! You have given me relief when I was in distress. Be gracious to me and hear my prayer! In peace I will both lie down and sleep; for you alone, O Lord, make me dwell in safety.

chaptersContent.title: Lead Me in Your Righteousness
chaptersContent.summary: Morning prayer for God's guidance and protection
chaptersContent.content: O Lord, in the morning you hear my voice; in the morning I prepare a sacrifice for you and watch. Lead me, O Lord, in your righteousness because of my enemies; make your way straight before me.

chaptersContent.title: O Lord, Deliver My Life
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for mercy and healing in distress
chaptersContent.content: Be gracious to me, O Lord, for I am languishing; heal me, O Lord, for my bones are troubled. Turn, O Lord, deliver my life; save me for the sake of your steadfast love. The Lord has heard my plea; the Lord accepts my prayer.

chaptersContent.title: In You Do I Take Refuge
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for justice against false accusers
chaptersContent.content: O Lord my God, in you do I take refuge; save me from all my pursuers and deliver me. The Lord judges the peoples; judge me, O Lord, according to my righteousness and according to my integrity that is in me.

chaptersContent.title: How Majestic Is Your Name
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's creation and care for humanity
chaptersContent.content: O Lord, our Lord, how majestic is your name in all the earth! You have set your glory above the heavens. What is man that you are mindful of him, and the son of man that you care for him?

chaptersContent.title: I Will Recount Your Wonderful Deeds
chaptersContent.summary: Thanksgiving for God's justice and deliverance
chaptersContent.content: I will give thanks to the Lord with my whole heart; I will recount all of your wonderful deeds. And those who know your name put their trust in you, for you, O Lord, have not forsaken those who seek you.

chaptersContent.title: Why Do You Hide Yourself
chaptersContent.summary: Question about God's apparent absence during wickedness
chaptersContent.content: Why, O Lord, do you stand far away? Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble? Arise, O Lord; O God, lift up your hand; forget not the afflicted. O Lord, you hear the desire of the afflicted.

chaptersContent.title: The Lord Is in His Holy Temple
chaptersContent.summary: Trust in God's righteous judgment from heaven
chaptersContent.content: In the Lord I take refuge; how can you say to my soul, Flee like a bird to your mountain? The Lord is in his holy temple; the Lord's throne is in heaven; his eyes see, his eyelids test the children of man.

chaptersContent.title: Save, O Lord, for the Godly One Is Gone
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer against lying and deceitful speech
chaptersContent.content: Save, O Lord, for the godly one is gone; for the faithful have vanished from among the children of man. The words of the Lord are pure words, like silver refined in a furnace on the ground, purified seven times.

chaptersContent.title: How Long, O Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Cry for help in times of prolonged suffering
chaptersContent.content: How long, O Lord? Will you forget me forever? How long will you hide your face from me? But I have trusted in your steadfast love; my heart shall rejoice in your salvation. I will sing to the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: The Fool Says, There Is No God
chaptersContent.summary: Description of the corruption of those who deny God
chaptersContent.content: The fool says in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, they do abominable deeds; there is none who does good. Oh, that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion! When the Lord restores the fortunes of his people.

chaptersContent.title: Who Shall Dwell on Your Holy Hill
chaptersContent.summary: Qualifications for dwelling in God's presence
chaptersContent.content: O Lord, who shall sojourn in your tent? Who shall dwell on your holy hill? He who walks blamelessly and does what is right and speaks truth in his heart. He who does these things shall never be moved.

chaptersContent.title: You Are My Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Declaration of trust in God and hope in the future
chaptersContent.content: I say to the Lord, You are my Lord; I have no good apart from you. I have set the Lord always before me; because he is at my right hand, I shall not be shaken. You make known to me the path of life.

chaptersContent.title: Incline Your Ear to Me
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for vindication and protection from enemies
chaptersContent.content: Hear a just cause, O Lord; attend to my cry! Give ear to my prayer from lips free of deceit! I call upon you, for you will answer me, O God; incline your ear to me; hear my words.

chaptersContent.title: The Lord Is My Rock and My Fortress
chaptersContent.summary: David's song of deliverance from all his enemies
chaptersContent.content: The Lord is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer, my God, my rock, in whom I take refuge, my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold. In my distress I called upon the Lord; to my God I cried for help.

chaptersContent.title: The Heavens Declare the Glory of God
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's revelation in creation and His law
chaptersContent.content: The heavens declare the glory of God, and the sky above proclaims his handiwork. The law of the Lord is perfect, reviving the soul; the testimony of the Lord is sure, making wise the simple.

chaptersContent.title: May the Lord Answer You
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for God's help in times of trouble
chaptersContent.content: May the Lord answer you in the day of trouble! May the name of the God of Jacob protect you! Some trust in chariots and some in horses, but we trust in the name of the Lord our God.

chaptersContent.title: The King Rejoices in Your Strength
chaptersContent.summary: Thanksgiving for God's blessings on the king
chaptersContent.content: O Lord, in your strength the king rejoices, and in your salvation how greatly he exults! For the king trusts in the Lord, and through the steadfast love of the Most High he shall not be moved.

chaptersContent.title: My God, My God, Why Have You Forsaken Me
chaptersContent.summary: Cry of suffering and ultimate trust in God's deliverance
chaptersContent.content: My God, my God, why have you forsaken me? Why are you so far from saving me, from the words of my groaning? For dogs encompass me; a company of evildoers encircles me; they have pierced my hands and feet.

chaptersContent.title: The Lord is My Shepherd
chaptersContent.summary: David's famous psalm about God's care and guidance
chaptersContent.content: The Lord is my shepherd; I shall not want. He makes me lie down in green pastures. He leads me beside still waters. He restores my soul. He leads me in paths of righteousness for his name's sake.

chaptersContent.title: The Earth Is the Lord's
chaptersContent.summary: Declaration of God's ownership and call to worship
chaptersContent.content: The earth is the Lord's and the fullness thereof, the world and those who dwell therein. Who shall ascend the hill of the Lord? And who shall stand in his holy place? Lift up your heads, O gates!

chaptersContent.title: To You, O Lord, I Lift Up My Soul
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for guidance, forgiveness, and deliverance
chaptersContent.content: To you, O Lord, I lift up my soul. Make me to know your ways, O Lord; teach me your paths. The friendship of the Lord is for those who fear him, and he makes known to them his covenant.

chaptersContent.title: Vindicate Me, O Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for vindication and commitment to integrity
chaptersContent.content: Vindicate me, O Lord, for I have walked in my integrity, and I have trusted in the Lord without wavering. O Lord, I love the habitation of your house and the place where your glory dwells.

chaptersContent.title: The Lord Is My Light and My Salvation
chaptersContent.summary: Declaration of trust in God's protection and presence
chaptersContent.content: The Lord is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? The Lord is the stronghold of my life; of whom shall I be afraid? One thing have I asked of the Lord, that will I seek after: that I may dwell in the house of the Lord all the days of my life.

chaptersContent.title: To You, O Lord, I Call
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for help and thanksgiving for answered prayer
chaptersContent.content: To you, O Lord, I call; my rock, be not deaf to me, lest, if you be silent to me, I become like those who go down to the pit. Blessed be the Lord! For he has heard the voice of my pleas for mercy.

chaptersContent.title: Ascribe to the Lord Glory
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's power displayed in nature
chaptersContent.content: Ascribe to the Lord, O heavenly beings, ascribe to the Lord glory and strength. The voice of the Lord is powerful; the voice of the Lord is full of majesty. May the Lord give strength to his people!

chaptersContent.title: Joy Comes with the Morning
chaptersContent.summary: Thanksgiving for deliverance from death
chaptersContent.content: I will extol you, O Lord, for you have drawn me up and have not let my foes rejoice over me. For his anger is but for a moment, and his favor is for a lifetime. Weeping may tarry for the night, but joy comes with the morning.

chaptersContent.title: Into Your Hand I Commit My Spirit
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for deliverance and trust in God
chaptersContent.content: In you, O Lord, do I take refuge; let me never be put to shame; in your righteousness deliver me! Into your hand I commit my spirit; you have redeemed me, O Lord, faithful God. But I trust in you, O Lord; I say, You are my God.

chaptersContent.title: Blessed Is the One Whose Transgression Is Forgiven
chaptersContent.summary: Joy of forgiveness and confession of sin
chaptersContent.content: Blessed is the one whose transgression is forgiven, whose sin is covered. I acknowledged my sin to you, and I did not cover my iniquity; I said, I will confess my transgressions to the Lord, and you forgave the iniquity of my sin.

chaptersContent.title: Sing Joyfully to the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Call to praise God for His creation and providence
chaptersContent.content: Shout for joy in the Lord, O you righteous! Praise befits the upright. For the word of the Lord is upright, and all his work is done in faithfulness. Let your steadfast love, O Lord, be upon us, even as we hope in you.

chaptersContent.title: I Will Bless the Lord at All Times
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's deliverance and call to fear Him
chaptersContent.content: I will bless the Lord at all times; his praise shall continually be in my mouth. Oh, taste and see that the Lord is good! Blessed is the man who takes refuge in him! The Lord is near to all who call on him in truth.

chaptersContent.title: Contend, O Lord, with Those Who Contend with Me
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for vindication against enemies
chaptersContent.content: Contend, O Lord, with those who contend with me; fight against those who fight against me! Then my soul will rejoice in the Lord, exulting in his salvation. Let those who delight in my righteousness shout for joy and be glad.

chaptersContent.title: How Precious Is Your Steadfast Love
chaptersContent.summary: Contrast between wickedness and God's love
chaptersContent.content: Transgression speaks to the wicked deep in his heart; there is no fear of God before his eyes. How precious is your steadfast love, O God! The children of mankind take refuge in the shadow of your wings.

chaptersContent.title: Fret Not Yourself Because of Evildoers
chaptersContent.summary: Wisdom about trusting God and not envying the wicked
chaptersContent.content: Fret not yourself because of evildoers; be not envious of wrongdoers! Delight yourself in the Lord, and he will give you the desires of your heart. The steps of a man are established by the Lord, when he delights in his way.

chaptersContent.title: Do Not Forsake Me, O Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for mercy in times of suffering and sin
chaptersContent.content: O Lord, rebuke me not in your anger, nor discipline me in your wrath! But for you, O Lord, do I wait; it is you, O Lord my God, who will answer. Make haste to help me, O Lord, my salvation!

chaptersContent.title: I Said, I Will Guard My Ways
chaptersContent.summary: Meditation on the brevity of life and human frailty
chaptersContent.content: I said, I will guard my ways, that I may not sin with my tongue; I will guard my mouth with a muzzle, so long as the wicked are in my presence. O Lord, make me know my end and what is the measure of my days.

chaptersContent.title: I Waited Patiently for the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Thanksgiving for deliverance and prayer for continued help
chaptersContent.content: I waited patiently for the Lord; he inclined to me and heard my cry. I delight to do your will, O my God; your law is within my heart. But may all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you.

chaptersContent.title: Blessed Is the One Who Considers the Poor
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for healing and deliverance from enemies
chaptersContent.content: Blessed is the one who considers the poor! In the day of trouble the Lord delivers him. As for me, I said, O Lord, be gracious to me; heal me, for I have sinned against you! Blessed be the Lord, the God of Israel.

chaptersContent.title: As a Deer Pants for Flowing Streams
chaptersContent.summary: Longing for God's presence and worship
chaptersContent.content: As a deer pants for flowing streams, so pants my soul for you, O God. Why are you cast down, O my soul, and why are you in turmoil within me? Hope in God; for I shall again praise him, my salvation and my God.

chaptersContent.title: Send Out Your Light and Your Truth
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for God's guidance and vindication
chaptersContent.content: Vindicate me, O God, and defend my cause against an ungodly people, from the deceitful and unjust man deliver me! Send out your light and your truth; let them lead me; let them bring me to your holy hill.

chaptersContent.title: O God, We Have Heard with Our Ears
chaptersContent.summary: Lament over God's apparent abandonment
chaptersContent.content: O God, we have heard with our ears, our fathers have told us, what deeds you performed in their days, in the days of old. In God we have boasted continually, and we will give thanks to your name forever.

chaptersContent.title: My Heart Overflows with a Pleasing Theme
chaptersContent.summary: Wedding song celebrating the king and his bride
chaptersContent.content: My heart overflows with a pleasing theme; I address my verses to the king; my tongue is like the pen of a ready scribe. Your throne, O God, is forever and ever. The scepter of your kingdom is a scepter of uprightness.

chaptersContent.title: God Is Our Refuge and Strength
chaptersContent.summary: Declaration of trust in God's protection
chaptersContent.content: God is our refuge and strength, a very present help in trouble. The Lord of hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our fortress. Be still, and know that I am God. I will be exalted among the nations.

chaptersContent.title: Clap Your Hands, All Peoples
chaptersContent.summary: Call to praise God as King of all the earth
chaptersContent.content: Clap your hands, all peoples! Shout to God with loud songs of joy! For God, the Most High, is to be feared, a great king over all the earth. The princes of the peoples gather as the people of the God of Abraham.

chaptersContent.title: Great Is the Lord and Greatly to Be Praised
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for Jerusalem and God's protection
chaptersContent.content: Great is the Lord and greatly to be praised in the city of our God! His holy mountain, beautiful in elevation, is the joy of all the earth, Mount Zion, in the far north, the city of the great King.

chaptersContent.title: Hear This, All Peoples
chaptersContent.summary: Wisdom about the futility of trusting in wealth
chaptersContent.content: Hear this, all peoples! Give ear, all inhabitants of the world, both low and high, rich and poor together! Man in his pomp will not remain; he is like the beasts that perish. Man in his pomp yet without understanding is like the beasts that perish.

chaptersContent.title: The Mighty One, God the Lord, Speaks
chaptersContent.summary: God's judgment on His people and call to true worship
chaptersContent.content: The Mighty One, God the Lord, speaks and summons the earth from the rising of the sun to its setting. Offer to God a sacrifice of thanksgiving, and perform your vows to the Most High. The one who offers thanksgiving as his sacrifice glorifies me.

chaptersContent.title: A Prayer for Forgiveness
chaptersContent.summary: David's prayer of repentance after his sin with Bathsheba
chaptersContent.content: Have mercy on me, O God, according to your steadfast love; according to your abundant mercy blot out my transgressions. Wash me thoroughly from my iniquity, and cleanse me from my sin!

chaptersContent.title: Why Do You Boast of Evil
chaptersContent.summary: Condemnation of the wicked and trust in God's love
chaptersContent.content: Why do you boast of evil, O mighty man? The steadfast love of God endures all the day. But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God. I trust in the steadfast love of God forever and ever.

chaptersContent.title: The Fool Says, There Is No God
chaptersContent.summary: Description of the corruption of those who deny God
chaptersContent.content: The fool says in his heart, There is no God. They are corrupt, doing abominable iniquity; there is none who does good. Oh, that salvation for Israel would come out of Zion! When God restores the fortunes of his people.

chaptersContent.title: O God, Save Me by Your Name
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for deliverance from enemies
chaptersContent.content: O God, save me by your name, and vindicate me by your might. Behold, God is my helper; the Lord is the upholder of my life. For he has delivered me from every trouble.

chaptersContent.title: Give Ear to My Prayer, O God
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for deliverance from treacherous friends
chaptersContent.content: Give ear to my prayer, O God, and hide not yourself from my plea for mercy! But I call to God, and the Lord will save me. Cast your burden on the Lord, and he will sustain you.

chaptersContent.title: In God I Trust; I Shall Not Be Afraid
chaptersContent.summary: Trust in God despite persecution
chaptersContent.content: Be gracious to me, O God, for man tramples on me; all day long an attacker oppresses me. When I am afraid, I put my trust in you. In God, whose word I praise, in God I trust; I shall not be afraid.

chaptersContent.title: Be Merciful to Me, O God
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for mercy and praise for God's faithfulness
chaptersContent.content: Be merciful to me, O God, be merciful to me, for in you my soul takes refuge; in the shadow of your wings I will take refuge, till the storms of destruction pass by. My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast!

chaptersContent.title: Do You Indeed Decree What Is Right
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for justice against wicked rulers
chaptersContent.content: Do you indeed decree what is right, you gods? Do you judge the children of man uprightly? O God, break the teeth in their mouths; tear out the fangs of the young lions, O Lord!

chaptersContent.title: Deliver Me from My Enemies
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for deliverance from bloodthirsty enemies
chaptersContent.content: Deliver me from my enemies, O my God; protect me from those who rise up against me; deliver me from those who work evil, and save me from bloodthirsty men. O my Strength, I will watch for you.

chaptersContent.title: O God, You Have Rejected Us
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for restoration after military defeat
chaptersContent.content: O God, you have rejected us, broken our defenses; you have been angry; oh, restore us. You have given a banner to those who fear you, that it may be displayed because of truth.

chaptersContent.title: Hear My Cry, O God
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for God's protection and the king's reign
chaptersContent.content: Hear my cry, O God, listen to my prayer; from the end of the earth I call to you when my heart is faint. Lead me to the rock that is higher than I, for you have been my refuge.

chaptersContent.title: For God Alone My Soul Waits in Silence
chaptersContent.summary: Trust in God alone for salvation
chaptersContent.content: For God alone my soul waits in silence; from him comes my salvation. For God alone, O my soul, wait in silence, for my hope is from him. Trust in him at all times, O people; pour out your heart before him.

chaptersContent.title: O God, You Are My God
chaptersContent.summary: Longing for God's presence and praise
chaptersContent.content: O God, you are my God; earnestly I seek you; my soul thirsts for you; my flesh faints for you, as in a dry and weary land where there is no water. Because your steadfast love is better than life.

chaptersContent.title: Hear My Voice, O God
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for protection from secret plots
chaptersContent.content: Hear my voice, O God, in my complaint; preserve my life from dread of the enemy. But God shoots his arrow at them; they are wounded suddenly. Let the righteous one rejoice in the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Praise Is Due to You, O God
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's goodness and provision
chaptersContent.content: Praise is due to you, O God, in Zion, and to you shall vows be performed. By awesome deeds you answer us with righteousness, O God of our salvation, the hope of all the ends of the earth.

chaptersContent.title: Shout for Joy to God
chaptersContent.summary: Call to praise God for His mighty works
chaptersContent.content: Shout for joy to God, all the earth; sing the glory of his name; give to him glorious praise! Come and see what God has done: he is awesome in his deeds toward the children of man.

chaptersContent.title: May God Be Gracious to Us
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for God's blessing and salvation
chaptersContent.content: May God be gracious to us and bless us and make his face to shine upon us, that your way may be known on earth, your saving power among all nations. God shall bless us; let all the ends of the earth fear him!

chaptersContent.title: God Shall Arise
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's victory and care for His people
chaptersContent.content: God shall arise, his enemies shall be scattered; and those who hate him shall flee before him! Father of the fatherless and protector of widows is God in his holy habitation. Blessed be the Lord, who daily bears us up.

chaptersContent.title: Save Me, O God
chaptersContent.summary: Cry for help in deep distress
chaptersContent.content: Save me, O God! For the waters have come up to my neck. But as for me, my prayer is to you, O Lord. At an acceptable time, O God, in the abundance of your steadfast love answer me.

chaptersContent.title: Make Haste, O God, to Deliver Me
chaptersContent.summary: Urgent prayer for deliverance
chaptersContent.content: Make haste, O God, to deliver me! O Lord, make haste to help me! May all who seek you rejoice and be glad in you! May those who love your salvation say evermore, God is great!

chaptersContent.title: In You, O Lord, Do I Take Refuge
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for God's help in old age
chaptersContent.content: In you, O Lord, do I take refuge; let me never be put to shame! Do not cast me off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my strength is spent. So even to old age and gray hairs, O God, do not forsake me.

chaptersContent.title: Give the King Your Justice
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for the king's righteous rule
chaptersContent.content: Give the king your justice, O God, and your righteousness to the royal son! May he have dominion from sea to sea, and from the River to the ends of the earth! May his name endure forever.

chaptersContent.title: Truly God Is Good to Israel
chaptersContent.summary: Struggle with the prosperity of the wicked
chaptersContent.content: Truly God is good to Israel, to those who are pure in heart. But when I thought how to understand this, it seemed to me a wearisome task, until I went into the sanctuary of God.

chaptersContent.title: O God, Why Do You Cast Us Off Forever
chaptersContent.summary: Lament over the destruction of the sanctuary
chaptersContent.content: O God, why do you cast us off forever? Why does your anger smoke against the sheep of your pasture? Yet God my King is from of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.

chaptersContent.title: We Give Thanks to You, O God
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's righteous judgment
chaptersContent.content: We give thanks to you, O God; we give thanks, for your name is near. We recount your wondrous deeds. But it is God who executes judgment, putting down one and lifting up another.

chaptersContent.title: In Judah God Is Known
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's victory over enemies
chaptersContent.content: In Judah God is known; his name is great in Israel. Glorious are you, more majestic than the mountains full of prey. Make your vows to the Lord your God and perform them.

chaptersContent.title: I Cry Aloud to God
chaptersContent.summary: Meditation on God's past deliverance
chaptersContent.content: I cry aloud to God, aloud to God, and he will hear me. I will remember the deeds of the Lord; yes, I will remember your wonders of old. Your way, O God, is holy. What god is great like our God?

chaptersContent.title: Tell the Coming Generation
chaptersContent.summary: Teaching Israel's history to future generations
chaptersContent.content: Give ear, O my people, to my teaching; incline your ears to the words of my mouth! We will not hide them from their children, but tell to the coming generation the glorious deeds of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: How Long, O Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for vengeance on enemies who destroyed Jerusalem
chaptersContent.content: O God, the nations have come into your inheritance; they have defiled your holy temple; they have laid Jerusalem in ruins. Do not remember against us our former iniquities.

chaptersContent.title: Give Ear, O Shepherd of Israel
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for restoration of God's people
chaptersContent.content: Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, you who lead Joseph like a flock. You who are enthroned upon the cherubim, shine forth. Restore us, O Lord God of hosts! Let your face shine.

chaptersContent.title: Sing Aloud to God Our Strength
chaptersContent.summary: Call to worship and remember God's deliverance
chaptersContent.content: Sing aloud to God our strength; shout for joy to the God of Jacob! I relieved your shoulder of the burden; your hands were freed from the basket. I am the Lord your God, who brought you up out of the land of Egypt.

chaptersContent.title: God Has Taken His Place in the Divine Council
chaptersContent.summary: God's judgment on unjust judges
chaptersContent.content: God has taken his place in the divine council; in the midst of the gods he holds judgment: Give justice to the weak and the fatherless; maintain the right of the afflicted and the destitute.

chaptersContent.title: O God, Do Not Keep Silence
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for God to act against Israel's enemies
chaptersContent.content: O God, do not keep silence; do not hold your peace or be still, O God! O my God, make them like whirling dust, like chaff before the wind. Let them know that you alone, whose name is the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: How Lovely Is Your Dwelling Place
chaptersContent.summary: Longing for God's house and presence
chaptersContent.content: How lovely is your dwelling place, O Lord of hosts! My soul longs, yes, faints for the courts of the Lord; my heart and flesh sing for joy to the living God. For a day in your courts is better than a thousand elsewhere.

chaptersContent.title: Revive Us Again
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for restoration and God's favor
chaptersContent.content: Lord, you were favorable to your land; you restored the fortunes of Jacob. Will you not revive us again, that your people may rejoice in you? Righteousness will go before him and make his footsteps a way.

chaptersContent.title: Incline Your Ear, O Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for God's mercy and help
chaptersContent.content: Incline your ear, O Lord, and answer me, for I am poor and needy. For you, O Lord, are good and forgiving, abounding in steadfast love to all who call upon you. But you, O Lord, are a God merciful and gracious.

chaptersContent.title: On the Holy Mount Stands the City He Founded
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for Zion as the city of God
chaptersContent.content: On the holy mount stands the city he founded; the Lord loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwelling places of Jacob. The Lord records as he registers the peoples, This one was born there.

chaptersContent.title: O Lord, God of My Salvation
chaptersContent.summary: Cry of despair and prayer for help
chaptersContent.content: O Lord, God of my salvation, I cry out day and night before you. You have put me in the depths of the pit, in the regions dark and deep. You have caused my beloved and my friend to shun me.

chaptersContent.title: I Will Sing of the Steadfast Love of the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's covenant with David
chaptersContent.content: I will sing of the steadfast love of the Lord, forever; with my mouth I will make known your faithfulness to all generations. Righteousness and justice are the foundation of your throne.

chaptersContent.title: Lord, You Have Been Our Dwelling Place
chaptersContent.summary: Meditation on God's eternity and human frailty
chaptersContent.content: Lord, you have been our dwelling place in all generations. For a thousand years in your sight are but as yesterday when it is past, or as a watch in the night. So teach us to number our days.

chaptersContent.title: He Who Dwells in the Shelter of the Most High
chaptersContent.summary: Trust in God's protection and care
chaptersContent.content: He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High will abide in the shadow of the Almighty. He will cover you with his pinions, and under his wings you will find refuge; his faithfulness is a shield and buckler.

chaptersContent.title: It Is Good to Give Thanks to the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's works and the righteous
chaptersContent.content: It is good to give thanks to the Lord, to sing praises to your name, O Most High; to declare your steadfast love in the morning, and your faithfulness by night. The righteous flourish like the palm tree.

chaptersContent.title: The Lord Reigns
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's majesty and power
chaptersContent.content: The Lord reigns; he is robed in majesty; the Lord is robed; he has put on strength as his belt. Yes, the world is established; it shall never be moved. Your decrees are very trustworthy.

chaptersContent.title: O Lord, God of Vengeance
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for God's justice and comfort
chaptersContent.content: O Lord, God of vengeance, O God of vengeance, shine forth! Blessed is the man whom you discipline, O Lord, and whom you teach out of your law. But the Lord has become my stronghold.

chaptersContent.title: Oh Come, Let Us Sing to the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Call to worship and warning against unbelief
chaptersContent.content: Oh come, let us sing to the Lord; let us make a joyful noise to the rock of our salvation! Oh come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before the Lord, our Maker! Today, if you hear his voice.

chaptersContent.title: Oh Sing to the Lord a New Song
chaptersContent.summary: Call to praise God among the nations
chaptersContent.content: Oh sing to the Lord a new song; sing to the Lord, all the earth! For great is the Lord, and greatly to be praised; he is to be feared above all gods. For he comes to judge the earth.

chaptersContent.title: The Lord Reigns, Let the Earth Rejoice
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's righteous rule
chaptersContent.content: The Lord reigns, let the earth rejoice; let the many coastlands be glad! The heavens proclaim his righteousness, and all the peoples see his glory. Rejoice in the Lord, O you righteous.

chaptersContent.title: Oh Sing to the Lord a New Song
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's salvation and judgment
chaptersContent.content: Oh sing to the Lord a new song, for he has done marvelous things! His right hand and his holy arm have worked salvation for him. Let the sea roar, and all that fills it; the world and those who dwell in it!

chaptersContent.title: The Lord Reigns
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's holiness and justice
chaptersContent.content: The Lord reigns; let the peoples tremble! He sits enthroned upon the cherubim; let the earth quake! Exalt the Lord our God, and worship at his holy mountain; for the Lord our God is holy!

chaptersContent.title: Make a Joyful Noise to the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Call to worship and thanksgiving
chaptersContent.content: Make a joyful noise to the Lord, all the earth! Serve the Lord with gladness! Come into his presence with singing! Know that the Lord, he is God! It is he who made us, and we are his.

chaptersContent.title: I Will Sing of Steadfast Love and Justice
chaptersContent.summary: David's commitment to righteous living and just rule
chaptersContent.content: I will sing of steadfast love and justice; to you, O Lord, I will make music. I will ponder the way that is blameless. Oh when will you come to me? I will walk with integrity of heart within my house.

chaptersContent.title: Do Not Hide Your Face from Me
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer of one afflicted and faint, pleading for God's help
chaptersContent.content: Hear my prayer, O Lord; let my cry come to you! Do not hide your face from me in the day of my distress! Incline your ear to me; answer me speedily in the day when I call!

chaptersContent.title: Bless the Lord, O My Soul
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's mercy and benefits to His people
chaptersContent.content: Bless the Lord, O my soul, and all that is within me, bless his holy name! The Lord is merciful and gracious, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love. As far as the east is from the west, so far does he remove our transgressions from us.

chaptersContent.title: O Lord My God, You Are Very Great
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's creation and provision in nature
chaptersContent.content: Bless the Lord, O my soul! O Lord my God, you are very great! You are clothed with splendor and majesty, covering yourself with light as with a garment, stretching out the heavens like a tent.

chaptersContent.title: Tell of All His Wonderful Works
chaptersContent.summary: Recounting God's faithfulness to Israel throughout history
chaptersContent.content: Oh give thanks to the Lord; call upon his name; make known his deeds among the peoples! Seek the Lord and his strength; seek his presence continually! That they might keep his statutes and observe his laws. Praise the Lord!

chaptersContent.title: Give Thanks to the Lord, for He Is Good
chaptersContent.summary: Confession of Israel's sins and God's mercy
chaptersContent.content: Praise the Lord! Oh give thanks to the Lord, for he is good, for his steadfast love endures forever! Both we and our fathers have sinned; we have committed iniquity; we have done wickedness.

chaptersContent.title: Let the Redeemed of the Lord Say So
chaptersContent.summary: Thanksgiving for God's deliverance in various circumstances
chaptersContent.content: Oh give thanks to the Lord, for he is good, for his steadfast love endures forever! Let the redeemed of the Lord say so, whom he has redeemed from trouble. Whoever is wise, let him attend to these things; let them consider the steadfast love of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: With God We Shall Do Valiantly
chaptersContent.summary: David's prayer for victory and God's help
chaptersContent.content: My heart is steadfast, O God! I will sing and make melody with all my being! Oh grant us help against the foe, for vain is the salvation of man! With God we shall do valiantly; it is he who will tread down our foes.

chaptersContent.title: Do Not Be Silent, O God of My Praise
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for God's help against enemies and false accusers
chaptersContent.content: Be not silent, O God of my praise! For wicked and deceitful mouths are opened against me, speaking against me with lying tongues. But you, O God my Lord, deal on my behalf for your name's sake; because your steadfast love is good, deliver me!

chaptersContent.title: The Lord Says to My Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Prophetic psalm about the Messiah's priesthood and reign
chaptersContent.content: The Lord says to my Lord: Sit at my right hand, until I make your enemies your footstool. The Lord has sworn and will not change his mind, You are a priest forever after the order of Melchizedek.

chaptersContent.title: Great Are the Lord's Works
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's works and the fear of the Lord
chaptersContent.content: Praise the Lord! I will give thanks to the Lord with my whole heart, in the company of the upright, in the congregation. The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom; all those who practice it have a good understanding.

chaptersContent.title: Blessed Is the One Who Fears the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Description of the blessed life of the righteous
chaptersContent.content: Praise the Lord! Blessed is the man who fears the Lord, who greatly delights in his commandments! Light dawns in the darkness for the upright; he is gracious, merciful, and righteous. He has distributed freely; he has given to the poor; his righteousness endures forever.

chaptersContent.title: Who Is Like the Lord Our God
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's greatness and care for the lowly
chaptersContent.content: Praise the Lord! Praise, O servants of the Lord, praise the name of the Lord! The Lord is high above all nations, and his glory above the heavens! He raises the poor from the dust and lifts the needy from the ash heap.

chaptersContent.title: Tremble, O Earth
chaptersContent.summary: Celebration of God's power in the exodus from Egypt
chaptersContent.content: When Israel went out from Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of strange language, Judah became his sanctuary, Israel his dominion. Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob.

chaptersContent.title: Not to Us, O Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Praise to God and contrast with worthless idols
chaptersContent.content: Not to us, O Lord, not to us, but to your name give glory, for the sake of your steadfast love and your faithfulness! Our God is in the heavens; he does all that he pleases. O Israel, trust in the Lord! He is their help and their shield.

chaptersContent.title: I Love the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Thanksgiving for God's deliverance from death
chaptersContent.content: I love the Lord, because he has heard my voice and my pleas for mercy. Precious in the sight of the Lord is the death of his saints. O Lord, I am your servant; I am your servant, the son of your maidservant. You have loosed my bonds.

chaptersContent.title: Praise the Lord, All Nations
chaptersContent.summary: Shortest psalm calling all nations to praise God
chaptersContent.content: Praise the Lord, all nations! Extol him, all peoples! For great is his steadfast love toward us, and the faithfulness of the Lord endures forever. Praise the Lord!

chaptersContent.title: Give Thanks to the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Thanksgiving for God's salvation and deliverance
chaptersContent.content: Oh give thanks to the Lord, for he is good; for his steadfast love endures forever! The stone that the builders rejected has become the cornerstone. This is the day that the Lord has made; let us rejoice and be glad in it.

chaptersContent.title: Your Word Is a Lamp to My Feet
chaptersContent.summary: The longest psalm celebrating God's law and word
chaptersContent.content: How can a young man keep his way pure? By guarding it according to your word. I have stored up your word in my heart, that I might not sin against you. Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.

chaptersContent.title: Deliver Me, O Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for deliverance from lying and deceitful people
chaptersContent.content: In my distress I called to the Lord, and he answered me. Deliver me, O Lord, from lying lips, from a deceitful tongue. I am for peace, but when I speak, they are for war!

chaptersContent.title: My Help Comes from the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Trust in God's protection and care
chaptersContent.content: I lift up my eyes to the hills. From where does my help come? My help comes from the Lord, who made heaven and earth. The Lord will keep you from all evil; he will keep your life.

chaptersContent.title: Let Us Go to the House of the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Joy in going to worship at Jerusalem
chaptersContent.content: I was glad when they said to me, Let us go to the house of the Lord! Our feet have been standing within your gates, O Jerusalem! Jerusalembuilt as a city that is bound firmly together.

chaptersContent.title: To You I Lift Up My Eyes
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for God's mercy in the face of contempt
chaptersContent.content: To you I lift up my eyes, O you who are enthroned in the heavens! Behold, as the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master, as the eyes of a maidservant to the hand of her mistress, so our eyes look to the Lord our God.

chaptersContent.title: If It Had Not Been the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Thanksgiving for God's deliverance from enemies
chaptersContent.content: If it had not been the Lord who was on our sidelet Israel now sayif it had not been the Lord who was on our side when people rose up against us, then they would have swallowed us up alive.

chaptersContent.title: Those Who Trust in the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Security of those who trust in God
chaptersContent.content: Those who trust in the Lord are like Mount Zion, which cannot be moved, but abides forever. As the mountains surround Jerusalem, so the Lord surrounds his people, from this time forth and forevermore.

chaptersContent.title: When the Lord Restored the Fortunes of Zion
chaptersContent.summary: Joy at God's restoration and prayer for more blessing
chaptersContent.content: When the Lord restored the fortunes of Zion, we were like those who dream. Then our mouth was filled with laughter, and our tongue with shouts of joy; then they said among the nations, The Lord has done great things for them.

chaptersContent.title: Unless the Lord Builds the House
chaptersContent.summary: The futility of human effort without God's blessing
chaptersContent.content: Unless the Lord builds the house, those who build it labor in vain. Unless the Lord watches over the city, the watchman stays awake in vain. Behold, children are a heritage from the Lord, the fruit of the womb a reward.

chaptersContent.title: Blessed Is Everyone Who Fears the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Blessings for those who fear and walk in God's ways
chaptersContent.content: Blessed is everyone who fears the Lord, who walks in his ways! You shall eat the fruit of the labor of your hands; you shall be blessed, and it shall be well with you. May you see your children's children!

chaptersContent.title: They Have Afflicted Me from My Youth
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for God's judgment on Israel's enemies
chaptersContent.content: Greatly have they afflicted me from my youthlet Israel now saygreatly have they afflicted me from my youth, but they have not prevailed against me. The blessing of the Lord be upon you! We bless you in the name of the Lord!

chaptersContent.title: Out of the Depths
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for forgiveness and hope in God's mercy
chaptersContent.content: Out of the depths I cry to you, O Lord! O Lord, hear my voice! Let your ears be attentive to the voice of my pleas for mercy! I wait for the Lord, my soul waits, and in his word I hope.

chaptersContent.title: I Have Calmed and Quieted My Soul
chaptersContent.summary: David's contentment and trust like a weaned child
chaptersContent.content: O Lord, my heart is not lifted up; my eyes are not raised too high; I do not occupy myself with things too great and too marvelous for me. But I have calmed and quieted my soul, like a weaned child with its mother.

chaptersContent.title: Remember, O Lord, for David
chaptersContent.summary: Prayer for God to remember His promises to David
chaptersContent.content: Remember, O Lord, in David's favor, all the hardships he endured, how he swore to the Lord and vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob, I will not enter my house or get into my bed.

chaptersContent.title: Behold, How Good and Pleasant
chaptersContent.summary: The blessing of unity among God's people
chaptersContent.content: Behold, how good and pleasant it is when brothers dwell in unity! It is like the precious oil on the head, running down on the beard, on the beard of Aaron, running down on the collar of his robes!

chaptersContent.title: Come, Bless the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Call to worship for the servants of the Lord
chaptersContent.content: Come, bless the Lord, all you servants of the Lord, who stand by night in the house of the Lord! Lift up your hands to the holy place and bless the Lord! May the Lord bless you from Zion, he who made heaven and earth!

chaptersContent.title: Praise the Name of the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Praise for God's greatness and His choice of Israel
chaptersContent.content: Praise the Lord! Praise the name of the Lord, give praise, O servants of the Lord, who stand in the house of the Lord, in the courts of the house of our God! Praise the Lord, for the Lord is good; sing to his name, for it is pleasant!

chaptersContent.title: His Steadfast Love Endures Forever
chaptersContent.summary: Thanksgiving for God's works with repeated refrain
chaptersContent.content: Give thanks to the Lord, for he is good, for his steadfast love endures forever. Give thanks to the God of gods, for his steadfast love endures forever. Give thanks to the God of heaven, for his steadfast love endures forever.

chaptersContent.title: How Shall We Sing the Lord's Song
chaptersContent.summary: Lament of exiles in Babylon who cannot sing
