chaptersContent.content: And you, O son of man, thus says the Lord God to the land of Israel: An end! The end has come upon the four corners of the land. Now the end is upon you, and I will send my anger upon you; I will judge you according to your ways.

chaptersContent.title: Idolatry in the Temple
chaptersContent.summary: Ezekiel sees the idolatry practiced in the temple
chaptersContent.content: He put out the form of a hand and took me by a lock of my head, and the Spirit lifted me up between earth and heaven and brought me in visions of God to Jerusalem, to the entrance of the gateway of the inner court that faces north, where was the seat of the image of jealousy.

chaptersContent.title: The Mark of Protection
chaptersContent.summary: The righteous are marked for protection before judgment
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said to him, Pass through the city, through Jerusalem, and put a mark on the foreheads of the men who sigh and groan over all the abominations that are committed in it. And to the others he said in my hearing, Pass through the city after him, and strike.

chaptersContent.title: God's Glory Leaves the Temple
chaptersContent.summary: The glory of God departs from the temple
chaptersContent.content: And the glory of the Lord went up from the cherub to the threshold of the house, and the house was filled with the cloud, and the court was filled with the brightness of the glory of the Lord. Now the cherubim were standing on the south side of the house.

chaptersContent.title: Judgment on the Leaders
chaptersContent.summary: Judgment on the wicked leaders of Jerusalem
chaptersContent.content: Who say, The time is not near to build houses. This city is the cauldron, and we are the meat. Therefore say, Thus says the Lord God: Though I removed them far off among the nations, and though I scattered them among the countries, yet I have been a sanctuary to them for a while in the countries where they have gone.

chaptersContent.title: Ezekiel's Exile Sign
chaptersContent.summary: Ezekiel acts out going into exile
chaptersContent.content: As for you, son of man, prepare for yourself an exile's baggage, and go into exile by day in their sight. You shall go out from your place and go into exile to another place in their sight. Perhaps they will understand, though they are a rebellious house.

chaptersContent.title: False Prophets Condemned
chaptersContent.summary: Condemnation of false prophets who mislead the people
chaptersContent.content: Thus says the Lord God, Woe to the foolish prophets who follow their own spirit, and have seen nothing! Because, yes, because they have misled my people, saying, Peace, when there is no peace, and because, when the people build a wall, these prophets smear it with whitewash.

chaptersContent.title: Idolatrous Elders
chaptersContent.summary: Elders with idols in their hearts seek Ezekiel
chaptersContent.content: Son of man, these men have taken their idols into their hearts, and set the stumbling block of their iniquity before their faces. Should I indeed let myself be consulted by them? I will set my face against that man and make him a sign and a byword.

chaptersContent.title: Jerusalem Like a Useless Vine
chaptersContent.summary: Jerusalem is compared to a useless vine branch
chaptersContent.content: Son of man, how does the wood of the vine surpass any wood, the vine branch that is among the trees of the forest? Is wood taken from it to make anything? Do people take a peg from it to hang any vessel on it? Behold, it is given to the fire for fuel.

chaptersContent.title: Jerusalem's Unfaithfulness
chaptersContent.summary: Jerusalem's spiritual adultery and unfaithfulness to God
chaptersContent.content: When I passed by you again and saw you, behold, you were at the age for love, and I spread the corner of my garment over you and covered your nakedness; I made my vow to you and entered into a covenant with you, declares the Lord God, and you became mine.

chaptersContent.title: The Two Eagles
chaptersContent.summary: Parable of two eagles representing kings and kingdoms
chaptersContent.content: A great eagle with great wings and long pinions, rich in plumage of many colors, came to Lebanon and took the top of the cedar. He broke off the topmost of its young twigs and carried it to a land of trade and set it in a city of merchants.

chaptersContent.title: Individual Responsibility
chaptersContent.summary: Each person is responsible for their own sins
chaptersContent.content: Behold, all souls are mine; the soul of the father as well as the soul of the son is mine: the soul who sins shall die. The soul who sins shall die. The son shall not suffer for the iniquity of the father, nor the father suffer for the iniquity of the son.

chaptersContent.title: Lament for the Princes
chaptersContent.summary: Lament for the princes of Israel
chaptersContent.content: And you, take up a lamentation for the princes of Israel, and say: What was your mother? A lioness! Among lions she crouched; in the midst of young lions she reared her cubs. Your mother was like a vine in a vineyard planted by the water, fruitful and full of branches.

chaptersContent.title: Israel's Rebellion
chaptersContent.summary: History of Israel's rebellion against God
chaptersContent.content: Say to them, Thus says the Lord God: On the day when I chose Israel, I swore to the offspring of the house of Jacob, making myself known to them in the land of Egypt. I swore to them, saying, I am the Lord your God. As I live, declares the Lord God, surely with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm and with wrath poured out I will be king over you.

chaptersContent.title: The Sword of the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: The sword of judgment against Jerusalem and Ammon
chaptersContent.content: And say to the land of Israel, Thus says the Lord: Behold, I am against you and will draw my sword from its sheath and will cut off from you both righteous and wicked. Because I will cut off from you both righteous and wicked, therefore my sword shall be drawn from its sheath against all flesh from south to north.

chaptersContent.title: Jerusalem's Sins
chaptersContent.summary: Detailed list of Jerusalem's sins and corruption
chaptersContent.content: And you, son of man, will you judge, will you judge the bloody city? Then declare to her all her abominations. In you they take bribes to shed blood; you take interest and profit and make gain of your neighbors by extortion; and you have forgotten me, declares the Lord God.

chaptersContent.title: Two Adulterous Sisters
chaptersContent.summary: Parable of Oholah and Oholibah representing Samaria and Jerusalem
chaptersContent.content: Oholah was the name of the elder and Oholibah the name of her sister. They became mine, and they bore sons and daughters. As for their names, Oholah is Samaria, and Oholibah is Jerusalem. Therefore, O Oholibah, thus says the Lord God: Behold, I will stir up against you your lovers from whom you turned in disgust.

chaptersContent.title: The Boiling Pot
chaptersContent.summary: Parable of the boiling pot representing Jerusalem's judgment
chaptersContent.content: Set on the pot, set it on and pour water into it. Put in it the pieces of meat, all the good pieces, the thigh and the shoulder; fill it with choice bones. Woe to the bloody city, to the pot whose corrosion is in it, and whose corrosion has not gone out of it!

chaptersContent.title: Judgment on Ammon
chaptersContent.summary: Judgment on Ammon, Moab, Edom, and Philistia
chaptersContent.content: And say to the Ammonites, Hear the word of the Lord God: Thus says the Lord God, Because you said, Aha! over my sanctuary when it was profaned, and over the land of Israel when it was made desolate, and over the house of Judah when they went into exile.

chaptersContent.title: Judgment on Tyre
chaptersContent.summary: Prophecy of Tyre's destruction
chaptersContent.content: Son of man, because Tyre said concerning Jerusalem, Aha, the gate of the peoples is broken; it has swung open to me. I shall be replenished, now that she is laid waste, therefore thus says the Lord God: Behold, I am against you, O Tyre, and will bring up many nations against you.

chaptersContent.title: Lament for Tyre
chaptersContent.summary: Lament over the fall of Tyre
chaptersContent.content: And you, son of man, raise a lamentation over Tyre, and say to Tyre, who dwells at the entrances to the sea, merchant of the peoples to many coastlands, thus says the Lord God: O Tyre, you have said, I am perfect in beauty. Your borders are in the heart of the seas; your builders made perfect your beauty.

chaptersContent.title: Judgment on Tyre's King
chaptersContent.summary: Judgment on the king of Tyre and Sidon
chaptersContent.content: Son of man, say to the prince of Tyre, Thus says the Lord God: Because your heart is proud, and you have said, I am a god, I sit in the seat of the gods, in the heart of the seas, yet you are but a man, and no god, though you make your heart like the heart of a god.

chaptersContent.title: Judgment on Egypt
chaptersContent.summary: Prophecy of Egypt's defeat and captivity
chaptersContent.content: Speak, and say, Thus says the Lord God: Behold, I am against you, Pharaoh king of Egypt, the great dragon that lies in the midst of his streams, that says, My Nile is my own; I made it for myself. And all the inhabitants of Egypt shall know that I am the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Egypt's Complete Destruction
chaptersContent.summary: Complete destruction of Egypt and her allies
chaptersContent.content: Son of man, prophesy, and say, Thus says the Lord God: Wail, Alas for the day! For the day is near, the day of the Lord is near; it will be a day of clouds, a time of doom for the nations. A sword shall come upon Egypt, and anguish shall be in Cush.

chaptersContent.title: Pharaoh Like a Cedar
chaptersContent.summary: Pharaoh compared to a great cedar tree that falls
chaptersContent.content: Son of man, say to Pharaoh king of Egypt and to his troops: Whom are you like in your greatness? Behold, Assyria was a cedar in Lebanon, with beautiful branches and forest shade, and of towering height, its top among the clouds.

chaptersContent.title: Lament for Pharaoh
chaptersContent.summary: Lament over Pharaoh and Egypt's fall
chaptersContent.content: Son of man, raise a lamentation over Pharaoh king of Egypt and say to him: You consider yourself a lion of the nations, but you are like a dragon in the seas; you burst forth in your rivers, trouble the waters with your feet, and foul their rivers.

chaptersContent.title: Ezekiel as Watchman
chaptersContent.summary: Ezekiel's role as watchman and call to repentance
chaptersContent.content: So you, son of man, I have made a watchman for the house of Israel. Whenever you hear a word from my mouth, you shall give them warning from me. Say to them, As I live, declares the Lord God, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked, but that the wicked turn from his way and live.

chaptersContent.title: Shepherds and Sheep
chaptersContent.summary: Condemnation of bad shepherds and promise of good shepherd
chaptersContent.content: Son of man, prophesy against the shepherds of Israel; prophesy, and say to them, even to the shepherds, Thus says the Lord God: Ah, shepherds of Israel who have been feeding yourselves! Should not shepherds feed the sheep? Behold, I, I myself will search for my sheep and will seek them out.

chaptersContent.title: Judgment on Mount Seir
chaptersContent.summary: Judgment on Edom (Mount Seir)
chaptersContent.content: Son of man, set your face against Mount Seir, and prophesy against it, and say to it, Thus says the Lord God: Behold, I am against you, Mount Seir, and I will stretch out my hand against you, and I will make you a desolation and a waste.

chaptersContent.title: Restoration of Israel
chaptersContent.summary: Promise of Israel's restoration and new heart
chaptersContent.content: I will take you from the nations and gather you from all the countries and bring you into your own land. And I will give you a new heart, and a new spirit I will put within you. And I will remove the heart of stone from your flesh and give you a heart of flesh.

chaptersContent.title: The Valley of Dry Bones
chaptersContent.summary: Vision of dry bones coming to life, symbolizing Israel's restoration
chaptersContent.content: And he said to me, 'Son of man, can these bones live?' And I answered, 'O Lord God, you know.' Thus says the Lord God to these bones: Behold, I will cause breath to enter you, and you shall live. And I will put my Spirit within you, and you shall live, and I will place you in your own land.

chaptersContent.title: Gog and Magog
chaptersContent.summary: Prophecy of Gog and Magog's attack on Israel
chaptersContent.content: Son of man, set your face toward Gog, of the land of Magog, the chief prince of Meshech and Tubal, and prophesy against him and say, Thus says the Lord God: Behold, I am against you, O Gog, chief prince of Meshech and Tubal.

chaptersContent.title: Gog's Defeat
chaptersContent.summary: Gog's defeat and Israel's restoration
chaptersContent.content: And I will turn you about and drive you forward, and bring you up from the uttermost parts of the north, and lead you against the mountains of Israel. And my holy name I will make known in the midst of my people Israel, and I will not let my holy name be profaned anymore.

chaptersContent.title: Vision of the New Temple
chaptersContent.summary: Ezekiel sees the measurements of the new temple
chaptersContent.content: In visions of God he brought me to the land of Israel, and set me down on a very high mountain, on which was a structure like a city to the south. And behold, there was a wall all around the outside of the temple area, and the length of the measuring reed in the man's hand was six long cubits.

chaptersContent.title: Temple Measurements
chaptersContent.summary: Detailed measurements of the temple building
chaptersContent.content: Then he brought me to the nave and measured the jambs. On each side six cubits was the breadth of the jamb. And the breadth of the entrance was ten cubits, and the sidewalls of the entrance were five cubits on either side.

chaptersContent.title: Chambers and Courts
chaptersContent.summary: Measurements of the temple chambers and courts
chaptersContent.content: Then he led me out into the outer court, toward the north, and he brought me to the chambers that were opposite the separate yard and opposite the building on the north. Before the length of 100 cubits was the north door, and the length was 50 cubits.

chaptersContent.title: God's Glory Returns
chaptersContent.summary: The glory of God returns to the new temple
chaptersContent.content: And behold, the glory of the God of Israel was coming from the east. And the sound of his coming was like the sound of many waters, and the earth shone with his glory. And the vision I saw was just like the vision that I had seen when he came to destroy the city.

chaptersContent.title: Temple Regulations
chaptersContent.summary: Regulations for the temple and its priests
chaptersContent.content: Then he brought me by way of the north gate to the front of the temple, and I looked, and behold, the glory of the Lord filled the temple of the Lord. And I fell on my face. And the Lord said to me, Son of man, mark well, see with your eyes, and hear with your ears all that I shall tell you.

chaptersContent.title: Allotment of Land
chaptersContent.summary: Allotment of land for the temple and priests
chaptersContent.content: When you allot the land as an inheritance, you shall set apart for the Lord a portion of the land as a holy district, 25,000 cubits long and 20,000 cubits broad. It shall be holy throughout its whole extent. Of this a square plot of 500 by 500 cubits shall be for the sanctuary.

chaptersContent.title: Prince's Offerings
chaptersContent.summary: Regulations for the prince's offerings and worship
chaptersContent.content: Thus says the Lord God: The gate of the inner court that faces east shall be shut on the six working days, but on the Sabbath day it shall be opened, and on the day of the new moon it shall be opened. The prince shall enter by the vestibule of the gate from outside.

chaptersContent.title: The River of Life
chaptersContent.summary: Vision of water flowing from the temple bringing life
chaptersContent.content: Then he brought me back to the door of the temple, and behold, water was issuing from below the threshold of the temple toward the east. And wherever the river goes, every living creature that swarms will live, and there will be very many fish. Everything will live where the river goes.

chaptersContent.title: Division of the Land
chaptersContent.summary: Final division of the land among the tribes
chaptersContent.content: These are the names of the tribes: Dan, one portion at the extreme north, adjoining the way of Hethlon to Lebo-hamath, as far as Hazar-enan. And from the border of Dan, from the east side to the west, Asher, one portion. And from the border of Asher, from the east side to the west, Naphtali, one portion.

books.name: Daniel
books.description: Daniel's faithfulness in exile and prophetic visions
books.author: Daniel

chaptersContent.title: Daniel's Resolve
chaptersContent.summary: Daniel and his friends remain faithful to God in Babylon
chaptersContent.content: But Daniel resolved that he would not defile himself with the king's food, or with the wine that he drank. Therefore he asked the chief of the eunuchs to allow him not to defile himself. As for these four youths, God gave them learning and skill in all literature and wisdom, and Daniel had understanding in all visions and dreams.

chaptersContent.title: Nebuchadnezzar's Dream
chaptersContent.summary: Daniel interprets the king's dream of the great image
chaptersContent.content: Daniel answered and said: 'Blessed be the name of God forever and ever, to whom belong wisdom and might. He reveals deep and hidden things; he knows what is in the darkness, and the light dwells with him. And in the days of those kings the God of heaven will set up a kingdom that shall never be destroyed.'

chaptersContent.title: The Fiery Furnace
chaptersContent.summary: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego refuse to worship the golden image
chaptersContent.content: If this be so, our God whom we serve is able to deliver us from the burning fiery furnace, and he will deliver us out of your hand, O king. But if not, be it known to you, O king, that we will not serve your gods or worship the golden image that you have set up.

chaptersContent.title: Nebuchadnezzar's Madness
chaptersContent.summary: The king's dream of a tree and his temporary madness
chaptersContent.content: The sentence is by the decree of the watchers, the decision by the word of the holy ones, to the end that the living may know that the Most High rules the kingdom of men and gives it to whom he will and sets over it the lowliest of men.

chaptersContent.title: The Writing on the Wall
chaptersContent.summary: Belshazzar's feast and the mysterious writing on the wall
chaptersContent.content: Immediately the fingers of a human hand appeared and wrote on the plaster of the wall of the king's palace, opposite the lampstand. And the king saw the hand as it wrote. And this is the writing that was inscribed: MENE, MENE, TEKEL, and PARSIN.

chaptersContent.title: Daniel in the Lion's Den
chaptersContent.summary: Daniel continues to pray despite the king's decree and is protected by God
chaptersContent.content: When Daniel knew that the document had been signed, he went to his house where he had windows in his upper chamber open toward Jerusalem. He got down on his knees three times a day and prayed and gave thanks before his God, as he had done previously.

chaptersContent.title: Daniel's Vision of Four Beasts
chaptersContent.summary: Vision of four beasts and the Ancient of Days
chaptersContent.content: I saw in the night visions, and behold, with the clouds of heaven there came one like a son of man, and he came to the Ancient of Days and was presented before him. And to him was given dominion and glory and a kingdom, that all peoples, nations, and languages should serve him.

chaptersContent.title: Vision of the Ram and Goat
chaptersContent.summary: Vision of a ram, goat, and the little horn
chaptersContent.content: As I was considering, behold, a male goat came from the west across the face of the whole earth, without touching the ground. And the goat had a conspicuous horn between his eyes. He came to the ram with the two horns, which I had seen standing on the bank of the canal.

chaptersContent.title: Daniel's Prayer and the Seventy Weeks
chaptersContent.summary: Daniel's prayer of confession and the prophecy of seventy weeks
chaptersContent.content: Then I turned my face to the Lord God, seeking him by prayer and pleas for mercy with fasting and sackcloth and ashes. O Lord, hear; O Lord, forgive. O Lord, pay attention and act. Delay not, for your own sake, O my God, because your city and your people are called by your name.

chaptersContent.title: Daniel's Vision by the Tigris
chaptersContent.summary: Daniel's vision of a glorious man and his strength renewed
chaptersContent.content: His body was like beryl, his face like the appearance of lightning, his eyes like flaming torches, his arms and legs like the gleam of burnished bronze, and the sound of his words like the sound of a multitude. Fear not, Daniel, for from the first day that you set your heart to understand.

chaptersContent.title: Kings of the North and South
chaptersContent.summary: Detailed prophecy about future kings and conflicts
chaptersContent.content: And now I will show you the truth. Behold, three more kings shall arise in Persia, and a fourth shall be far richer than all of them. And when he has become strong through his riches, he shall stir up all against the kingdom of Greece.

chaptersContent.title: The Time of the End
chaptersContent.summary: Prophecy about the end times and resurrection
chaptersContent.content: At that time shall arise Michael, the great prince who has charge of your people. And there shall be a time of trouble, such as never has been since there was a nation till that time. But at that time your people shall be delivered, everyone whose name shall be found written in the book.

books.name: Hosea
books.description: God's unfailing love despite Israel's unfaithfulness
books.author: Hosea

chaptersContent.title: Hosea's Marriage
chaptersContent.summary: God commands Hosea to marry an unfaithful woman as a symbol
chaptersContent.content: When the Lord first spoke through Hosea, the Lord said to Hosea, 'Go, take to yourself a wife of whoredom and have children of whoredom, for the land commits great whoredom by forsaking the Lord.' Yet the number of the children of Israel shall be like the sand of the sea, which cannot be measured or numbered.

chaptersContent.title: Israel's Unfaithfulness
chaptersContent.summary: God's judgment on Israel for spiritual adultery
chaptersContent.content: Plead with your mother, pleadfor she is not my wife, and I am not her husbandthat she put away her whoring from her face, and her adultery from between her breasts. She did not know that it was I who gave her the grain, the wine, and the oil, and who lavished on her silver and gold.

chaptersContent.title: Hosea's Reconciliation
chaptersContent.summary: Hosea redeems his wife, symbolizing God's restoration of Israel
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said to me, 'Go again, love a woman who is loved by another man and is an adulteress, even as the Lord loves the children of Israel, though they turn to other gods and love cakes of raisins.' So I bought her for fifteen shekels of silver and a homer and a lethech of barley.

chaptersContent.title: God's Case Against Israel
chaptersContent.summary: God's indictment of Israel for lack of knowledge and faithfulness
chaptersContent.content: Hear the word of the Lord, O children of Israel, for the Lord has a controversy with the inhabitants of the land. There is no faithfulness or steadfast love, and no knowledge of God in the land. My people are destroyed for lack of knowledge; because you have rejected knowledge, I reject you from being a priest to me.

chaptersContent.title: Judgment on Leaders
chaptersContent.summary: God's judgment on priests, people, and leaders of Israel
chaptersContent.content: Hear this, O priests! Pay attention, O house of Israel! Give ear, O house of the king! For the judgment is for you; for you have been a snare at Mizpah and a net spread upon Tabor. Their deeds do not permit them to return to their God, for the spirit of whoredom is within them.

chaptersContent.title: A Call to Repentance
chaptersContent.summary: Call for Israel to return to the Lord with genuine repentance
chaptersContent.content: Come, let us return to the Lord; for he has torn us, that he may heal us; he has struck us down, and he will bind us up. After two days he will revive us; on the third day he will raise us up, that we may live before him. For I desire steadfast love and not sacrifice, the knowledge of God rather than burnt offerings.

chaptersContent.title: Israel's Corruption
chaptersContent.summary: Israel's corruption and God's desire to heal them
chaptersContent.content: When I would heal Israel, the iniquity of Ephraim is revealed, and the evil deeds of Samaria; for they deal falsely; the thief breaks in, and the bandits raid outside. Ephraim mixes himself with the peoples; Ephraim is a cake not turned. Woe to them, for they have strayed from me!

chaptersContent.title: Israel's False Worship
chaptersContent.summary: Israel's idolatry and false worship bring judgment
chaptersContent.content: They made kings, but not through me. They set up princes, but I knew it not. With their silver and gold they made idols for their own destruction. For they sow the wind, and they shall reap the whirlwind. The standing grain has no heads; it shall yield no flour; if it were to yield, strangers would devour it.

chaptersContent.title: Punishment for Idolatry
chaptersContent.summary: God's punishment for Israel's idolatry and unfaithfulness
chaptersContent.content: Rejoice not, O Israel! Exult not like the peoples; for you have played the whore, forsaking your God. You have loved a prostitute's wages on all threshing floors. The days of punishment have come; the days of recompense have come; Israel shall know it.

chaptersContent.title: Israel's Sin and Captivity
chaptersContent.summary: Israel's sin leads to captivity and destruction
chaptersContent.content: Israel is a luxuriant vine that yields its fruit. The more his fruit increased, the more altars he built; as his country improved, he improved his pillars. The high places of Aven, the sin of Israel, shall be destroyed. Thorn and thistle shall come up on their altars.

chaptersContent.title: God's Love for Israel
chaptersContent.summary: God's tender love for Israel despite their rebellion
chaptersContent.content: When Israel was a child, I loved him, and out of Egypt I called my son. I led them with cords of kindness, with the bands of love, and I became to them as one who eases the yoke on their jaws, and I bent down to them and fed them. How can I give you up, O Ephraim?

chaptersContent.title: Israel's Deceit and God's Grace
chaptersContent.summary: Israel's deceit contrasted with God's grace and faithfulness
chaptersContent.content: The Lord has an indictment against Judah and will punish Jacob according to his ways; he will repay him according to his deeds. So you, by the help of your God, return, hold fast to love and justice, and wait continually for your God. I am the Lord your God from the land of Egypt.

chaptersContent.title: The Lord's Anger and Mercy
chaptersContent.summary: God's anger at Israel's sin but promise of redemption
chaptersContent.content: But I am the Lord your God from the land of Egypt; you know no God but me, and besides me there is no savior. It is your destruction, O Israel, because you are against me, against your helper. I shall ransom them from the power of Sheol; I shall redeem them from Death.

chaptersContent.title: God's Love for Israel
chaptersContent.summary: God's tender love and reluctance to give up on Israel
chaptersContent.content: When Israel was a child, I loved him, and out of Egypt I called my son. I led them with cords of kindness, with the bands of love, and I became to them as one who eases the yoke on their jaws, and I bent down to them and fed them. How can I give you up, O Ephraim? How can I hand you over, O Israel?

chaptersContent.title: Return to the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Call to repentance and promise of restoration
chaptersContent.content: Return, O Israel, to the Lord your God, for you have stumbled because of your iniquity. I will heal their apostasy; I will love them freely, for my anger has turned from them. Whoever is wise, let him understand these things; whoever is discerning, let him know them; for the ways of the Lord are right, and the upright walk in them, but transgressors stumble in them.

books.name: Joel
books.description: Prophecy about the Day of the Lord and outpouring of the Spirit
books.author: Joel

chaptersContent.title: The Locust Plague
chaptersContent.summary: Joel describes a devastating locust plague as a sign of judgment
chaptersContent.content: What the cutting locust left, the swarming locust has eaten. What the swarming locust left, the hopping locust has eaten, and what the hopping locust left, the destroying locust has eaten.

chaptersContent.title: The Day of the Lord and Promise of the Spirit
chaptersContent.summary: Joel prophesies about the Day of the Lord and God's Spirit being poured out
chaptersContent.content: And it shall come to pass afterward, that I will pour out my Spirit on all flesh; your sons and your daughters shall prophesy, your old men shall dream dreams, and your young men shall see visions.

chaptersContent.title: Judgment of the Nations
chaptersContent.summary: God promises to judge the nations and restore Israel
chaptersContent.content: I will gather all the nations and bring them down to the Valley of Jehoshaphat. And I will enter into judgment with them there, on behalf of my people and my heritage Israel.

books.name: Amos
books.description: Prophecy calling for social justice and righteousness
books.author: Amos

chaptersContent.title: Judgment on the Nations
chaptersContent.summary: God's judgment on surrounding nations for their sins
chaptersContent.content: And he said: The Lord roars from Zion, and utters his voice from Jerusalem; the pastures of the shepherds mourn, and the top of Carmel withers. Thus says the Lord: For three transgressions of Damascus, and for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because they have threshed Gilead with threshing sledges of iron.

chaptersContent.title: Judgment on Judah and Israel
chaptersContent.summary: God's judgment on Judah and Israel for their sins
chaptersContent.content: Thus says the Lord: For three transgressions of Judah, and for four, I will not revoke the punishment, because they have rejected the law of the Lord, and have not kept his statutes, but their lies have led them astray, those after which their fathers walked.

chaptersContent.title: Israel's Guilt and Punishment
chaptersContent.summary: Israel's guilt and the certainty of God's punishment
chaptersContent.content: You only have I known of all the families of the earth; therefore I will punish you for all your iniquities. Do two walk together, unless they have agreed to meet? Does a lion roar in the forest, when he has no prey? Does a young lion cry out from his den, if he has taken nothing?

chaptersContent.title: Israel Has Not Returned
chaptersContent.summary: God's warnings and Israel's failure to return to Him
chaptersContent.content: I gave you cleanness of teeth in all your cities, and lack of bread in all your places, yet you did not return to me, declares the Lord. I would send rain upon one city and send no rain upon another city; one field would have rain, and the field on which it did not rain would wither.

chaptersContent.title: Woe to Those at Ease
chaptersContent.summary: Woe to those who are complacent and trust in their strength
chaptersContent.content: Woe to those who are at ease in Zion, and to those who feel secure on the mountain of Samaria, the notable men of the first of the nations, to whom the house of Israel comes! Woe to those who lie on beds of ivory and stretch themselves out on their couches.

chaptersContent.title: The Basket of Summer Fruit
chaptersContent.summary: Vision of summer fruit symbolizes Israel's end and judgment
chaptersContent.content: This is what the Lord God showed me: behold, a basket of summer fruit. And he said, Amos, what do you see? And I said, A basket of summer fruit. Then the Lord said to me, The end has come upon my people Israel; I will never again pass by them.

chaptersContent.title: Seek Good
chaptersContent.summary: Call to seek good and establish justice
chaptersContent.content: Seek good, and not evil, that you may live; and so the Lord, the God of hosts, will be with you, as you have said. Hate evil, and love good, and establish justice in the gate; it may be that the Lord, the God of hosts, will be gracious to the remnant of Joseph. But let justice roll down like waters, and righteousness like an ever-flowing stream.

chaptersContent.title: Visions of Judgment
chaptersContent.summary: Amos sees visions of coming judgment on Israel
chaptersContent.content: This is what he showed me: behold, the Lord was standing beside a wall built with a plumb line, with a plumb line in his hand. And the Lord said to me, 'Amos, what do you see?' And I said, 'A plumb line.' Then the Lord said, 'Behold, I am setting a plumb line in the midst of my people Israel; I will never again pass by them.'

chaptersContent.title: Promise of Restoration
chaptersContent.summary: Despite judgment, God promises future restoration
chaptersContent.content: In that day I will raise up the booth of David that is fallen and repair its breaches, and raise up its ruins and rebuild it as in the days of old. Behold, the days are coming, declares the Lord, when the plowman shall overtake the reaper and the treader of grapes him who sows the seed; the mountains shall drip sweet wine, and all the hills shall flow with it.

books.name: Obadiah
books.description: Prophecy of judgment against Edom for their pride and violence
books.author: Obadiah

chaptersContent.title: Judgment on Edom
chaptersContent.summary: God pronounces judgment on Edom for their pride and violence against Israel
chaptersContent.content: The pride of your heart has deceived you, you who live in the clefts of the rock, in your lofty dwelling, who say in your heart, 'Who will bring me down to the ground?' For the day of the Lord is near upon all the nations. As you have done, it shall be done to you; your deeds shall return on your own head.

books.name: Jonah
books.description: The story of Jonah's mission to Nineveh and God's mercy
books.author: Unknown

chaptersContent.title: Jonah Flees from God
chaptersContent.summary: Jonah tries to flee from God's command to go to Nineveh
chaptersContent.content: Now the word of the Lord came to Jonah the son of Amittai, saying, 'Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city, and call out against it, for their evil has come up before me.' But Jonah rose to flee to Tarshish from the presence of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Jonah's Prayer
chaptersContent.summary: From the belly of the fish, Jonah prays and is delivered
chaptersContent.content: Then Jonah prayed to the Lord his God from the belly of the fish, saying, 'I called out to the Lord, out of my distress, and he answered me; out of the belly of Sheol I cried, and you heard my voice.'

chaptersContent.title: Nineveh Repents
chaptersContent.summary: Jonah preaches to Nineveh and the entire city repents
chaptersContent.content: And the people of Nineveh believed God. They called for a fast and put on sackcloth, from the greatest of them to the least of them. When God saw what they did, how they turned from their evil way, God relented of the disaster that he had said he would do to them, and he did not do it.

chaptersContent.title: Jonah's Anger and God's Compassion
chaptersContent.summary: Jonah is angry at God's mercy, but God teaches him about compassion
chaptersContent.content: And he prayed to the Lord and said, 'O Lord, is not this what I said when I was yet in my country? That is why I made haste to flee to Tarshish; for I knew that you are a gracious God and merciful, slow to anger and abounding in steadfast love, and relenting from disaster.'

books.name: Micah
books.description: Prophecy combining judgment with hope and the requirements of God
books.author: Micah

chaptersContent.title: Judgment on Samaria and Jerusalem
chaptersContent.summary: God's judgment on the capitals of Israel and Judah
chaptersContent.content: Hear, you peoples, all of you; pay attention, O earth, and all that is in it, and let the Lord God be a witness against you, the Lord from his holy temple. For behold, the Lord is coming out of his place, and will come down and tread upon the high places of the earth.

chaptersContent.title: Woe to Oppressors
chaptersContent.summary: Woe to those who oppress the poor and take their land
chaptersContent.content: Woe to those who devise wickedness and work evil on their beds! When the morning dawns, they perform it, because it is in the power of their hand. They covet fields and seize them, and houses, and take them away; they oppress a man and his house, a man and his inheritance.

chaptersContent.title: Leaders and Prophets Rebuked
chaptersContent.summary: Rebuke of corrupt leaders, judges, and false prophets
chaptersContent.content: And I said: Hear, you heads of Jacob and rulers of the house of Israel! Is it not for you to know justice? Then they will cry to the Lord, but he will not answer them; he will hide his face from them at that time, because they have made their deeds evil.

chaptersContent.title: The Mountain of the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: Vision of the future exaltation of Zion and peace
chaptersContent.content: It shall come to pass in the latter days that the mountain of the house of the Lord shall be established as the highest of the mountains, and it shall be lifted up above the hills; and peoples shall flow to it, and many nations shall come, and say: Come, let us go up to the mountain of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: The Ruler from Bethlehem
chaptersContent.summary: Prophecy of the Messiah's birth in Bethlehem
chaptersContent.content: But you, O Bethlehem Ephrathah, who are too little to be among the clans of Judah, from you shall come forth for me one who is to be ruler in Israel, whose coming forth is from of old, from ancient days. And he shall stand and shepherd his flock in the strength of the Lord, in the majesty of the name of the Lord his God.

chaptersContent.title: What Does the Lord Require?
chaptersContent.summary: God's requirements: justice, mercy, and humble walking
chaptersContent.content: With what shall I come before the Lord, and bow myself before God on high? Shall I come before him with burnt offerings, with calves a year old? He has told you, O man, what is good; and what does the Lord require of you but to do justice, and to love kindness, and to walk humbly with your God?

chaptersContent.title: God's Mercy and Forgiveness
chaptersContent.summary: Confidence in God's mercy and forgiveness
chaptersContent.content: But as for me, I will look to the Lord; I will wait for the God of my salvation; my God will hear me. Who is a God like you, pardoning iniquity and passing over transgression for the remnant of his inheritance? He does not retain his anger forever, because he delights in steadfast love.

books.name: Nahum
books.description: Prophecy of Nineveh's destruction and God's justice
books.author: Nahum

chaptersContent.title: God's Wrath and Goodness
chaptersContent.summary: God's character as both just judge and good refuge
chaptersContent.content: The Lord is a jealous and avenging God; the Lord is avenging and wrathful; the Lord takes vengeance on his adversaries and keeps wrath for his enemies. The Lord is good, a stronghold in the day of trouble; he knows those who take refuge in him. Behold, upon the mountains, the feet of him who brings good news, who publishes peace!

chaptersContent.title: The Fall of Nineveh
chaptersContent.summary: Vivid description of Nineveh's destruction in battle
chaptersContent.content: The scatterer has come up against you. Man the ramparts; watch the road; dress for battle; collect all your strength. Nineveh of old was like a pool of water, but now they flee away. 'Halt! Halt!' they cry, but none turns back. Behold, I am against you, declares the Lord of hosts, and I will burn your chariots in smoke, and the sword shall devour your young lions.

chaptersContent.title: Nineveh's Complete Destruction
chaptersContent.summary: The complete and final destruction of Nineveh
chaptersContent.content: Woe to the bloody city, all full of lies and plunderno end to the prey! And all who look at you will shrink from you and say, 'Wasted is Nineveh; who will grieve for her?' Where shall I seek comforters for you? There is no easing your hurt; your wound is grievous. All who hear the news about you clap their hands over you. For upon whom has not come your unceasing evil?

books.name: Habakkuk
books.description: A prophet's dialogue with God about justice and faith
books.author: Habakkuk

chaptersContent.title: Habakkuk's Complaint
chaptersContent.summary: The prophet questions God about injustice and violence
chaptersContent.content: O Lord, how long shall I cry for help, and you will not hear? Or cry to you 'Violence!' and you will not save? Look among the nations, and see; wonder and be astounded. For I am doing a work in your days that you would not believe if told. You who are of purer eyes than to see evil and cannot look at wrong, why do you idly look at traitors and remain silent when the wicked swallows up the man more righteous than he?

chaptersContent.title: The Righteous Shall Live by Faith
chaptersContent.summary: God's answer and the principle of living by faith
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord answered me: 'Write the vision; make it plain on tablets, so he may run who reads it. Behold, his soul is puffed up; it is not upright within him, but the righteous shall live by his faith. For the earth will be filled with the knowledge of the glory of the Lord as the waters cover the sea.'

chaptersContent.title: Habakkuk's Prayer
chaptersContent.summary: A prayer of trust and joy despite circumstances
chaptersContent.content: O Lord, I have heard the report of you, and your work, O Lord, do I fear. In the midst of the years revive it; in the midst of the years make it known; in wrath remember mercy. Though the fig tree should not blossom, nor fruit be on the vines, the produce of the olive fail and the fields yield no food, the flock be cut off from the fold and there be no herd in the stalls, yet I will rejoice in the Lord; I will take joy in the God of my salvation.

books.name: Zephaniah
books.description: Prophecy of the Day of the Lord and future restoration
books.author: Zephaniah

chaptersContent.title: The Day of Wrath
chaptersContent.summary: Description of the coming Day of the Lord's wrath
chaptersContent.content: Be silent before the Lord God! For the day of the Lord is near; the Lord has prepared a sacrifice and consecrated his guests. The great day of the Lord is near, near and hastening fast; the sound of the day of the Lord is bitter; the mighty man cries aloud there. Neither their silver nor their gold shall be able to deliver them on the day of the wrath of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Call to Repentance
chaptersContent.summary: A call for repentance and judgment on surrounding nations
chaptersContent.content: Gather together, yes, gather, O shameless nation, before the decree takes effectbefore the day passes away like chaffbefore there comes upon you the burning anger of the Lord. Seek the Lord, all you humble of the land, who do his just commands; seek righteousness; seek humility; perhaps you may be hidden on the day of the anger of the Lord.

chaptersContent.title: Promise of Restoration
chaptersContent.summary: God's promise to restore and rejoice over His people
chaptersContent.content: For at that time I will change the speech of the peoples to a pure speech, that all of them may call upon the name of the Lord and serve him with one accord. The Lord your God is in your midst, a mighty one who will save; he will rejoice over you with gladness; he will quiet you by his love; he will exult over you with loud singing.

books.name: Haggai
books.description: Prophecy encouraging the rebuilding of the temple after exile
books.author: Haggai

chaptersContent.title: Call to Rebuild the Temple
chaptersContent.summary: Haggai challenges the people to prioritize rebuilding God's temple
chaptersContent.content: Is it a time for you yourselves to dwell in your paneled houses, while this house lies in ruins? Now, therefore, thus says the Lord of hosts: Consider your ways. You have sown much, and harvested little.

chaptersContent.title: The Glory of the New Temple
chaptersContent.summary: God promises that the new temple's glory will exceed the former
chaptersContent.content: Yet now be strong, O Zerubbabel, declares the Lord. Be strong, O Joshua, son of Jehozadak, the high priest. Be strong, all you people of the land, declares the Lord. Work, for I am with you, declares the Lord of hosts.

books.name: Zechariah
books.description: Visions of restoration and the coming Messiah
books.author: Zechariah

chaptersContent.title: Call to Return
chaptersContent.summary: God calls His people to return to Him
chaptersContent.content: Therefore say to them, Thus declares the Lord of hosts: Return to me, says the Lord of hosts, and I will return to you, says the Lord of hosts. Therefore thus says the Lord: I have returned to Jerusalem with mercy; my house shall be built in it, declares the Lord of hosts, and the measuring line shall be stretched out over Jerusalem.

chaptersContent.title: Vision of the Horns and Craftsmen
chaptersContent.summary: Vision of four horns and four craftsmen
chaptersContent.content: And I lifted my eyes and saw, and behold, four horns! And I said to the angel who talked with me, 'What are these?' And he said to me, 'These are the horns that have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.'

chaptersContent.title: Joshua the High Priest
chaptersContent.summary: Vision of Joshua the high priest and the Branch
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said to Satan, 'The Lord rebuke you, O Satan! The Lord who has chosen Jerusalem rebuke you! Is not this a brand plucked from the fire?' And I will remove the iniquity of this land in a single day.

chaptersContent.title: Vision of the Golden Lampstand
chaptersContent.summary: Vision of the lampstand and two olive trees
chaptersContent.content: Then he said to me, 'This is the word of the Lord to Zerubbabel: Not by might, nor by power, but by my Spirit, says the Lord of hosts. Who are you, O great mountain? Before Zerubbabel you shall become a plain.'

chaptersContent.title: Vision of the Flying Scroll
chaptersContent.summary: Vision of a flying scroll and woman in a basket
chaptersContent.content: Then he said to me, 'This is the curse that goes out over the face of the whole land. For everyone who steals shall be cleaned out according to what is on one side, and everyone who swears falsely shall be cleaned out according to what is on the other side.'

chaptersContent.title: Vision of the Four Chariots
chaptersContent.summary: Vision of four chariots and the crowning of Joshua
chaptersContent.content: And the angel answered me, 'These are going out to the four winds of heaven, after presenting themselves before the Lord of all the earth. Behold, the man whose name is the Branch: for he shall branch out from his place, and he shall build the temple of the Lord.'

chaptersContent.title: Question About Fasting
chaptersContent.summary: People ask about fasting and God's response
chaptersContent.content: Say to all the people of the land and the priests, 'When you fasted and mourned in the fifth month and in the seventh, for these seventy years, was it for me that you fasted? Render true judgments, show kindness and mercy to one another.'

chaptersContent.title: God's Promises to Jerusalem
chaptersContent.summary: God's promises of restoration and blessing
chaptersContent.content: Thus says the Lord: I have returned to Zion and will dwell in the midst of Jerusalem, and Jerusalem shall be called the faithful city, and the mountain of the Lord of hosts, the holy mountain. These are the things that you shall do: Speak the truth to one another.

chaptersContent.title: The King on a Donkey
chaptersContent.summary: Prophecy of the Messiah coming humbly on a donkey
chaptersContent.content: Rejoice greatly, O daughter of Zion! Shout aloud, O daughter of Jerusalem! Behold, your king is coming to you; righteous and having salvation is he, humble and mounted on a donkey, on a colt, the foal of a donkey. I will cut off the chariot from Ephraim and the war horse from Jerusalem; and the battle bow shall be cut off, and he shall speak peace to the nations.

chaptersContent.title: The Lord Will Save His People
chaptersContent.summary: God's promise to save and restore His people
chaptersContent.content: Ask rain from the Lord in the season of the spring rain, from the Lord who makes the storm clouds, and he will give them showers of rain, to everyone the vegetation in the field. I will strengthen the house of Judah, and I will save the house of Joseph.

chaptersContent.title: The Good Shepherd Rejected
chaptersContent.summary: Prophecy of the rejection of the good shepherd
chaptersContent.content: So I became the shepherd of the flock doomed to slaughter, for the sheep merchants. And I took two staffs, one I named Favor, the other I named Union. And I tended the sheep. And they weighed out as my wages thirty pieces of silver.

chaptersContent.title: Jerusalem's Deliverance
chaptersContent.summary: God's deliverance of Jerusalem from her enemies
chaptersContent.content: The burden of the word of the Lord concerning Israel: Thus declares the Lord, who stretched out the heavens and founded the earth and formed the spirit of man within him. And I will pour out on the house of David and the inhabitants of Jerusalem a spirit of grace and pleas for mercy.

chaptersContent.title: Cleansing from Sin
chaptersContent.summary: Cleansing from sin and the striking of the shepherd
chaptersContent.content: On that day there shall be a fountain opened for the house of David and the inhabitants of Jerusalem, to cleanse them from sin and uncleanness. Awake, O sword, against my shepherd, against the man who stands next to me, declares the Lord of hosts.

chaptersContent.title: The Day of the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: The final Day of the Lord and God's reign
chaptersContent.content: On that day his feet shall stand on the Mount of Olives that is before Jerusalem on the east, and the Mount of Olives shall be split in two from east to west by a very wide valley. And the Lord will be king over all the earth. On that day the Lord will be one and his name one.

books.name: Malachi
books.description: The final Old Testament prophet's call to faithfulness
books.author: Malachi

chaptersContent.title: God's Love for Israel
chaptersContent.summary: God declares His love for Israel despite their questioning
chaptersContent.content: I have loved you, says the Lord. But you say, 'How have you loved us?' Is not Esau Jacob's brother? declares the Lord. Yet I have loved Jacob but Esau I have hated. A son honors his father, and a servant his master. If then I am a father, where is my honor? And if I am a master, where is my fear? says the Lord of hosts to you, O priests, who despise my name.

chaptersContent.title: Unfaithfulness in Marriage and Worship
chaptersContent.summary: God condemns unfaithfulness in marriage and worship
chaptersContent.content: Have we not all one Father? Has not one God created us? Why then are we faithless to one another, profaning the covenant of our fathers? Because the Lord was witness between you and the wife of your youth, to whom you have been faithless, though she is your companion and your wife by covenant. For the man who does not love his wife but divorces her, says the Lord, the God of Israel, covers his garment with violence, says the Lord of hosts.

chaptersContent.title: Tithing and God's Blessing
chaptersContent.summary: God challenges His people to test Him in tithing
chaptersContent.content: Will man rob God? Yet you are robbing me. But you say, 'How have we robbed you?' In your tithes and contributions. Bring the full tithe into the storehouse, that there may be food in my house. And thereby put me to the test, says the Lord of hosts, if I will not open the windows of heaven for you and pour down for you a blessing until there is no more need.

chaptersContent.title: Elijah's Return
chaptersContent.summary: Promise of Elijah's return before the Day of the Lord
chaptersContent.content: But for you who fear my name, the sun of righteousness shall rise with healing in its wings. You shall go out leaping like calves from the stall. Behold, I will send you Elijah the prophet before the great and awesome day of the Lord comes. And he will turn the hearts of fathers to their children and the hearts of children to their fathers, lest I come and strike the land with a decree of utter destruction.

books.name: Matthew
books.description: The Gospel presenting Jesus as the promised Messiah and King
books.author: Matthew

chaptersContent.title: The Genealogy and Birth of Jesus
chaptersContent.summary: Matthew traces Jesus' lineage and recounts His virgin birth
chaptersContent.content: The book of the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham. She will bear a son, and you shall call his name Jesus, for he will save his people from their sins.

chaptersContent.title: The Visit of the Magi and Flight to Egypt
chaptersContent.summary: Wise men visit Jesus, and the family flees to Egypt
chaptersContent.content: Where is he who has been born king of the Jews? For we saw his star when it rose and have come to worship him. And going into the house, they saw the child with Mary his mother, and they fell down and worshiped him.

chaptersContent.title: John the Baptist Prepares the Way
chaptersContent.summary: John baptizes Jesus and the Spirit descends like a dove
chaptersContent.content: Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is at hand. I baptize you with water for repentance, but he who is coming after me is mightier than I. And a voice from heaven said, 'This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased.'

chaptersContent.title: Jesus' Temptation and Early Ministry
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus is tempted in the wilderness and begins His ministry
chaptersContent.content: But he answered, 'It is written, Man shall not live by bread alone, but by every word that comes from the mouth of God.' Then Jesus said to him, 'Be gone, Satan! For it is written, You shall worship the Lord your God.'

chaptersContent.title: The Sermon on the Mount - Beatitudes
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches the Beatitudes and principles of kingdom living
chaptersContent.content: Seeing the crowds, he went up on the mountain, and when he sat down, his disciples came to him. And he opened his mouth and taught them, saying: 'Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.'

chaptersContent.title: The Sermon on the Mount - Prayer and Fasting
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches about prayer, fasting, and heavenly treasures
chaptersContent.content: Pray then like this: Our Father in heaven, hallowed be your name. Do not lay up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust destroy and where thieves break in and steal. But seek first the kingdom of God and his righteousness.

chaptersContent.title: The Sermon on the Mount - Judging and Asking
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches about judging others and asking God
chaptersContent.content: Judge not, that you be not judged. Ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you. So whatever you wish that others would do to you, do also to them.

chaptersContent.title: Jesus Heals Many
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus performs various healing miracles
chaptersContent.content: And behold, a leper came to him and knelt before him, saying, 'Lord, if you will, you can make me clean.' The centurion replied, 'Lord, I am not worthy to have you come under my roof.'

chaptersContent.title: More Healings and Calling of Matthew
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus heals more people and calls Matthew the tax collector
chaptersContent.content: As Jesus passed on from there, he saw a man called Matthew sitting at the tax booth, and he said to him, 'Follow me.' And he rose and followed him. Go and learn what this means: I desire mercy, and not sacrifice.

chaptersContent.title: The Twelve Apostles Sent Out
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus sends out the twelve apostles with instructions
chaptersContent.content: These twelve Jesus sent out, instructing them, 'Go nowhere among the Gentiles and enter no town of the Samaritans, but go rather to the lost sheep of the house of Israel.' Behold, I am sending you out as sheep in the midst of wolves.

chaptersContent.title: John's Question and Jesus' Response
chaptersContent.summary: John questions Jesus and Jesus praises John
chaptersContent.content: Are you the one who is to come, or shall we look for another? Truly, I say to you, among those born of women there has arisen no one greater than John the Baptist. Come to me, all who labor and are heavy laden.

chaptersContent.title: Jesus and the Sabbath
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus defends His Sabbath actions and warns against blasphemy
chaptersContent.content: For the Son of Man is lord of the Sabbath. Whoever is not with me is against me, and whoever does not gather with me scatters. For whoever does the will of my Father in heaven is my brother and sister and mother.

chaptersContent.title: Parables of the Kingdom
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches about the kingdom through parables
chaptersContent.content: And he told them many things in parables, saying: 'A sower went out to sow.' The kingdom of heaven is like a grain of mustard seed that a man took and sowed in his field. The kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field.

chaptersContent.title: John Beheaded and Jesus Feeds 5000
chaptersContent.summary: John is executed and Jesus miraculously feeds the multitude
chaptersContent.content: When he went ashore he saw a great crowd, and he had compassion on them and healed their sick. And they all ate and were satisfied. And they took up twelve baskets full of the broken pieces left over.

chaptersContent.title: Tradition and the Canaanite Woman
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus addresses tradition and heals a Canaanite woman's daughter
chaptersContent.content: This people honors me with their lips, but their heart is far from me. It is not what goes into the mouth that defiles a person, but what comes out of the mouth; this defiles a person.

chaptersContent.title: Peter's Confession
chaptersContent.summary: Peter declares Jesus as the Christ, the Son of the living God
chaptersContent.content: Simon Peter replied, 'You are the Christ, the Son of the living God.' And Jesus answered him, 'Blessed are you, Simon Bar-Jonah! For flesh and blood has not revealed this to you, but my Father who is in heaven.'

chaptersContent.title: The Transfiguration
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus is transfigured on the mountain with Moses and Elijah
chaptersContent.content: And he was transfigured before them, and his face shone like the sun, and his clothes became white as light. This is my beloved Son, with whom I am well pleased; listen to him.

chaptersContent.title: The Greatest in the Kingdom
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches about humility and forgiveness
chaptersContent.content: Truly, I say to you, unless you turn and become like children, you will never enter the kingdom of heaven. If your brother sins against you, go and tell him his fault, between you and him alone.

chaptersContent.title: Marriage and Divorce
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches about marriage, divorce, and celibacy
chaptersContent.content: So they are no longer two but one flesh. What therefore God has joined together, let not man separate. Let the little children come to me and do not hinder them, for to such belongs the kingdom of heaven.

chaptersContent.title: Laborers in the Vineyard
chaptersContent.summary: Parable of workers and Jesus' third prediction of death
chaptersContent.content: So the last will be first, and the first last. It shall not be so among you. But whoever would be great among you must be your servant, and whoever would be first among you must be your slave.

chaptersContent.title: Triumphal Entry and Temple Cleansing
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus enters Jerusalem and cleanses the temple
chaptersContent.content: Say to the daughter of Zion, Behold, your king is coming to you, humble, and mounted on a donkey, and on a colt, the foal of a beast of burden. Hosanna to the Son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!

chaptersContent.title: Parables and Questions
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus tells parables and answers challenging questions
chaptersContent.content: For many are called, but few are chosen. Therefore render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's. You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart.

chaptersContent.title: Woes to the Scribes and Pharisees
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus pronounces woes on religious leaders
chaptersContent.content: Whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted. Woe to you, scribes and Pharisees, hypocrites! For you tithe mint and dill and cumin. O Jerusalem, Jerusalem, how often would I have gathered your children.

chaptersContent.title: Signs of the End
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus predicts the destruction of the temple and end times
chaptersContent.content: And this gospel of the kingdom will be proclaimed throughout the whole world as a testimony to all nations, and then the end will come. For false christs and false prophets will arise and perform great signs and wonders.

chaptersContent.title: Parables of the Kingdom
chaptersContent.summary: Parables about readiness for the kingdom
chaptersContent.content: Watch therefore, for you know neither the day nor the hour. His master said to him, 'Well done, good and faithful servant. You have been faithful over a little; I will set you over much.'

chaptersContent.title: The Plot and Last Supper
chaptersContent.summary: Judas plots betrayal and Jesus shares the Last Supper
chaptersContent.content: Now as they were eating, Jesus took bread, and after blessing it broke it and gave it to the disciples, and said, 'Take, eat; this is my body.' This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many.

chaptersContent.title: Jesus' Trial and Crucifixion
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus is tried, crucified, and buried
chaptersContent.content: And about the ninth hour Jesus cried out with a loud voice, saying, 'Eli, Eli, lema sabachthani?' that is, 'My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?' And Jesus cried out again with a loud voice and yielded up his spirit.

chaptersContent.title: The Resurrection and Great Commission
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus rises from the dead and commissions His disciples
chaptersContent.content: He is not here, for he has risen, as he said. Come, see the place where he lay. Go therefore and make disciples of all nations, baptizing them in the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit.

books.name: Mark
books.description: The Gospel emphasizing Jesus as the suffering Servant
books.author: Mark

chaptersContent.title: The Beginning of the Gospel
chaptersContent.summary: John the Baptist prepares the way; Jesus is baptized and begins ministry
chaptersContent.content: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God. And a voice came from heaven, 'You are my beloved Son; with you I am well pleased.'

chaptersContent.title: The Beginning of the Gospel
chaptersContent.summary: John the Baptist prepares the way; Jesus is baptized and begins ministry
chaptersContent.content: The beginning of the gospel of Jesus Christ, the Son of God. And a voice came from heaven, 'You are my beloved Son; with you I am well pleased.'

chaptersContent.title: Choosing the Twelve
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus heals on the Sabbath and appoints the twelve apostles
chaptersContent.content: And he went up on the mountain and called to him those whom he desired, and they came to him. And he appointed twelve (whom he also named apostles) so that they might be with him and he might send them out to preach. For whoever does the will of God, he is my brother and sister and mother.

chaptersContent.title: The Parable of the Sower
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches in parables and explains the parable of the sower
chaptersContent.content: Listen! Behold, a sower went out to sow. And he said, 'He who has ears to hear, let him hear.' But those that were sown on the good soil are the ones who hear the word and accept it and bear fruit, thirtyfold and sixtyfold and a hundredfold.

chaptersContent.title: Jesus Heals and Raises from the Dead
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus heals a demon-possessed man and raises Jairus's daughter
chaptersContent.content: And he did not permit him but said to him, 'Go home to your friends and tell them how much the Lord has done for you, and how he has had mercy on you.' And he said to her, 'Daughter, your faith has made you well; go in peace, and be healed of your disease.' Taking her by the hand he said to her, 'Talitha cumi,' which means, 'Little girl, I say to you, arise.'

chaptersContent.title: Jesus Rejected and John Beheaded
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus is rejected in Nazareth and John the Baptist is executed
chaptersContent.content: Is not this the carpenter, the son of Mary and brother of James and Joses and Judas and Simon? And are not his sisters here with us?' And they took offense at him. And Jesus said to them, 'A prophet is not without honor, except in his hometown and among his relatives and in his own household.' And he said to them, 'Come away by yourselves to a desolate place and rest a while.'

chaptersContent.title: Tradition and the Heart
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches about true defilement and heals a Gentile woman's daughter
chaptersContent.content: And he said to them, 'Well did Isaiah prophesy of you hypocrites, as it is written, 'This people honors me with their lips, but their heart is far from me.' There is nothing outside a person that by going into him can defile him, but the things that come out of a person are what defile him.' But she answered him, 'Yes, Lord; yet even the dogs under the table eat the children's crumbs.'

chaptersContent.title: Peter's Confession and the Cross
chaptersContent.summary: Peter confesses Jesus as Christ; Jesus predicts His death
chaptersContent.content: And he asked them, 'But who do you say that I am?' Peter answered him, 'You are the Christ.' And calling the crowd to him with his disciples, he said to them, 'If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.'

chaptersContent.title: The Transfiguration and Discipleship
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus is transfigured and teaches about true greatness
chaptersContent.content: And after six days Jesus took with him Peter and James and John, and led them up a high mountain by themselves. And he was transfigured before them. And a cloud overshadowed them, and a voice came out of the cloud, 'This is my beloved Son; listen to him.' And he sat down and called the twelve. And he said to them, 'If anyone would be first, he must be last of all and servant of all.'

chaptersContent.title: Marriage, Riches, and Service
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches about marriage, wealth, and serving others
chaptersContent.content: But from the beginning of creation, 'God made them male and female.' And Jesus, looking at him, loved him, and said to him, 'You lack one thing: go, sell all that you have and give to the poor, and you will have treasure in heaven; and come, follow me.' For even the Son of Man came not to be served but to serve, and to give his life as a ransom for many.

chaptersContent.title: The Triumphal Entry and Temple Cleansing
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus enters Jerusalem and cleanses the temple
chaptersContent.content: And those who went before and those who followed were shouting, 'Hosanna! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord!' And he was teaching them and saying to them, 'Is it not written, 'My house shall be called a house of prayer for all the nations'? But you have made it a den of robbers.' And whenever you stand praying, forgive, if you have anything against anyone, so that your Father also who is in heaven may forgive you your trespasses.

chaptersContent.title: Teaching in the Temple
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus answers questions about taxes, resurrection, and the greatest commandment
chaptersContent.content: Jesus said to them, 'Render to Caesar the things that are Caesar's, and to God the things that are God's.' And they were amazed at him. For when they rise from the dead, they neither marry nor are given in marriage, but are like angels in heaven. And you shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your mind and with all your strength.

chaptersContent.title: Signs of the End
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus predicts the destruction of the temple and signs of the end
chaptersContent.content: And Jesus said to him, 'Do you see these great buildings? There will not be left here one stone upon another that will not be thrown down.' And you will be hated by all for my name's sake. But the one who endures to the end will be saved. Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.

chaptersContent.title: The Last Supper and Betrayal
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus institutes the Lord's Supper and is betrayed by Judas
chaptersContent.content: And as they were eating, he took bread, and after blessing it broke it and gave it to them, and said, 'Take; this is my body.' And he said to them, 'This is my blood of the covenant, which is poured out for many.' And he said, 'Abba, Father, all things are possible for you. Remove this cup from me. Yet not what I will, but what you will.'

chaptersContent.title: The Crucifixion
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus is crucified and dies on the cross
chaptersContent.content: And Pilate asked him, 'Are you the King of the Jews?' And he answered him, 'You have said so.' And at the ninth hour Jesus cried with a loud voice, 'Eloi, Eloi, lema sabachthani?' which means, 'My God, my God, why have you forsaken me?' And when the centurion, who stood facing him, saw that in this way he breathed his last, he said, 'Truly this man was the Son of God!'

chaptersContent.title: The Resurrection
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus rises from the dead and appears to His disciples
chaptersContent.content: And he said to them, 'Do not be alarmed. You seek Jesus of Nazareth, who was crucified. He has risen; he is not here. See the place where they laid him.' And he said to them, 'Go into all the world and proclaim the gospel to the whole creation.' And they went out and preached everywhere, while the Lord worked with them and confirmed the message by accompanying signs.

books.name: Luke
books.description: The Gospel emphasizing Jesus' humanity and compassion for all people
books.author: Luke

chaptersContent.title: The Birth of John and Jesus Foretold
chaptersContent.summary: Angel Gabriel announces the births of John the Baptist and Jesus
chaptersContent.content: And the angel answered her, 'The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you; therefore the child to be born will be called holythe Son of God.'

chaptersContent.title: The Birth of John and Jesus Foretold
chaptersContent.summary: Angel Gabriel announces the births of John the Baptist and Jesus
chaptersContent.content: And the angel answered her, 'The Holy Spirit will come upon you, and the power of the Most High will overshadow you; therefore the child to be born will be called holythe Son of God.'

chaptersContent.title: John the Baptist and Jesus' Baptism
chaptersContent.summary: John prepares the way and Jesus is baptized
chaptersContent.content: And he went into all the region around the Jordan, proclaiming a baptism of repentance for the forgiveness of sins. John answered them all, saying, 'I baptize you with water, but he who is mightier than I is coming, the strap of whose sandals I am not worthy to untie. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.'

chaptersContent.title: Jesus' Temptation and Ministry Begins
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus is tempted in the wilderness and begins His ministry
chaptersContent.content: And Jesus answered him, 'It is written, 'Man shall not live by bread alone.'' And Jesus answered him, 'It is written, 'You shall worship the Lord your God, and him only shall you serve.'' The Spirit of the Lord is upon me, because he has anointed me to proclaim good news to the poor. He has sent me to proclaim liberty to the captives and recovering of sight to the blind, to set at liberty those who are oppressed.

chaptersContent.title: Calling the Disciples and Healing
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus calls His first disciples and performs miracles
chaptersContent.content: But when Simon Peter saw it, he fell down at Jesus' knees, saying, 'Depart from me, for I am a sinful man, O Lord.' And when he saw their faith, he said, 'Man, your sins are forgiven you.' I have not come to call the righteous but sinners to repentance.

chaptersContent.title: The Sabbath and Choosing the Twelve
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus heals on the Sabbath and appoints the twelve apostles
chaptersContent.content: And Jesus said to them, 'I ask you, is it lawful on the Sabbath to do good or to do harm, to save life or to destroy it?' And when day came, he called his disciples and chose from them twelve, whom he named apostles. And as you wish that others would do to you, do so to them.

chaptersContent.title: Faith and Forgiveness
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus heals a centurion's servant and forgives a sinful woman
chaptersContent.content: When Jesus heard these things, he marveled at him, and turning to the crowd that followed him, said, 'I tell you, not even in Israel have I found such faith.' Therefore I tell you, her sins, which are many, are forgivenfor she loved much. But he who is forgiven little, loves little. And he said to the woman, 'Your faith has saved you; go in peace.'

chaptersContent.title: Parables and Miracles
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus tells parables and performs miracles
chaptersContent.content: And some fell into good soil and grew and yielded a hundredfold.' As he said these things, he called out, 'He who has ears to hear, let him hear.' And he said to them, 'Where is your faith?' And they were afraid, and they marveled, saying to one another, 'Who then is this, that he commands even winds and water, and they obey him?'

chaptersContent.title: The Twelve Sent Out and Peter's Confession
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus sends out the twelve and Peter confesses Him as Christ
chaptersContent.content: And he sent them out to proclaim the kingdom of God and to heal. Then he said to them all, 'If anyone would come after me, let him deny himself and take up his cross daily and follow me.'

chaptersContent.title: The Seventy-Two and the Good Samaritan
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus sends out seventy-two and tells the parable of the Good Samaritan
chaptersContent.content: And he said to them, 'The harvest is plentiful, but the laborers are few. Therefore pray earnestly to the Lord of the harvest to send out laborers into his harvest.' And he answered, 'You shall love the Lord your God with all your heart and with all your soul and with all your strength and with all your mind, and your neighbor as yourself.'

chaptersContent.title: Teaching on Prayer and Casting Out Demons
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches the Lord's Prayer and casts out demons
chaptersContent.content: And he said to them, 'When you pray, say: Father, hallowed be your name. Your kingdom come. And I tell you, ask, and it will be given to you; seek, and you will find; knock, and it will be opened to you. But if it is by the finger of God that I cast out demons, then the kingdom of God has come upon you.'

chaptersContent.title: Warnings and Encouragements
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus warns against hypocrisy and encourages trust in God
chaptersContent.content: Fear not; you are of more value than many sparrows. And he said to them, 'Take care, and be on your guard against all covetousness, for one's life does not consist in the abundance of his possessions.' Instead, seek his kingdom, and these things will be added to you.

chaptersContent.title: Repentance and the Kingdom
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus calls for repentance and describes the kingdom
chaptersContent.content: No, I tell you; but unless you repent, you will all likewise perish. Strive to enter through the narrow door. For many, I tell you, will seek to enter and will not be able. And behold, some are last who will be first, and some are first who will be last.

chaptersContent.title: Humility and the Cost of Discipleship
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches about humility and counting the cost
chaptersContent.content: For everyone who exalts himself will be humbled, and he who humbles himself will be exalted. And the master said to the servant, 'Go out to the highways and hedges and compel people to come in, that my house may be filled.' So therefore, any one of you who does not renounce all that he has cannot be my disciple.

chaptersContent.title: The Lost Sheep, Coin, and Son
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus tells three parables about God's joy over the repentant
chaptersContent.content: Just so, I tell you, there will be more joy in heaven over one sinner who repents than over ninety-nine righteous persons who need no repentance.

chaptersContent.title: The Rich Man and Lazarus
chaptersContent.summary: Parable about the rich man and poor Lazarus
chaptersContent.content: And he said to them, 'You are those who justify yourselves before men, but God knows your hearts. For what is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.' But Abraham said, 'Child, remember that you in your lifetime received your good things, and Lazarus in like manner bad things; but now he is comforted here, and you are in anguish.'

chaptersContent.title: Faith and Gratitude
chaptersContent.summary: Jesus teaches about faith and the ten lepers
chaptersContent.content: And the Lord said, 'If you had faith like a grain of mustard seed, you could say to this mulberry tree, 'Be uprooted and planted in the sea,' and it would obey you.'
