chaptersContent.summary: Warning about false teachers and their destruction
chaptersContent.content: But false prophets also arose among the people, just as there will be false teachers among you, who will secretly bring in destructive heresies, even denying the Master who bought them, bringing upon themselves swift destruction. Then the Lord knows how to rescue the godly from trials, and to keep the unrighteous under punishment until the day of judgment.

chaptersContent.title: The Day of the Lord
chaptersContent.summary: The promise of Christ's return and new heavens and earth
chaptersContent.content: The Lord is not slow to fulfill his promise as some count slowness, but is patient toward you, not wishing that any should perish, but that all should reach repentance. But the day of the Lord will come like a thief, and then the heavens will pass away with a roar, and the heavenly bodies will be burned up and dissolved, and the earth and the works that are done on it will be exposed.

books.name: 1 John
books.description: Fellowship with God through love and obedience
books.author: John

chaptersContent.title: Walking in the Light
chaptersContent.summary: Fellowship with God requires walking in the light
chaptersContent.content: This is the message we have heard from him and proclaim to you, that God is light, and in him is no darkness at all. But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus his Son cleanses us from all sin.

chaptersContent.title: The New Commandment
chaptersContent.summary: John teaches about sin, propitiation, and loving one another
chaptersContent.content: My little children, I am writing these things to you so that you may not sin. But if anyone does sin, we have an advocate with the Father, Jesus Christ the righteous. He is the propitiation for our sins, and not for ours only but also for the sins of the whole world.

chaptersContent.title: God's Love and Our Love
chaptersContent.summary: Understanding and practicing God's love
chaptersContent.content: See what kind of love the Father has given to us, that we should be called children of God; and so we are. By this we know love, that he laid down his life for us, and we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers.

chaptersContent.title: God is Love
chaptersContent.summary: The nature and importance of love
chaptersContent.content: Anyone who does not love does not know God, because God is love. So we have come to know and to believe the love that God has for us. God is love, and whoever abides in love abides in God, and God abides in him.

chaptersContent.title: Assurance of Eternal Life
chaptersContent.summary: Confidence in eternal life through faith in Christ
chaptersContent.content: And this is the testimony, that God gave us eternal life, and this life is in his Son. I write these things to you who believe in the name of the Son of God, that you may know that you have eternal life.

books.name: 2 John
books.description: John's letter about truth and love in Christian fellowship
books.author: John

chaptersContent.title: Walking in Truth and Love
chaptersContent.summary: John emphasizes the importance of truth and love, warning against false teachers
chaptersContent.content: I rejoiced greatly to find some of your children walking in the truth, just as we were commanded by the Father. And this is love, that we walk according to his commandments; this is the commandment, just as you have heard from the beginning, so that you should walk in it.

books.name: 3 John
books.description: John's letter about hospitality and church leadership
books.author: John

chaptersContent.title: Gaius's Hospitality
chaptersContent.summary: John commends Gaius for his hospitality and warns against Diotrephes
chaptersContent.content: I have no greater joy than to hear that my children are walking in the truth. Beloved, do not imitate evil but imitate good. Whoever does good is from God; whoever does evil has not seen God.

books.name: Jude
books.description: Jude's urgent letter about contending for the faith
books.author: Jude

chaptersContent.title: Contend for the Faith
chaptersContent.summary: Jude urges believers to contend for the faith against false teachers
chaptersContent.content: Beloved, although I was very eager to write to you about our common salvation, I found it necessary to write appealing to you to contend for the faith that was once for all delivered to the saints. Now to him who is able to keep you from stumbling and to present you blameless before the presence of his glory with great joy.

books.name: Revelation
books.description: John's apocalyptic vision of the end times and Christ's return
books.author: John

chaptersContent.title: The Revelation of Jesus Christ
chaptersContent.summary: John introduces his vision of the glorified Christ
chaptersContent.content: The revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave him to show to his servants the things that must soon take place. 'I am the Alpha and the Omega,' says the Lord God, 'who is and who was and who is to come, the Almighty.'

chaptersContent.title: Letters to the Seven Churches - Ephesus and Smyrna
chaptersContent.summary: Christ's letters to the churches in Ephesus and Smyrna
chaptersContent.content: But I have this against you, that you have abandoned the love you had at first. Do not fear what you are about to suffer. Behold, the devil is about to throw some of you into prison, that you may be tested.

chaptersContent.title: Letters to the Seven Churches - Pergamum and Thyatira
chaptersContent.summary: Christ's letters to the churches in Pergamum and Thyatira
chaptersContent.content: Yet you have still a few names in Sardis, people who have not soiled their garments, and they will walk with me in white, for they are worthy. Behold, I stand at the door and knock.

chaptersContent.title: The Throne in Heaven
chaptersContent.summary: John sees God's throne in heaven surrounded by worship
chaptersContent.content: And the four living creatures, each of them with six wings, are full of eyes all around and within, and day and night they never cease to say, 'Holy, holy, holy, is the Lord God Almighty.'

chaptersContent.title: The Scroll and the Lamb
chaptersContent.summary: The Lamb is found worthy to open the sealed scroll
chaptersContent.content: And one of the elders said to me, 'Weep no more; behold, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has conquered, so that he can open the scroll and its seven seals.'

chaptersContent.title: The Seven Seals
chaptersContent.summary: The first six seals are opened, bringing judgment
chaptersContent.content: And I looked, and behold, a white horse! And its rider had a bow, and a crown was given to him, and he came out conquering, and to conquer. And out came another horse, bright red.

chaptersContent.title: The 144,000 and the Great Multitude
chaptersContent.summary: The sealing of the 144,000 and the great multitude in white
chaptersContent.content: And I heard the number of the sealed, 144,000, sealed from every tribe of the sons of Israel. After this I looked, and behold, a great multitude that no one could number, from every nation.

chaptersContent.title: The Seventh Seal and the Trumpets
chaptersContent.summary: The seventh seal is opened and the first four trumpets sound
chaptersContent.content: When the Lamb opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour. Then I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and seven trumpets were given to them.

chaptersContent.title: The Fifth and Sixth Trumpets
chaptersContent.summary: The fifth and sixth trumpets bring locust and army judgments
chaptersContent.content: They were told not to harm the grass of the earth or any green plant or any tree, but only those people who do not have the seal of God on their foreheads. And in those days people will seek death and will not find it.

chaptersContent.title: The Angel and the Little Scroll
chaptersContent.summary: A mighty angel with a little scroll appears
chaptersContent.content: And when the seven thunders had sounded, I was about to write, but I heard a voice from heaven saying, 'Seal up what the seven thunders have said, and do not write it down.'

chaptersContent.title: The Two Witnesses
chaptersContent.summary: Two witnesses prophesy and are killed, then resurrected
chaptersContent.content: And I will grant authority to my two witnesses, and they will prophesy for 1,260 days, clothed in sackcloth. And when they have finished their testimony, the beast that rises from the bottomless pit will make war on them.

chaptersContent.title: The Woman and the Dragon
chaptersContent.summary: A woman gives birth to a child while a dragon waits to devour
chaptersContent.content: And a great sign appeared in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet, and on her head a crown of twelve stars. She was pregnant and was crying out in birth pains.

chaptersContent.title: The Beast from the Sea and Earth
chaptersContent.summary: Two beasts arise to deceive and persecute God's people
chaptersContent.content: And I saw a beast rising out of the sea, with ten horns and seven heads, with ten diadems on its horns and blasphemous names on its heads. And all who dwell on earth will worship it.

chaptersContent.title: The Lamb and the 144,000
chaptersContent.summary: The Lamb stands with the 144,000 and angels proclaim judgment
chaptersContent.content: Then I looked, and behold, on Mount Zion stood the Lamb, and with him 144,000 who had his name and his Father's name written on their foreheads. And I heard a voice from heaven like the roar of many waters.

chaptersContent.title: The Seven Bowls of God's Wrath
chaptersContent.summary: Seven angels prepare to pour out God's final judgments
chaptersContent.content: Then I saw another sign in heaven, great and amazing, seven angels with seven plagues, which are the last, for with them the wrath of God is finished. And the sanctuary was filled with smoke.

chaptersContent.title: The Seven Bowls of Wrath
chaptersContent.summary: The seven bowls of God's wrath are poured out
chaptersContent.content: Then I heard a loud voice from the temple telling the seven angels, 'Go and pour out on the earth the seven bowls of the wrath of God.' And the first angel went and poured out his bowl on the earth.

chaptersContent.title: The Great Prostitute and the Beast
chaptersContent.summary: John sees the great prostitute riding the scarlet beast
chaptersContent.content: Then one of the seven angels who had the seven bowls came and said to me, 'Come, I will show you the judgment of the great prostitute who is seated on many waters.'

chaptersContent.title: The Fall of Babylon
chaptersContent.summary: Babylon the great city falls and is destroyed
chaptersContent.content: And he called out with a mighty voice, 'Fallen, fallen is Babylon the great! She has become a dwelling place for demons, a haunt for every unclean spirit.'

chaptersContent.title: The Marriage Supper of the Lamb
chaptersContent.summary: Heaven rejoices at Babylon's fall and the Lamb's marriage
chaptersContent.content: After this I heard what seemed to be the loud voice of a great multitude in heaven, crying out, 'Hallelujah! Salvation and glory and power belong to our God.'

chaptersContent.title: The Thousand Years and Final Judgment
chaptersContent.summary: Satan is bound for a thousand years, then final judgment
chaptersContent.content: And he seized the dragon, that ancient serpent, who is the devil and Satan, and bound him for a thousand years. Blessed and holy is the one who shares in the first resurrection!

chaptersContent.title: The New Heaven and New Earth
chaptersContent.summary: God creates a new heaven and earth; the New Jerusalem descends
chaptersContent.content: Then I saw a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away, and the sea was no more. And he who was seated on the throne said, 'Behold, I am making all things new.'

chaptersContent.title: The River of Life and Final Words
chaptersContent.summary: The river of life flows and Christ gives final promises
chaptersContent.content: Then the angel showed me the river of the water of life, bright as crystal, flowing from the throne of God and of the Lamb through the middle of the street of the city.
